38906799.review: When I saw this game it reminded me of something ive played a looooong time ago... and when i saw the pixilated reference in the tutorial it hit me! This game was made by Lachsen and his crew - the same guy who developed the promising Velsarbor-Demo. 38895322.review: Pretty great game, it has fast paced combat, and a good mix of melee and ranged combat as well. The puzzles in the dungeons are actually pretty difficult and you have to do a bit of thinking and trial and error to get them right, which I personally love. This game overall is pretty challenging. The soundtrack is pretty excellent as well. As you level up, you can spend points in your skill tree, allowing you to upgrade your melee abilities, ranged abilities, or make your character have really strong defense. As you progress, you will also gain completely new skill trees based on the elemental power-ups you receive, giving the character customization quite a bit of depth. In it's current state, this game has quite a bit of content and I would recommend it even at full price, and especially if you do see it on sale.

38876532.review: 玩了7小时了，唯一的感受就是难，怪的动作太快了，根本反应不过来，单挑还好说，群殴简直头大。再有就是怪物等级设计。。等级低于自己的基本都是1经验，高于自己的打起来费劲的要死，还能不能好好玩耍了。。不过谜题设计还是非常不错，如果可以的话希望官方能推出难度选择。。。

38876226.review:
What..... neo-classical pixel art style with modern UI sensibilities and design conveniences?

A semi-mute protagonist with a semi-amnesiac backstory where the game tracks how many times you say "Hi!" ?!

Action RPG combat that actually tracks real-time positioning instead of stat/dice-rolls to determine hit???!!

A stand-out soundtrack (release that soundtrack as DLC please!) that locks it firmly into Nostalgia-land jRPG goodness while still being a Western style RPG that mimics MMORPG???!!! (OMGBBQROFL!)

I recommend this game.  (if you're curious about the low hr count, it's because I fell in love with it and stopped myself to dive in at 1.0 full release status).

38874511.review: I don't like doing reviews, but I found this game really obnoxious to play on PC. If you review videos you'll see people using advanced features like dash cancel jumping to extend jump distances, this is absolutely required in this game. The problem is on PC this is a really big pain to actually do. While I have an XBOX controller and I certainly could try this game with it on my PC, why should I have to bother? I enjoy the puzzles of this game, the RPG elements, the combat styles, but I absolutely hate the controls on PC. Why does it seem lately all games aren't designed for PC's? The answer is because they aren't. This game needs easier controls, it doesn't make the game more fun when I have to do triple cancel jumps, it just upsets me. As a result in its current state I give this game a 3/10.

38867131.review:
버전 0.9.8 기준 현재 나온 스토리 까지 다 했습니다. 이 게임은 갓겜이 맞습니다. 

빼어난 도트 그래픽은 물론이고, 속도감 있는 전투와 멋진 스킬 이펙트, 흥미진진한 스토리, 다양하고 재미있는 퍼즐들, 멋진 보스전이 여러분을 기다리고 있죠. 전 요번 한글화 때 구매를 했는데, 모 던전의 행태와 달리 한글화도 전문 업체에게 맡겨 정말 잘 되어 있습니다. 특정 아이템과 맵에 간간이 패러디도 있어서 깨알 재미도 있습니다.게임 내 트로피 획득 조건에 이런 패러디 아이템에 관한 것도 있죠. 또 현재 나온 스토리 까지 보았을 때 차후 스토리 및 다른 서브퀘스트를 어느정도 챙겨가며 한다면 평균 예상플레이 타임 40~60시간은 잡아야 할 정도로 방대한 게임시간을 선사할 수 있는 게임이라 생각합니다. 

 다만 모든 몹들에게 일정 패턴이 있어서 능력치로 찍어 누르지 않으면 무쌍이 조금 힘들다는 단점이 있습니다. 몹들마다 패턴 공략하는거 좋아하시는 분에겐 오히려 장점이 될 수도 있겠네요. 돈만 모아서 좋은 아이템을 살 순 없습니다. 돈 뿐만이 아니라 그에 필요한 아이템이 있어야 하기 때문에 몹을 연속으로 계속 잡아 랭크를 올려 아이템을 파밍하거나, 맵에 존재하는 식물들을 통한 노가다가 조금 강제되는 경향이 있습니다. 또 퍼즐이 과하게 많다는 생각도 듭니다. 던전 안의 퍼즐들 뿐만 아니라 일반 맵에도 퍼즐이 엄청 많기 때문이죠. 게임 내 요소에 분명 퍼즐이 있기 때문에 무슨 문제가 되냐 싶겠습니다만, 문제는 퍼즐에 대한 힌트가 그다지 없다는 겁니다. 던전안의 퍼즐들은 맵 바닥에 표시가 되있는 등 간접적으로나마 힌트가 주어져 있는데, 일반 필드에선 힌트가 일절 없습니다. 그런데 이런 맵의 퍼즐을 이용하는 서브 퀘스트도 있기 때문에 퀘스트를 함에 있어 애로사항이 꽃핍니다. 아직 대중화된 게임이 아니라 공략도 없기 떄문에, 퍼즐 싫어하거나 잘 못하시는 분들은 불호가 될 수 있는 부분이라 생각합니다.

이런 요인을 감안하더라도 장점이 충분히 단점을 커버하고도 남기 때문에, 충분히 좋은 게임이라 생각합니다. 지금 할인중이지만 정가에 사도 충분히 후회없을거라 생각합니다. 1기가의 반도 안되는 착한 용량에 몇십시간의 볼륨과 훌륭한 도트들, 정말 멋지지 않으십니까? 강추합니다. 꼭 사세요. 꼭 사세요. 중요하니까 두번 적었습니다.

38865530.review:
先说优点：
游戏模式设计很有新意，剧情也不错，虽然比较粗糙，但也感觉到制作者想做一款好游戏的心意。
美术风格与传统2D游戏（比如塞尔达）比较像，本人比较喜欢这种风格。
接着缺点：
手柄操作体验十分糟糕，操作起来很别扭，而且游戏难度很高（可能是我手残，但自我感觉操作还可以）。
令我十分反感的是要专门刷怪来提升等级，个人玩单机就是不想重复刷等级或者怪之类的。
怪的血量和伤害偏高，而且攻击速度很快对反应要求严格，一个13级和15级的任务打boss要各费30分钟。
另外一个十分致命的缺点是游戏的光影效果很糟糕，你基本分不清高度但是游戏里充满高低落差的地形（虽然这十分有趣），一次看错以为在同一个平面的掉落又要重新跳跃，令人烦躁。

虽然玩了10个小时，我才到了雪村，糟糕的操作体验和美术光影效果让我中途放弃了这个游戏。游戏没有完成，基于我的体验还有现在的情况我给了差评，真的不建议入手，可能游戏以后完成打我脸，我也希望能打我脸毕竟这个游戏的设计真的不错。
38865530.developer_response: 感谢您对游戏的肯定，至于游戏一些需要刷的地方，有的是为了增加探索的乐趣，而对于高度差的这一点，您提的建议非常好，我们会努力改进的。如果您有更多的问题，也欢迎您多多提出和我们交流，非常感谢！

38638984.review:
私はこのゲームを面白いと思いますがオススメはしません
少なくとも正規版にイージーモードが搭載されてから買うべきだと思います。
このゲームは高難易度アクションパズルRPGです。
求められるアクションの難易度が高くパズルが多い為ゲーム初心者や楽に爽快感のあるアクションを求めている人には向かないゲームとなっています。
これは洞窟物語を鼻歌交じりでクリアしたり100万回死んで覚えるゲームを楽しめる変態かドＭさんの為のゲームです。

ゲームの要点だけまとめると
回復アイテムの使用に時間がかかるため基本的に回復は出来ない
ダメージを与えられる方向が決まった敵or無敵時間を持つ敵が複数おり頭を使わないと倒せない
マップはパルクールを基本にしており様々な所へ登ったり出来るがわかりずらい
ゲーム内の敵とＰｖＰをするとき５回勝利しないとダメややたらとパズルが多くてくどい
ドットで描かれるキャラが素敵
自分で調整したスキルツリーで技を選んだりして戦えるので面白い
ドットハックみたいなストーリー
といった所でしょうか

面白いゲームですが楽しいゲームではないのでそこだけは覚悟して初めてください

38625903.review:
Very few studios manage to create new game concepts and ideas and even fewer manage to implement it successfully. CrossCode is a shining example of new experiences which are both fun and has huge potential to be a timeless classic. 16-bit offline MMORPG with a compelling story and charecters?? Genius. 

- The gameplay is fast-paced (think Ys games) and decently challenging. 
- The puzzles and enemy designs are really impressive. Has a surprising amount of platforming for a 2.5D game like this and its impressive that they have made it very fluid and natural.
- Skill trees are complex with each element (fire, earth, ice etc etc) having its own subtrees.
- Side quests are super fun and rewarding to say the least.

For me, the most impressive thing about this game was that i never got bored even for a single minute. MMORPG kinda games have that tendency to be slow and draggy at the beginning but this game had no such problems! Great job!

38617986.review: I haven't played this game since December of 2015, but my love for it is still strong, if not stronger as it has developed over these two years.

38614430.review:
This one comes absolutely recommended! Not only is it available for quite cheap (and they don't intend to up the price when finished, from their description), but it also comes with a free demo. If you're not sure on it, go try out that demo! If nothing else, grab the game when it's on sale.

Pros:
Excellent and consistent graphics style.
Very catchy music.
Lea is just adorable.
Gameplay feels fluid, responsive and fair.

Cons:
Not many, save for the difficulty as you progress starting to ramp up very noticeably. It could be that I'm simply not an expert on how to use skills to my advantage, however. The only thing I could consider 'controller-breaking' worthy is a challenge that is not necessary to complete the game.

And it offers that in multiple, also optional challenges. And that entire quest in itself is optional.

38610024.review:
This one is a real doozy. Fast paced with slight hack and slash mechanics and old school SNES/GBA gameplay. Reminded me of Golden Sun from GBA with the only difference being the combat system where Golden Sun is turn based, tactics while this is a melee/ranged fighter with button mashing elements.

All is not so easy though. The mobs are actually tough and the level 4's can outnumber and kill you outright if you don't dodge stuff properly. Game has a polished feel and a stunning soundtrack. There are a number of areas and quests that haven't been released yet but I would recommend this 10/10 to buy on the Winter Sale. 

Support these devs. They deserve it!

38766677.review:
평가 삭제로 다시 작성합니다.

본 게임은 액션 + RPG + 퍼즐이 결합된 장르인데요, 현재 얼리액세스로 개발 진행중에 있습니다. 2만원이라는 착한 가격에도 불구하고 무려 30시간에서 길게는 45시간 정도 되는 플레이타임이 확보되어있고 공식적으로 한글화를 지원하고 있습니다.(유저제작 한글화이긴 하지만) AAA게임이 대략 40~100시간 남짓의 볼륨이란 것을 감안하면 500mb 밖에 되지 않는 용량으로 놀라울 정도로 많은 분량과 제작 완성도를 보여주는 게임입니다.


-퍼즐-
 일부 게임들이 RPG에 퍼즐을 소소하게 결합되어서 큰 틀에서는 영향이 없는 일종의 서브컨텐츠라면 이 게임에서는 굉장한 비중을 차지합니다. 숨겨진 요소(던전, 보스, 아이템 등등)를 찾기 위해 필요한 것은 물론 보스와의 전투에는 매우 흔히 보입니다. 심지어 일반 필드에서도 퍼즐요소가 가득해서 퍼즐을 풀어야만 다음 맵으로 넘어갈 수 있는 경우도 다반사입니다. 그만큼 비중이 높지요. 난이도 조절은 적절하면서도 어려운 편이라 몇번 실패하더라도 결국에는 지나갈 수 있도록 설계가 되어있더라구요. 개인적으로 퍼즐 극혐하는데도, 만족하면서 다음은 무엇일까 하는 기대감으로 즐겼습니다. 

-액션-
왠지 퍼즐 중심이라서 액션과 RPG요소가 겉절이 하듯 대충 버무려져있는 것이 아닐까 하시겠지만, 생각외로 꽤나 깊이가 있고 완성도가 높습니다. 굉장히 호흡이 빠르고 쉴틈이 없습니다. 시각적 및 청각적 만족감도 굉장히 높아서 타격음도 훌륭하고 타격 시 화면 흔들림이나 연출 등이 뛰어납니다. 장인정신으로 찍어내서 고티어 스킬은 "와 도트 그리느라 진짜 손이 남아나질 않았겠다" 싶은 이펙트들도 추가되구요.

 전투와 관련해서는 몬스터들의 AI와 이동속도가 굉장히 좋은데다 공격력도 위력적인 편이고 거기다 초저렙 구간만 지나가도 귀찮은 패턴으로 무장한 몬스터들이 등장하기 시작합니다.  
만약 근거리 공격을 해온다면 굉장히 속도가 빠르거나 유도성을 지니고 있거나 아니면 굉장히 데미지가 높게 책정되어있습니다. 만약 원거리 공격을 해온다면 부메랑처럼 경로가 변경되거나 탄막형태로 퍼지거나 혹은 유도성을 지니거나 폭탄처럼 터저서 범위 공격을 해옵니다.
 체력도 꽤 높은 편이고 심지어 전면 무적이거나 속성 저항력은 어느시점부터 기본적으로 깔고나오다보니 속성을 맞게 상대해주지 않으면 전투력이 급감하기도 합니다.

문제는 이런 흉악한 놈들이 무려 "일반 몬스터"이고 보스급 몬스터들은 더더욱 뼈저리고 고약한 패턴이 중심이 됩니다. 그런 와중에도 짧은 순간만 딜 타임이 허용되는데 이때를 놓치면 또 더러운 콤보 한 세트를 요리조리 잘 피해야합니다. 체력량은 생각보다 많지 않아서 1/3씩 1/4씩 깎아내지만 이놈들의 체력이 낮아지면 2페이즈 3페이즈로 진입하면서 위력적인 패턴이 하니씩 추가됩니다. 정말 이런 류 게임을 통달하신 분들이 아니라면 최소 한번은 죽을 수 밖에 없을 정도로요.

개인적으로 액션 부분에서 유일한 단점이라면, 공격방식인데. 
캐릭터에 가깝게 클릭하면 근접공격, 그 범위를 넘어서면 원거리 공격으로 나갑니다만 이게 꽤 헷갈립니다. 특히 스킬은 스페이스바 하나로 사용하는데 원거리 근거리 따져서 써야하는데 정신없어서 정말 숙련 되기 전까지 근거리 스킬만 쓰거나 원거리 스킬만 쓰게 되더라구요. 물론 숙달되거나 이런 류의 컨트롤에 자신 있으신 분들은 문제 없을거라 봐요.


-RPG-
2000년대 후반에 유행했던 MMORPG와 "완전" 똑같습니다. 정말로 똑같아요. 너무 잘 만들어져서 저는 이게 온라인 게임으로 나와야 하는거 아닌가 하고 갸웃 했을 정도로요.
처음에 도착하는 초보자 마을에서만 퀘스트가 거의 열댓개 되는데다가 마을마다 거의 이정도 분량의 퀘스트가 존재합니다.
 물론 RPG게임이다보니 대부분 "무엇을 죽여라 무엇을 가져와라"가 중심이지만 몇몇은 흥미롭거나 재밌는 퀘스트도 등장합니다. 캐릭터 레벨스케일링도 잘되어있어서 레벨이 오르다보면 캐릭터 성장하는게 느껴집니다.  장비도 레벨마다 확실한 차이가 있어서 성능과 효과를 느낄수 있지만 상기했다시피 몬스터들의 AI가 높아서 몬스터를 공략할줄 모르면 여전히 어렵게 느껴질겁니다.
스탯은 자동으로 상승하지만, 스킬은 자기가 원하는데로 입력 가능한데요. 기본 무속성부터 시작해서 화염, 얼음, 전기, 파동 4가지 속성이 있는데, 각 속성마다 또 스킬포인트가 따로 주어져서 원하는데로 찍을수 있습니다.

RPG이다 보니 동료도 중요한 요소인데요. 장비를 채워주거나 할수 없지만, 얘네들이 엄청나게 잘 싸웁니다. 유저보다 더 잘싸워요. AI가 엄청 좋아서 약점을 공략해 잡아버리거나 경직 패턴을 골라서 극딜 넣거나 하는 모습도 보여줍니다. 유저가 어그로 끌어주면 후방에서 열심히 패주고 자기가 어그로 끌리면 도망다니면서 유저가 팰수 있는 시간을 벌어준다던가 피가 없으면 도망가서 회복하고 오는 등 싱글게임인데도 불구하고 플레이어와 함께하고 있다는 착각이 들 만큼 잘싸웁니다.


-시스템,인터페이스,Etc 등등..-
인터페이스가 깔끔하구요. 폰트도 글자를 알아보기 쉽게 되어있으면서 자동저장이나 빠른이동, 스킬초기화 등 유저편의를 위해 노력한 부분이 곳곳에 보입니다. 게임 자체가 엄청 게임 메커니즘을 잘 아는 사람들이 만들었구나 하는 생각이 들 정도입니다. 예를 들어 식물도 중요한 파밍요소인데 이 식물을 일정개수 이상 부수면 무슨 아이템이 몇퍼센트 확률로 무슨나무를 부쉈을때 드랍되는지 주로 어떤 지형에서 등장하는지 힌트도 나오구요. 백과사전을 찾아보면 캐릭터나 몬스터의 이름과 모양은 물론 저항력이나 체력 공격력 등도 표기되어있고 여태까지 잡은 횟수 등 세세한 정보 알려주는 등 도트가 지난 시대의 유산이라는 느낌이 안 들만큼 세련됐다는게 느껴집니다.


-평가-

퍼즐 좋아하시는 분들에겐 강추, 2000년대 중후반 주름잡았던 라그나로크를 위시한 MMORPG의 향수를 느끼고 싶은 분들이나 도트게임을 좋아하시는 분들에겐 100점 만점의 게임이 될겁니다.
도트게임이나 퍼즐 게임도 크게 좋아하지 않았던 제가  인생게임 탑 10안에 이 게임을 자신있게 넣을 수 있게된 것도 다 그만한 이유가 있기 때문이겠죠. 죽기전에 한가지 소원이 있다면, 이 게임을 베이스로 온라인 RPG 게임이 나왔으면 하는겁니다.  진짜 온라인RPG로 나오면 갓겜 그 자체가 될거 같거든요.

38746963.review:
“I can’t say enough superlatives about it to be honest.” First time i read a review so spot-on.

I'm not use to write a review with few hours recorded in-game, but the amount of love put in this game force me to do so.
The wedding of a MMO universe ans story with the gameplay of SNES classic like secret of man mean one thing : This is a love letter to RPG games made by gamers for gamers.

A world so huge and elements implemented so cleverly can only means this game has tremendous potential. And it's still Early access !

I can probably go on and on, it wouldn't do this game justice. So do yourself a favor and give it a try.

38745328.review: 퍼즐식, 그리고 폰겜으로 영웅서기등 도트 rpg를 좋아했었다면 추천

38738327.review:
このゲームはアクションRPGではありません、風雲たけし城です。
最初の港町で欄干の上を歩いて行くというサブクエストがあるけれど、無駄にめんどくさい。わずかにアナログスティックがずれるだけで落下する。ナナメ移動なんてもってのほか。この時点で諦めて返金しておけばよかった。もし同じところで詰まって面倒だと感じたら即プレイを中止し返金請求した方がいい。この後これ以上に面倒で理不尽な妨害を受けるパズルばかり出てくる。全く楽しくない。
アクションRPGをしたいと思って買ったのに、パズルばっかりやらされる。そして妨害を受ける。細い足場を飛び越えて順番に踏んでいくところで、飛び越えた先の先、画面外から弾が飛んできて被弾、落下してやり直しになったところでプレイを止めてアンインストールした。これは難易度ではなく、ただの理不尽。

世界やキャラの設定もアクション部分も楽しめる。なのにパズル部分でイライラして全部台無しにされる。ホントもったいない。

38734416.review: 최고의 게임 할인 안한상태에서 구매해도 전혀 안아까움

38729553.review:
ゲームの内容についてはほかの方が触れているので、私が感じたことを。

・日本語訳が和ゲーと間違えるほどすごく良くできている
スカイリムなどの洋ゲーでありがちなクソ翻訳、女性キャラと男性キャラの語尾の統一（～～だ）などがありません。キャラによって語尾も変わり、ストーリーの内容もするっと頭に入ってくる、ギャグも理解できるから面白い。
こんなに完成度の高い日本語訳は見たことがないです。しかもゲーム中に誤訳を報告できる機能までついています。
因みに今までで一番完成度が高いと感じていた日本語訳はWITCHER 3です。

・見下ろし視点のドット絵でのジャンプアクション
ドット絵でなくともジャンプアクションというのはストレスがたまるものだと思います（マリオサンシャインなど...）。それなのにドット絵のジャンプアクション。いやだなぁと思ってプレイしてみたら、びっくりするほどストレスがありません。
空中での小回りがよく利くからなのでしょうか？とにかくストレスがたまりませんでした。

・絶妙な難易度
難易度について言われているようですが、絶妙ですごく楽しい難しさだと思います。因みに私は洞窟物語は全クリしましたが、あれはめっちゃ難しかったです。
私のゲームの腕前はというと、ダークソウル、東方など（ジャンルが違いますが）はクリアできません。聖剣伝説も途中でやめてしまいましたね。ロックマン2はワイリーまでは超頑張っていきましたが、そこが難しすぎて断念...と、このくらいです。
確かにロックマン2の一面もクリアできねーよ！という人には難しいかもしれませんが,,,そんな人はこのゲーム欲しくないですよね。

私はこのゲームを強くお勧めします！

38707808.review:
Mich hat die Demo so überzeugt, dass mir nichts anderes übrig blieb als mir das Game zu kaufen (auch wenn "nur" early access, aber es lohnt sich bereits jetzt)
Das Gamekonzept ist für ein mmo Liebhaber wie mich, einfach genial.
Die Welt ist liebevoll bis ins Detail gestaltet.
Was soll ich sagen, ich liebe das Kampfsystem, den Grafikstil, die Story, den Humor.
Es macht mich stolz, dass wir Deutschen immernoch ein fantastisches Game rausbringen können!
Props an das tulle Team was dahinter steckt! Freue mich schon auf den restlichen content.

38706150.review:
Der Rahmen in einem MMO zu sein und dann doch nicht ist sehr interessant. Auch bin ich froh über eine deutsche Übersetung, die scheinbar noch nicht abgeschlossen ist. Manchmal sehe ich auch ein paar Fehler wie das Buchstaben verdreht sind. Das Wort "nicht" z.B. ist dann mal "nicth" und einige Sätze sind nicht gramatikalisch korrekt. Einmal habe ich gesehen das wo "ihm" stehen sollte "im" stand. NPC Dialoge haben oft spontan in Konversation einen Wechsel zu englisch woran man sich erst gewöhnen muss.

Das Gemeplay ist dann natürlich wie in einem MMO. Das heißt Quests erledigen um Sachen für den Spielchara zu bekommen. Die Gebiete bieten einiges zu erforschen und es ist ebenfalls gut, dass die Monster nicht permanent im Kampfmodus sind. Da man sich beim Betreten neuer Gebiete definitiv in den Ortschaften neu ausrüsten soll. Währung bekommt man durch das Besiegen von Monstern oder den Verkauf von erntebaren Materialien und natürlich als Questbelohnung. 

Bis jetzt habe ich bis nach den ersten großen Dungeon gespielt. Dieser hat mir gut gefallen. Ich mag die Denkaufgaben bei denen die Lösung zumindest für mich nicht immer offensichtlich war.
Nur der Boss war vielleicht etwas unbalanciert oder ich war hier wirklich schon gut ausgerüstet und gelevelt. Die ersten beiden Phasen waren leicht und in der dritten war ich dann bei den ersten Versuchen durch diese Minenbomben so schnell erledigt worden. Ich wusste im ersten Moment nicht mal was mich getroffen hatte.

Als ich das Wüstengebiet dann erreicht habe war da wieder dieser Questgeber mit seiner Sonde. Auch die Art wie man das neue Gebiet erforscht lässt das Spiel in dem Punkt ein wenig formular wirken. Du erreichst ein neues Gebiet erforschst es und versorgst dich durch Aktivitäten wie Bäume und Büsche looten und Questen mit dem nötigen um die Ausrüstung zu verstärken. Das ist so ziemlich was ich vorher auch tat nur die Umgebung und Monster sind anders.

Die angedeutet Offenbarung über den Hintergrund von Lea als Spielerin in der MMO Welt fand ich etwas zu schnell abgehandelt. Es war hier mehr wie eine schnelle Erklärung für den Spieler und das Verhalten von Lea hat sich nach dieser Offenbarung nicht verändert. Man könnte meinen sie wäre ein wenig ernster danach oder würde irgendeine Veränderung im Verhalten zeigen.

Wenn die Avatare aus dieser Matiere bestehen und in der realen Welt existieren öffnet das in der Theorie irgendwie die Möglichkeit, dass der Avatar mit dem tatsächlichen "Spieler" dahinter interagieren könnte. Kommt ganz darauf an wie der Zugang in dem Spiel nach CrossWorlds funktioniert. Also wie die "Spieler" die Avatare steuern.  Es muss zumindest einen Grund geben warum das nicht einfach auf Basis einer virtuellen Realität funktionert.
Am Anfang dachte ich Lea sollte so eine Art künstlicher Intilligenz Prototyp sein und sie müsse daher die Sprache und alles lernen. 

Ach ja über die Charaktere. Ich finde man sollte "Monsieur Grashaar" zumindest in Bergen zu sehen bekommen, da dieser Level halber nicht zu weit von Lea entfernt gewesen zu sein scheint. (?) Ansonsten wäre der PVP auch nicht balanciert gewesen. Was ist mit dem passiert? Und der lila Typ aus dem Intro hat scheinbar vollkommen das Interesse verloren. Wo ist der geblieben? Und ich frage mich was es bringt Mitglied dieser Gilde zu sein.

Man sieht schon, dass dieses Spiel mein Interesse sehr geweckt hat. Also:
An dem Spiel wird wie ich sehe fleißig gearbeitet und (ich schätze durch den frühen Zugang) ist es auch preislich überraschend niedrig. Eine Empfehlung.

38590522.review:
So far, an EXCELLENT 16-bit action adventure.  Granted, I am waiting until the full release to give a proper runthrough, but the potential in the upgrades systems, the smart puzzle mechanics, and the quirky but endearing storyline are already intact for the short time I've played.  I normally don't vouch for "premature" reviews, but I'm doing this in hopes that this game gets more exposure because this feels like a true labor of love from the developers; I really want them to get the community's full support for their care and attention to what makes a game...a game.

I will probably come back here to adjust my review once I've played through the whole game (upon 1.0 launch), and at that point go over Crosscode in a more exhaustive fashion.

38584625.review:

+ 非常有意思的新手教程
+ 精美流畅的画面
+ 丰富的人物表情
+ 不错的音乐
+ 流畅而又有难度的战斗系统
+ 足够有趣的支线

- Z轴在画面上的糟糕显示
- 因为Z轴的原因，导致的同样体验不佳的迷宫
- 略微重复的刷怪

总的来说是一款瑕不掩瑜的作品。我个人非常喜欢2D像素游戏，一个全职的独立工作室能做出如此高质量的2D作品真是太令人感动了！特别是这么大量的精美美术资源、不错的音乐和音效，100块以下能玩到这么棒的游戏真是赚翻啦！数值和战斗系统也比较合理，就是可能刷怪的时间稍微有些长。

不写了！我去玩游戏了！

久しぶりに時間を忘れてプレイしてしまいました。まさにこんなゲームを探していました。

全体的にバランスも良くシナリオや会話もおもしろくいい感じです。
ゲーム性としてはアクション性の高いGBA版ゼルダの伝説+ローグライク要素といった感じでしょうか。レベルを上げてスキルを割り振ったり、アイテムを集めて装備を整えたりといったGBAゼル伝にはないローグライク要素があります。
ダンジョンではゼル伝のようなアイテムこそないですが、代わりにエレメントと呼ばれる属性攻撃で謎解きをしていくようになっています。専用のギミックなんかもあり、ダンジョンボスはそういったギミックを駆使して戦うので個人的にはかなりツボでした。

そういった要素が好きな人にはたまらないゲームではないでしょうか。

38465746.review:
Cross Code starts out as a joyful trip down memory lane, invoking smiles, giggles and an overall feeling of quality development. Shortly after however, the trip gets derailed by cheap enemy tactics, repetive exploration (i.e. find the one piece of land you can hop onto to start looking for the next piece of land to hop onto to get to that chest) and a string of annoying fetch quest that make it more work than fun. 

I'll stick with it and see what develops, but for now, I can't recommend it.

38465501.review:

38451415.review:
魅力的な2Dパズルアクション。
パズル、アクション、ドット絵、BGM、世界観、どれも素晴らしいゲーム。

アクションは操作性良く、気持ちよく戦えて、且つやり応えも十分で素晴らしいです。
戦い方も敵に合った戦い方を要求されたりもして、単純作業にもなりません。
コンバットアーツの圧巻のエフェクトの爽快感。
油断すればあっさりHPがすっ飛ぶ緊張感。
魅力的なアクションが楽しめます。
ただ、製作側が見下ろし型2Dに慣れ切ってるのか、どうも俯瞰的な視点ができて画面全体の敵の行動は常に見れるよね？といった前提の要求を感じます。
序盤から、序盤のサイドクエストから、そういった視点で見ずに一体一体に見てると死ぬよと言わんばかりの鬼畜配置が所々にあります。
こういったシューター的な視点ができないと、難易度バランスがおかしいように感じられるかもしれません。

マップ全てにパズル、パズルアクション要素があり、全てのパズルを解こうとすると凄まじいボリュームです。
難易度も十分あり、やり応えたっぷりです。
一方で、メインストーリーの部分でも容赦なくパズルが盛り込まれているので、どんなにアクションが得意でもパズルが苦手だと普通に詰みます。
難易度が段階的に上がっていくので、いきなりきっついのは来ず、バランスは良いですが。
アクションだけでもとにかくしたい！ならカンニングしていきましょう。
パズルも好き！ならとにかく買いです。
時間制限系が多いのがちょっとしんどい……。

BGMは素晴らしい。だけでなくSEも素晴らしい。
アクションを魅力的にさせている一因です。音が気持ち良い。
爽快感に拍車をかけています。

ドット絵が魅力的です。かわいい。
立ち絵は正直日本人的にあんまり合わないと思います。
ボスのドット絵も綺麗。素敵。

日本語が追加されましたが、全てではありません（2017/12/20）。
現状のストーリーの終盤にほんのちょっと英語が混じります。
ストーリーに関わる部分なので、ストーリーをきっちり把握したい！って人はここらで一旦止めておくと良いかもしれません。
ほんのちょっとなのでスルーでも良いかもしれませんが。

アーリーアクセスですがサイドクエストの量を考えると既にボリュームたっぷりです。
非常に魅力的なゲームです。完成が楽しみ。

38436868.review: I don't have any words to describe (haha), how good this game is

38432986.review: 很丰富，很耐玩，不过对于我这路痴来讲，找路、找任务点、甚至找任务的建筑都比较麻烦，难度适中，游戏是好游戏，不过我个人玩起来有些吃力。

38430124.review:
ついに日本語化！　前々から気になっていたタイトルだけに非常に嬉しく思います。
アーリーアクセスの上にまだ中盤（？）くらいまでしかプレイできていないので最終的な評価はまだ出来ないのですが、現段階で感じたことは以下の通り。

良い点
・SFCライクで良質なグラフィック、BGM
・グリグリ滑らかに動くキャラと、攻撃一辺倒ではなくガード・回避を交えたアクション
・バトルシステムやUI等はユーザーに不便さを感じさせないデザイン（チュートリアル完備）
・魅力的な世界観（ゲームワールド）にキャラクター
・一筋縄ではいかない頭を使った多数のギミックが盛り込まれたダンジョン

気になる点
・SFCの聖剣伝説シリーズのような見下ろし始点の為、高低差がわかりづらい
・各ダンジョンのギミック解除がかなり高難度。数十回レベルのリトライの覚悟も必要

上記のうち高低差については長くゲームプレイしていれば慣れるので何とかなりますが、ダンジョンのギミックはある程度覚悟しておいたほうがいいです。
何が問題かというと、ギミック解除の方法はわかっても、それに非常にシビアなアクションを必要とされるシチュエーションが多いことです。遠距離攻撃で移動させられるアイテムをギミックの効果が発動している時間内にきめ細やかな遠距離攻撃で特定の場所まで移動させて…というようなケースが多く、繊細なコントローラー捌きが要求されます。
また、ギミックには時間制限のあるものが多く、その時間もかなりシビアに設定されているため正確かつ迅速に捌くスキルは必須です。正直、アクションに不慣れな方やマルチタスク苦手な方は十中八九詰むと思います。
何十回とリトライしていたら、だんだん電流イライラ棒をやってる気分になりました。解除失敗しても特にデメリットはないのでそこは安心ですが。

いろいろと書きましたが、総じてすごく丁寧に作られているゲームだなと感じました。
懐古と言われたらそれまでですが、古きよきSFC時代に作られた新作ゲームをやってるようなプレイ感です。
街、ダンジョンのマップや各NPCの台詞など、日本のゲーム会社が作ったと言われても信じてしまうくらいの出来栄えです。
SFC時代に聖剣伝説シリーズに夢中になった方には一押しです。

38401775.review: If you like games, buy this one.

38401595.review:
[h1]《CrossCode》是一款角色扮演+解謎+科幻背景的2D動作冒險遊戲[/h1]

[b]注意：《CrossCode》仍在Early Access階段，此評論版本為0.9.8版，正式版是否有所落差無法肯定。
[/b] [spoiler]我也不能肯定我會不會更新評論XD[/spoiler]

[b]A. 遊戲簡介、特色[/b]

《CrossCode》的故事建立於未來開發的一款MMORPG─CrossWorlds中，玩家扮演其中一位名為Lea的Avatar，因為不明原因而失去記憶，在CrossWorlds的世界冒險過程時，一步步釐清自己的身世之謎。

初見這款作品時各位會覺得畫面陽春，但是遊戲內龐大的世界觀；獨特的技能配點，以及具備各種顏藝的女主角Lea還有其他角色的幽默對話，這些豐富的遊戲內容讓《CrossCode》成為獨樹一格的傑作。

↓看看女主角Lea的表情，很有實力可以拿來當梗圖XD
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1231043552

正如同大多數MMORPG，玩家在CrossWorlds中可以接到許多主線與支線任務，甚至還有隊友、路人的設定，即使是單身遊戲也能夠組隊練等，非常適合邊緣人哦(?)

↓第一位隊友，綽號比本名還長的法國人，還有一個高等的男朋友(x
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1231857372

另外，遊戲中一大特色─Circuits(電路)系統，可以分配玩家的能力走向；學習各種Combat Arts(戰技)，隨著故事的進行，可以解鎖至總共三種屬性的Circuits：冰、火以及中立系統。戰技就想像成主動技能比較易懂，戰鬥中使用不同的Combat Arts可以輕鬆打贏你的敵人，有沒有覺得真的很像在遊戲中打MMORPG的感覺呢？

↓這邊是中立Circuits系統的起始點，只是冰山一角喔XD
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1231857355

[b]B. 小小心得[/b]

這款遊戲的特點不勝枚舉，由於正式版尚未推出，我擔心我的評論仍不詳盡，所以大多要素仍未提及，目前也有些區域無法前往；任務不能完成的情況，但是主角與BOSS戰鬥的緊張刺激感；各種戰技的華麗特效；加上為數不少的支線任務，非常值得在正式版推出的時候購入，最有趣的是：遊戲中有很多的部分是必須善用解謎技巧才能完成任務的，除了具備操作以外還需要動動腦才能過關。

就算不喜歡打怪練等，破解謎題，看在Lea的表情上，我想各位一定忍不住一睹她的丰采(?) 而願意支持這款遊戲的！只可惜遊戲跟其他MMORPG相比，有一個致命的缺點：為什麼沒有造型商城啊啊啊(哭)

[b]C. 整體評分、優缺點[/b]

畫面：7.5/10 (Lea: 100/10)
音樂：7/10
劇情：8/10 (目前劇情未完)
遊戲性：9.5/10
耐玩性：9/10

優點：
○世界觀、主線支線任務、故事內容龐大，超燒時間
○除了打鬥還有解謎要素，考驗大腦與雙手的極限
○女主角表情絕對超過滿分
○依照目前的製作水準，正式版非常值得期待

缺點：
●手把不如鍵鼠容易操作，短時間要瞄準多個目標+射擊太困難了
●有些“人多”的地方可能會掉FPS
●不易上手，前期至中期難度不低

懶人包：
不愛收集、練等、解謎、稍難的遊戲體驗的玩家可以跳過這款遊戲，
非常推薦給打過MMORPG的玩家們，即使是單人遊戲也能找到不少樂趣，
正式版推出時間估計於2018年年初，若擔心到時候偷偷漲價的可以先買。

38401025.review: For me Crosscode is the best game in many years after i stopped playing World of Warcraft.

38392094.review:
One of the best, if not THE best, indie games that I have ever played. Fast paced, challenging, great world design, great and memorable characters, good humor, great pacing through the game, and what is honestly probably a 5/10 story is presented in an at least 8/10 way.

The game is a series of dungeon crawls with very elaborate puzzles, similar to Legend of Zelda. As of version 0.9.8, there are 6 (including the beginning tutorial dungeon) which are very creative, challenging, and very impressive. The Zir'vitar Temple is definitely in top 3 best puzzle/action dungeon thingies that I have ever played. 

In between the fantastic dungeons, you experience a much faster-paced MMO. About 3-5 quests between each dungeon, none of them really feel like you've done an inconceivable many amount of times previously, and it's a very expansive and intricate world. There are a lot of NPC's with flavor text to occupy the world, the world itself is surprisingly very pretty (what with it being a pixel art game and all), and it never feels empty. Each area feels very unique, and there are many organic and very impressive selection of neat characters that are just [i]great[/i] to have around. 

The combat is fantastic. Yes, very click heavy and you do not have a history of button-mashing and your index finger is not comfortably swole, then you will become a tired baby person with a sore index finger. It offers a smooth and seamless transition between ranged and melee combat. There is also a dodge and a block, the dodge you will definitely learn to use to its full extent. It also has super moves for Dashing/Melee/Ranged/Guarding abilities, and they're fantastic and look really awesome. VERY fast paced. Very good, very solid, love it. One recommendation that I do have is that you bind a side mouse button or something to be your dedicated melee button, as the default method of switching between ranged and melee attacks can be difficult to keep up with.

All in all, very good. Satisfies the need for puzzles, adventure, action, and good games. Very great to see such a nice game and that it's still being developed and that the progress for development has been very solid and consistent. Good soundtrack and made in HTML5. Still getting localizations to other languages (most recently Japanese and Korean). Played through it four times and still not bored, albeit with each run spaced out between updates. Easily 9/10 game. Love it to bits.

38284830.review:
This is a surprisingly good puzzle game!

The main selling point of this game is retro SNES style action RPG. But what shines most here is the action puzzles. It requires trial and error, observation and trained fingers squeezing a worn out controller. The story has some merits too, and you will be immersed within the game 'world' in no time. 

On the other hand, this game is programmed in JavaScript + HTML5, alternatively it can be played in a browser (chrome). What that means also, is that you can 'mod' the game easily even you start out without any idea about the game's architecture. 

The development of this game is somewhat long, but the progress is well reflected in the well thought out fixes along the way. The Devs are really doing a good job here.


All in all, get it and enjoy a well piece of action game that has many surprising good points. It could rivals some of the very big names in the action genre!

38267010.review:
Really well done action RPG that puts an emphasis on your skill.

The world building is fantastic, with several layers to it that keeps you guessing the meta of it all.

Enjoyable take on the 'simulated MMO' story telling. The characters feel like they do have their own reasoning to their actions. Sometimes you meet the same background characters again and again as time progresses, which is really nice if your into wanting to immerse yourself and absorb the lore of the world.

Main character is charming and often provides great comedy relief due to their wide range of expressions. I really enjoy seeing her reactions to the world and it really builds her character up, whether frustration or being smug. Or even the expressive reactions of her companions.


In terms of gameplay mechanics, it can be a bit of a mix of a bullet hell and emphasis on timing, you have several actions available to you and they gain extra depth as you start exploring new combinations and possibilities. You can run around, slash things up close or engage in ranged combat, while guarding against either from foes, as the game puts you into a class in the story's MMO which has strong emphasis on skill and wits to use well.

There are a lot of puzzles in the world and dungeons. It's not overwhelming though and they can wrack your brain sometimes if you don't figure it out. They are quite challenging but well balanced. Sometimes it's possible to cheese or find alternate solutions, which can make you feel quite clever or skilled, either because of the mechanics possible or because you have become really adept on timing things due to combat.

38095386.review:
For a long time, I haven't played a game that made me not want to put it down, just play until 3 AM and not even realize how long it had been.
This was the first game to do that in a long time.

It is absolutely incredible. Nice music, a clever take on an "MMO" that still feels realistic, fulfilling combat that is a great mix of challenging while never forcing all of your concentration, great world and level design, intelligent puzzles that far outdo their zelda influence, great progression, a clever way of handling a "silent" protagonist, great boss fights, and a compelling story (so far). It never feels like it is babying you but it also never feels overwhelming, always keeping interest.

In its current state alone, I would say this is worth purchasing. Most of the dungeons are complete and able to be visited, at least 12 hours of the main game is currently playable (with story and quests), and most of the overworld areas are fleshed out and accessible, with the exception of Sapphire Ridge as it was only recently implemented and is still missing a few NPCs. Keep in mind however, about 30% of the main story is currently in the game, and there is a point where it will cut out and tell you to wait for the rest to be added. The fact I enjoyed this game so much with the little amount of all its content I experienced should be telling of how well done this game is. The developers are doing a great job, and I cannot wait for the final patch early next year.

我只说缺点：
-即便不做成就，也要花费大量的时间在练级和刷材料上，而且打低级怪才给1点经验。
-接到的任务通常会比自身等级高不少，个别任务需要等级超出任务很多才能打过，比如那个该死的炮艇！
-商店卖的血药最高只能恢复25%血量，想要更好的血药需要刷材料再去换，材料爆率很低而且兑换还要花钱。
-绝大多数箱子给的都是垃圾材料，而且数量还特别少。为什么非要把后期才能开的箱子放到前期的场景？
-后期boss对操作要求越来越高，个别boss攻击频率太高，不准备上大量药水会打的非常吃力。
-自定义按键为什么不让改鼠标的左右键？mouse4mouse5也不让定义。我想要左键近战右键远攻，非得光标放角色边上很近才能近战太不爽了。
-没有一键看地图，很不习惯，而且角色在地图上是固定的，不会随着角色在不同位置而变化，这给标记带来了极大的不便。
-完美防御的判定太苛刻，实用性很低。
-每个区域都有若干箱子可以开启，地图也标明了箱子总数，但是场景复杂，全搜集还是很费劲。希望改成当该区域所有任务和boss都攻克之后，在每个场景标明未开启的箱子数量。

37777408.review:
游戏中的游戏，也的确会让人置身其中呢~

很早就开始关注这个游戏了，听说加入中文就毫不犹豫的入手了~(给开发商点赞！）上手后真的非常惊喜，可以说是继最终幻想、伊苏和英雄传说系列之后接触的近年来最好的rpg游戏了。
作为一款2D的赛博朋克风rpg游戏，其对人物形象的塑造及剧情的表现力绝对不输于很多3D大作 [spoiler] Emilie好萌的~ [/spoiler]，处处可见的科幻元素也表现出未来科技及幻想世界的魅力。
游戏系统多延续了传统RPG游戏的风格，却也不乏探索创新的元素。游戏的战斗系统是快节奏的近身战，需要随机应变的策略及迅捷的反应速度，其中对技能系统的设计的确令人眼前一亮，四种特殊属性（需要剧情推进和攻略副本获得~)两两相克，以远、近、防、闪的不同战斗风格分别有不同的技能分支，并可以随意切换所选分支，用来应对不同的需求。另一值得探讨的元素便是解谜了；从刚进入游戏的房间到夹杂在剧情与各种支线任务里异常丰富且无比精巧的解谜元素也为攻略游戏提供了极大的乐~趣~，大多谜题是能够比较轻易地做出来的，个别精妙绝伦的谜题需要整体思维和一定的手速及可能的不断尝试才能够完成，所获得的成就感也大大提高。此外游戏的道具及装备系统在延续传统rpg游戏一贯风格之外，加入了分布在各个区域的宝箱收集系统，满足了广大收集爱好者[spoiler] 抖M~ [/spoiler]的欲望，大大提升了游玩时间~
游戏的音乐以8-bit Chiptune风格为主，典型的rpg游戏配乐，整体来说还是很不错的，对于游戏风格及场景搭配都很合适（其中战斗音乐更换过一次，其实以前那个也不错的~）音乐文件在游戏路径CrossCode/assets/media/bgm文件夹下，属于ogg格式文件，感兴趣的朋友可以听一听哦~
关于其他方面的想法，总还是期待着剧情的发展，期待正式版的推出与完善（Radical Fish已经很努力的制作了~超赞！），此外也可以加入联机系统啊~当然也只是微小的心愿了~（笑）
~END~

37626780.review:
The only Early Access game I would recommend.
If you like to boom-bada-pew while swish-swoosh around in a good ol' 16-bit style graphics, then this game is for you. The game will also challenge you in form of puzzles, which makes you feel like you need special help if you don't solve them fast enough.
The combat system is smooth and fluid, and there are few elements you can choose to obliterate your foes with (just don't use the same element type on an enemy that is resistant againist it, fool).
The lore is dope, you play around as a cyber girl with amnesia and there is this dude that likes to watch her every single action (creep? Pffft no, just helping).
Overall the game's gorgeous, and at the state as it is at the moment it will guarantee you at least 20 hours of gameplay (my hours consist of blind playthrough, including "how the hell do I get up there", and "I can't believe I was this stupid. I need special help").

37518453.review:
（ver.0.9.8にて[b]日本語化に対応しました！[/b]）
（以下、早期アクセス（ver.0.9.7）時のプレイで、ストーリー実装部を一通りプレイしての感想）

[h1]毎日公式ツイッターをチェックして開発進捗レポートを見てワクワクしてしまう！[/h1]
…そんな状態になるほど夢中にさせてくれた作品です。

良い点としては、基本的には他の方のレビューにもあるように

 ・スーファミライクな見下ろし型アクションRPG
 ・ドット絵、音楽、アクション部分、システム等、全体のクオリティーが高い
 ・（完成していないので判りませんが、多分）良ストーリー
 ・サイドクエストや収集要素等を含めると結構ボリュームがある

といった点が挙げられますが、
個人的には特に

・レベルデザイン（ステージのパズル的設計）が優れている

という点を挙げたいです。
他の同様のゲーム（ゼルダやアランドラ等）に比べても凝った印象を受けました。
ダンジョンだけでなく、通常のフィールド部分も凝りに凝った構成で楽しませてくれます。

「熱いアクション＋RPG＋パズル」が大好物ならきっと気に入る作品だと思います。

37139230.review:
tl; dr: 这是一款非常好的游戏，赶快买！

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

是时候给CrossCode写一封评测了，这个游戏带来的惊喜太多了。
作为一个日式RPG重度爱好者，能遇到这么一个优秀的RPG游戏实在是不容易。本来以为只有像任天堂这样资深的游戏公司才能开发出塞尔达传说那种完美的RPG，但现在我又看到了另外一款同样近乎完美的游戏——CrossCode。虽然这款游戏还在EA阶段，但是从它已有的内容来看已经能够成为RPG游戏当中的佼佼者。
游戏的战斗系统非常出色，手感很好，它带来的战斗体验绝对不亚于任何一款其他的类似游戏。不同属性、技能与攻击方式的灵活配合让战斗变得丰富多彩，即使面对相同的敌人也可以采取多种多样不同的战术。况且游戏中的怪物种类丰富，还有多种具有鲜明特点的BOSS以及仿佛你是在玩网游的PVP战斗……
游戏的地图都经过精心的设计，不存在视觉死角之类的问题。迷宫的解密难度适中，如果只是希望快速通关的话是比较容易的，但是如果想要拿到所有的宝箱或者做完所有的支线任务的话就需要多动一些脑筋、多走一些路了。另外一个很棒的地方就是CrossCode在迷宫中融入了跑酷元素，让玩家可以通过控制方向就可以到达任何地方而不用使用蹩脚的跳跃。这种操作虽然需要一定的技巧但是大幅提高了游戏的流畅性，也进一步丰富了迷宫的多样性。
由于还在开发当中，已有的游戏剧情还十分有限，现在还不足以对其进行完整的评价。从已有的剧情来看这款游戏融合了CrossWorld内外两个世界的剧情，CrossWorld内的世界和常规MMORPG的冒险故事没有什么区别，但是加入了不同玩家的互动以及游戏中现实世界的联系。而CrossCode外的世界暂时还是一个谜团，个人感觉有什么阴谋正在发生……
游戏中的交易系统既包括通用货币购买也包括收集物品交易，到后期钱会多的是，但是收集品就比较稀有了，所以想要总是维持一身的好装备需要不少的努力。
最后期待游戏早日完成。（为了实现这个目标，赶快购买这个游戏资助开发者呀！！！）

Erstmal vorweg: CrossCode ist eines meiner Lieblingsspiele. Einfach eins der besten die ich je gespielt habe.
Fangen wir mal an mit mit Contra

Contra's: .. keine!

Pro's:
- jeder kann so spielen wie er will im Kampf (es ist für jeden Spieltyp was dabei)
- Es hat eine richtig gute Story! (noch nicht vollendet da sie noch in Entwicklung ist)
- Die Rätsel machen spaß. Von leicht bis schwer ist alles dabei!
- Die Bosskämpfe sind aufregend und gut gestaltet (ist nicht immer einfach nur draufhauen)
- Vom Aussehen her lässt das Spiel jeden Retrogamer/ Pixel-Liebhaber das Herz in die Höhe springen
- Das Spiel lässt sich sehr flüssig spielen
- Es hat keine hohen Anforderungen
  und vieles mehr.. (zu viel zum aufzählen :D)

Fazit: Ich kann es einfach nur empfehlen. Es macht sehr viel spaß und man muss auch mal sein Kopf anstrengen.
Ich habe bereits 67 Stunden spielzeit und bin noch lange nicht fertig! Ich kann mir noch besseres Equipment farmen, noch mehr Quests machen,mehr von der Spielwelt erkunden und Bosse besiegen.

Für NUR 20€ ist das echt ein guter Preis.

Für alle die sich nicht entscheiden können: Es gibt noch eine Demo die man gratis runterladen kann zum testen!

37064996.review:
Summary: Deeply recommended. It is a full game stated 'early access' presumably because some features are still not yet 100% finished (eg localization, language translations, and finishing end-game content), however there is more than a full day's worth of content within! 24 hours+ of content, a fully fleshed out storyline, every detail and graphics done in hand-drawn pixels, and the free demo was first seen on Newgrounds in 2015 and was a hit ever since.

While my playtime may look little, as I've only played it online to be able to write a review for it, I've had my eye on this ever since it appeared as a 'free flash game' on Newgrounds back in 2015 (It is still up there for anyone who wonders), a long time before anything about it on steam occurred--it was a hit back then, and I am very happy to see the consistency that stuck carry over until now. Back then, CrossCode was swamped with high rating reviews focused on the effort and detail thrown into it, as all its art is done by hand (by the mouse), inasmuch as everything else (writing, characterization, concept), and all that time in creating this reflects in its quality. One personal sticking factor is its smoothness even on low-end or 'old' computers (like mine); it runs with visuals as smooth as videos running on 1080 HD; videos that struggle to play with stutter or lag at the same quality in many other games of that graphics. This smoothness follows in your playstyle and gameplay too--when you get hit, the responsibility is onto yourself, rather than anything with the controls (although one can blame the bullets because they are speedy too :P). And with these graphics, it avoids the annoying 'garish' levels of 'too much' graphics that would cause eyestrain or irritation after a long while too. The NPCs and characters are similar to many RPGs; some have lines that repeat or are linear to repeat after it gets exhausted, but a difference is they live with the world rather than act as static characters at different times.

The game comes with subtitles for everything, and even its art has been updated time and time again (from the generic shaded NPC, to a personalized grayscale NPC for more characterization--the developer team didn't need to do that, but they did, and this is the point of quality which drew me back over the years, pining to save up money to buy this when I could.)

The developers are responsive to the community too, and overall decent people. Aside from that, even at the time of writing this, the game is in 'early access', much of the news has clearly stated the goals and present/future content (although there are gift codes that anyone can get online by search engine, these aren't noticeable with the game unless people search for it), and it is technically a finished product at this point with its potential being unravelled as it goes. This was also a factor way back when all everyone knew about CrossCode was 'flash game on this website'; this attitude of consistency remarks a lot about both this game, and the ones developing it.

This is pretty much staying within my favorites as far as I'm reading (and having finished as much content as released at the moment), and has filled my nostalgia back to older games where pixels were done piece by piece, and thoughtfulness was placed in the framework of the whole set. And the good thing is, there is still a lot of space for growth.

Overall, I'd recommend it, even if it says it is "Early Access". It has hours of fun stacked inside it, with a deep story and characterization, also somewhat humoring classic MMO games. Personally--this "Early Access" means you get to see it grow.

Edit: Apologies ahead for my English or punctuation!

37009646.review:
我是一名被困在游戏中的玩家，我的哥哥为了救我出去没日没夜的重写着代码，最终死去了。临死前他完成了编码，而重编后的我，不仅等级被重置，似乎记忆都被重置了，我无法记起任何事情。

这是一款由瞬时效应有限责任公司开发的虚拟现实大型多人在线网络游戏，它叫CrossWorlds。只要开启CrossGearVR(交叉齿轮)设备，我的精神就和宇宙东部的气体巨行星的一颗卫星沙德隆上的游戏服务器连接，并与由瞬时物质制成的临时身体同步，由于量子科技的出色支持，可以实现零延迟的操作，即使是这个远在几个星系之外的虚拟人物。

在这个世界，玩家扮演着探险者的身份，去探索星球上古老的先祖之路的秘密，不过对我而言，我还有另一个目的——找回自己的记忆，据说看到熟悉的事物，进入熟悉的环境对找回记忆很有帮助。于是我再次来到了这个世界，做为一个对一切一无所知的完全的新手。

而且，我似乎遇到了一些小故障，由于交叉齿轮的传动装置尚不完善，偶尔会有一些问题，比如语言失调，来到这个世界的我，能听懂所有人的话，却无法说出任何一句话。我居然是一个失忆的哑巴，还真是完美。

我被传送到了一艘游戏工作人员的游轮MS太阳号上，软件工程师谢尔盖接待了我，他们给我解释了我的现状，教导我找回了游戏的基础操作，我上手很快，按他们的说法，似乎我就是一个天生的气圆使者，之后大概就准备送我到新手桥了。

然后我得装成从来没见过工作人员那样，对，就是假装失忆，对于一个真正失忆的人却要假装失忆，还真是讽刺。不过我有语言障碍，所以假装失忆这件事上我毫无障碍。我要像一个普通个游戏玩家在游戏里玩耍。

离开前还生了两件事情，一件是谢尔盖给了我第一个可以说的词语“你好”，友好的打招呼总是必要的。另一件是中途遇到了一个神秘的蓝色虚拟人物，他自称是神，可以飞行，实力强劲。不过船长杰特使用太阳之拳，那是一种可以暂时中断瞬时物质的武器，击败了蓝色虚拟人物。之后工作人员要又用瞬时物质中和器来确保没有留下任何瞬时物质残留，在那之前，我这个瞬时物质构成的虚拟人物必须离开。

于是我就这样匆忙的踏上了CrossWorlds的旅程，这个曾经存在于我记忆中的世界会是什么样子的呢…

概述

​像素风+快节奏+动作+RPG+弹幕+解谜+跑酷+迷宫+隐藏元素=几乎全部我爱的游戏类型（元素很多，看起来很迷惑。但实际这是一款 动作解谜游戏，解谜的时候不仅考验智商更考验操作。我好像听到手残党在悲鸣。。。）

这是一款即简单又不简单的游戏，这是一款需要你静下心来玩的游戏，就仿佛我们玩网游一样，有时候真的只是为了逃离现实的桎梏，逃离生活中的疲惫不堪。进入一个虚拟的世界里，看看风景也好，跑跑跳跳也好，打怪也好，做任务也好，只要有经验有金币有好装备，便能开心一整天。

对于这样的游戏，我想说，秘籍大概只有3个字“不要急”，没有人和你比什么。从进入到新手城镇开始，我就没有跟着剧情走了。不急着去完成主线任务，反正没人管我，我想干什么就干什么。也不用和现在的网游那般去冲级，去抢排行榜排名，去抢资源，去占领前期优势。没有任何竞争，我就是不用去做主线，先随意的悠闲的晃一圈。

于是，这个游戏开始不断的给我惊喜。一开始的左上角触发的栏杆跑酷任务，非常棒。总感觉左边郁郁寡欢的小哥哥似乎是个有故事的人，可和他搭话都不搭理我呢。右上和右下隐藏的奖励道具的获取也很不错。

之后在上面的区域发现的隐藏的宝箱（需要钥匙，目前没有），还有接到的隐藏的精英任务，还有那个抓小偷的任务，即难又不难，跑遍全城一定是能找到的。提示信息也有一定的作用。

出城后第一阶段的打怪升级，第二阶段是收集资源完成任务，第三阶段是找隐藏空间的进入方法收集小盒子。第一次找到蓝刺猬王的时候，我才开始觉得，原来这个游戏是这么玩的。各种隐藏的触发，留给了那些用心对待这个游戏的玩家。

我目前才玩了15个小时，有一天晚上12点打开它了，然后早上6点才睡上觉。正常来说，我不会这么急着来写这篇评测。但看现在的一些评论有一种粗略玩了一下还没找到精髓感觉，感到对这个游戏实在不公平。继续玩下去，不要给自己定目标，就漫无目的的探索发现，会有很多惊喜会等着你们的。

这游戏吧，有一个致命硬伤，有多硬？动作游戏够硬吧，手残玩不了。解谜游戏够硬吧，智商欠费玩不了。动作+解谜.=???  【剩下的硬核玩家我不知道还有多少，作者真的可以考虑下难度设定，或者作弊设定。不知道是不是因为RPG，能力总能成长，动作我也不算太手残，勉强能玩下。解谜有些时候真的是想不通怎么走，强迫症还让我非常想全收集，请原谅脑残的我.】


评价

出色的画风，2D像素完全无法束缚它的美丽。

优秀的动作，小姐姐欢快的步伐，敏捷的闪避，从容的跑酷，快节奏的战斗，打击感相当之好。

体验极佳的解谜，这个台阶要怎么上去，这个路线链接到哪里，那个箱子要怎么拿，各种解谜都是最原始的毫无提示的量级，无限的考验玩家的智慧。禅宗那里的解谜伴随炮弹攻击的紧张感，简直不能再好玩。

有趣的剧情，剧情其实还蛮大气的，不过作者似乎挺喜欢恶搞+致敬的，各种梗。总有一种逗比的感觉，高大上的世界背景被毁的不要不要的，谁在乎呢，反正着就是一个宅男的网游世界=。=

优秀的引导，用讲故事的模式完美的引导玩家熟悉了游戏中的各种操作，并且了解了游戏的世界观背景。

36971820.review:
If you like action, if you like skill trees, if you like immersive worlds with challenging enemies CrossCode if for you.  This game elegantly replicates all of the fast pased hack and slash action of your favorite action RPGs like Tales of Symphonia or Kingdom Hearts and combines it with some of the the patience and que-reading required for Games like Dark Souls; all presented in a gorgeous 16-bit style.  The controls take a little getting used to due to the nontraditional configuration but  feel tight and responsive after a bit of practice.  Level progression as you move from area to area is right up there with Golden Sun.  Enemies are challenging but teach you to use different skills as you get them.  Bosses are pretty difficult and will probably beat you the first time you face them, but it never feels cheap.  It never feel like the game cheated you out of a win.  More like shows you that your skills can improve which just drives you to focus a little harder and be more patient.  You rarely feel underleveled when going to a new area if you fight most of what you come across as you backtrack or explore.  And OMFG is there exploration.  There are enough treasures and pathways between area hidden throughout each land to give you that metroidvania fix!  Seariously folks I can't recomend this game enough.  

TL;DR: Tight controls, bitchin gameplay, Kindom Hearts+Golden Sun+Metroidvania with a side of Dark Souls. Don't miss out.

Before [i]CrossCode[/i] I saw the words "Early Access" as synonymous with "unfinished", "unplayable", "abandoned" and "not very good".  Radical Fish Games have shown me the error of my ways.

[i]CrossCode[/i] is great, and keeps getting better with every update.  The pixel art is beautiful, the mechanics are -- forgive the cliche -- simple to learn but difficult to master, and it plays very much like a modern-day [i]Zelda[/i].

I can't believe I've already sunk almost 20 hours into a game that's still in development, and I can't wait for the final release.

36215621.review:
Highly recommended. Try the demo. I can only share the opinion of another review: this game is pure gold, best action adventure I've played in recent years.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Very polished gameplay that's even more fun and diverse than the gameplay of great action-adventure SNES-games such as Terranigma, Secret of Mana, Zelda - A Link to the Past, and Illusion of Time. CrossCode presents an example of brilliant gameplay evolution.
- Art design and animations. Just as polished as the gameplay. 

- Personalized, hand-crafted content with great care to detail. CrossCode looks and plays like the developers really wanted to create a great game. From background dialogues to small puzzles in areas you're accustomed to just run through because other games leave them empty, there's creative details in many places.
- Story and characters. It's not finished yet but what I've seen was a treat. "Story driven" isn't just an empty marketing phrase in this case, even the tutorial's been skillfully tied to the plot. Besides, in comparison to the grimdark settings of most current action RPGs (e.g. Path of Exile, Grim Dawn, Dark Souls, Witcher 3, etc.), CrossCode's balanced setting stands out and is refreshing. The devs also did a great job to convey the atmophere of the game's world: NPCs are far more active than in traditional 2D action-rpgs, they run around as if on a mission or lounge around at interesting quest areas, bantering or hinting at hidden objectives or treasure.

- Loot. Somewhat reminds me of Ragnarok Online, where you're encouraged to hunt a specific monster's items, gathering valuables along the way, instead of just digging through loads of random trash loot. Specific items can then be traded for special gear, for example, which adds direction to the experience, even if you should decide to "grind".
- Amount of polish and design in general. For an early access version, a lot of the features seem carefully thought through, adding to a greater whole instead of just adding loose features on top of what's already there.


[h1]Cons(tructive criticism):[/h1]
- Menus seem a bit convoluted (especially "Trophies" and "Synopsis") as of yet, in contrast to the otherwise very user-friendly and unobstrusive UI.
- Balancing, pacing of challenges and missions. In the starting area, some optional quests require perfect aiming and timing, e.g. the training with "Master Sensei". If or when you finally complete these quests, the other starting missions are too easy.
- Since the game is so good you wish there was even more great stuff, enemies, and shiny items :)
- Other than that, I just hope the devs don't burn themselves out and continue to refine this rare gem they've created.


[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
CrossCode reminds me of the reason and significance of indie game development: the inspiration which led people to create videogames in the first place. On the one hand there's fast-food games built by an industry and built for consumption, on the other hand there's games like CrossCode where creative folks found a way to build on their own experiences, express themselves, and realise their concepts of a great and fun game. Thanks for your work.

36107435.review:
版本0.9.7，经过50个小时，除了现在所在的青玉山脉以外基本算是全收集了
（PS：除了盖亚的花园里缺少的开启某些地点的任务以外，还有个别几个实在是不想找的箱子）
整体流程下来所消耗的主要时间有60%都是花费在解谜上，还有15%在地图标识上（在这种只有区域性的地图显示里，给玩家自己能进行标注的方式，让我瞬间回到了九十年代玩伊苏2的感觉，需要一边打一边自己记录地图，虽然这种怀旧感不错，但对现在的不少玩家来说是个不小的阻碍，不过这个地图设计我还是表示赞同的）再有的15%是花在BOSS上的时间，最后的10%是在刷素材上（里面银河螺旋钻的作用在这方面体现的很方便）至于之前看到有玩家抱怨的升级的问题，我个人的流程中几乎感觉不到什么等级的阻碍，BOSS方面花的时间几乎都是用来反复练习一些BOSS的第三形态
主线剧情方面现版本到副本岛就结束了，总体剧情还是不错的，主角塑造的很生动（表情包少女），期待剧情的结局；
任务系统方面，每一个大的区域里都有一个片任务，随着主线的推进，支线任务也在不断跟进，任务里的难度基本都可以接受，主要都在于寻找的难度；
操作系统方面，因为是平面游戏，本来以为不会跳，结果跳是这里主要的难度，其次就是远程和近战了，用鼠标远近切换总是不习惯的，我开始想用键盘代替用鼠标近战，然后发现一只手不太够，我又想用鼠标上额外的键替代，结果这游戏不识别我鼠标额外按键，最后得亏我这罗技可以把鼠标改成键盘的按键，不然操作上绝对没现在这么顺手；
电路系统，也就是技能树，五种属性都有远，近，防，冲四类技能，技能释放都是蓄力，游戏里的技能如果连的好是可以秒BOSS的，而且类技能里的自由切换还是设计的很好的，另外就是洗点很方便，并不怕点错，而且对应的克制效果都是很明显的；
装备系统就没什么大的亮点了，除了个别的武器的注释挺有意思以外别的没什么了；
解谜系统绝对是这游戏的一大亮点，除了常规形态以外的四种属性对应都有不同的解谜方式，互相叠加之后，让解谜更有意思了 ，解密难度也过渡的不错，只要肯想总能解开；
道具系统就有些单一了，基本分为两类恢复类（三明治），剩下基本就是加buff的了，吃东西这个设计基本和怪猎类似，不能动，会被打断，有cd，这也基本限制了恢复类只能卡敌人攻击间隔使用，往往杂兵太多的时候基本吃不了东西的；
敌人的设计还是很不错的，比较多样，各种小BOSS,多形态的大BOSS们，敌人各有弱点，不对症下药伤害根本上不去，另外杀敌评级给掉落确实给稀有材料的获得增加了不少难度；
这里值得单说的就是这里的记录功能，很难得有游戏会把碰到过的每一个商店都记录下来，这个确实很方便，后期找东西合成都省了不少事。


总结一下需要改进的方面：
1.操作方法上能不能让远近攻击切换的方式简洁明了一些，防御和冲刺同理，一些需要快速防御的时候经常会导致冲刺；
2.使用道具一类能不能再丰富些，比如投掷类道具，或者单独拉怪的道具；
3.个别的任务汉化的目标地点有误，好像是秋之实的还是潜秋乡的；
4.关于装备能不能再加一些关于装备的描述，比如像素风的图片；
5.最好能支持下两三个人联机合作，那样还是会多很多乐趣的，毕竟排队跳河还是很有趣的场景............

以上就是我的评价了，就价格方面还是可以接受的，不过还是打折好啊，希望更多的玩家来试试这款游戏。
最后，赶紧更新正式版吧，我等着最后的剧情结局，快更新吧。

35928009.review:
The combat is tight and fast-paced with a decent variety of equipment and skills, the platforming and puzzles are generally quite delightful (but sometimes rather challenging!), and the music is rather catchy.  The character portraits are charming (smug Lea is the best Lea) and enhances the dialogue further.  The only con that comes to mind is that credits can be a little hard to come by, depending on one's playstyle.  However, I rarely found grinding in this game to be a chore, as it gave me some opportunities to practice new combat arts or platforming tricks.

From what I've seen, the devs have a lot of love for this game and the playerbase, which makes me appreciate the game even more than I already would.  Plus, portions of the game give me some nostalgia for Phantasy Star Online.

35886950.review:
丁寧に作られた2Dアクション。
よくゼルダや聖剣伝説などに例えられているが、自分は正直言ってそれ以上に面白いと思った。
現時点(2017/10/21/Ver.0.9.7)では未実装の部分もあるが、今後のおおまかな更新スケジュールと日本語公式対応が決定している。でも英語わからなくても雰囲気でストーリーはわかるし、目的地やクエスト条件などわかりやすいシステムをしているため、そんなに困らない。セールになっていればとりあえず買うことを勧める。

良かった点
・探索や戦闘のアクションが爽快。MAP上の敵は(一部をのぞき)非アクティブで、こちらから殴らなければ基本的に襲ってこない。従って「新しいエリアにきたら、まずは探索や収集をしたい」or「とにかく戦闘をガツガツ楽しみたい」という両方の遊び方に適している。戦闘システムは、属性や敵の行動パターンなどを考慮する必要もある。いい意味でパズル的要素の一部として機能している。雑魚戦でも格上の群れにテキトーにつっこんだりすると平気で死ぬが、デスペナはなく、MAP進入時点からリスポンできるためストレスはない。操作性も良好。
・音楽やグラフィックがすてき。このへんは好みだと思うのでトレーラー見て確認すべき。個人的には緑のアイツの曲が好き(序盤で聴ける)。
・ストーリーも良い。キャラの掛け合いや設定の細かさなど、よく練られていると思う。トレーラーでもわかる通り、主人公は訳あってごく限られた特定の単語しか喋れないが、それもシナリオに大きく関わっている。
・謎解きが面白い。まれにシビアな操作が要求される場面もあり、アクションが苦手な人は苦労するかもしれない。自分も得意な方ではないが、その分クリア時の達成感が大きかった。ゲームをやっていて「よっしゃー」とか言ったのは久しぶりだった。
・時限要素がないところ(自分が気付いた範囲では)。トロフィーが実装されたのでもしかすると今後登場するのかもしれない。

悪かった点
・一部のスキルが死にスキルになっている。というより、レベルと装備をしっかり整えていけば基本はゴリ押しでどうにかなるし、所謂スキルリセットも無限にできるので、この辺はプレイスタイル次第なんだろうか。
・一部のエリアで高低差が判別しづらい場合がある。探索中に飛び乗れると思って失敗したことが何度かあった。
・MAPをもっと細かく表示してくれたほうが助かる。と思ってたらバージョンアップでMAPにピンを立てられる機能が追加されたので、工夫次第か。
・素材集めが少し面倒。普段から探索時にレア素材などを意識して進んでいれば、あまり問題はない。

総じておすすめ。

35762316.review:
Almost at full release, I haven't even gotten past the second town, probably one of the most fun games on steam. I pirated this game at first, loved it, so I bought it. It's that good. Here's a list of Pros and Cons I can think of so far:

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
-Looks amazing
-Story-driven
-Once you get a handle on the controls, you get pretty powerful and can pull off some pretty dope stunts.
-♫[i]Laser Briiiidge[/i]♫
-Fun parkour and puzzles- for the most part, that is
-You just keep getting new cool things
-I love how you're a player playing a high-tec game in the future (like SAO sort of)
-How long it takes you to level is pretty well set
-Item drops are set so you don't get too over powered gear when you're a rookie
-Store is based on item drops AND money, so the entire economy isn't just "grind up money," it's also "grind up legendary trade items"
-Unlocks as you level make you feel OP and badass (First Cut Dash Art just feels OP when facing a slower but high HP target)
-If you like Skill Trees, this is the place for you. You get 1 "CP" per level, which you can allocate to different skills, some minor like a permanent 6% increased ATT, and some major like your "Art Skills." You start off with a single skill tree, not too much to look at, but the more you play, the more you unlock, and I [i]promise[/i] you, the unlocks are always great surprises and are very exciting.
-[spoiler]Once you get your elemental powers, they each have their own amount of CP which is set to what your level currently is. Say, you get fire at level 18, you get 18 credits [i]immediately[/i] into that skill tree which is hella exciting and gives you a whole new set of skills to play with.[/spoiler]

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
-Some grinding. (It's very possible without the grinding, I'm just a grinder, it's harder without the grind)
-I can only play this game for 8 hours at a time. I'm used to 9.
-You don't realize it, but after a while, when you're running around, the screen is slightly choppy, as if it's locked between 30-60fps. I'm not 100% sure about this, but I know that most of the time, when I stop moving for a moment, or a cutscene starts, my eyes notify me how stressful the movement was.
-It's an "MMORPG" that is single player, but has no real MMORPG crafting to it, such as smithing, cooking, alchemy, all sorts that you'd expect when item dropping is so relevent in the game. This is by far the biggest disappointment this game brought to me, being one that usually focuses in Alchemy in these game types, and can see that these systems could be pretty well implemented with the items the game has to offer.. Instead it's more of a "go gather 4 of these and 2 of these, and you can trade them for a healing potion," and I would much rather "gather 4 of these and 2 of these, and then put them into a cauldron and make my own healing potion, but if I put in 1 of [i][b]THESE[/b][/i], then I'll get a 2% ATT increase for two minutes." but sadly, I don't think I could see this being implemented, unless I learn HTML5 and make a mod for it when the game's released. ;-;
-[url=http://forum.cross-code.com/viewforum.php?f=2&sid=5917effe25806d9f3f332fd560a72c54] Their forums are dead.[/url]
-Some puzzles just leave you pissed instead of feeling like you achieved something (Bergen Monks)
-Being Early Access, not every quest you get is complete. One of the FIRST quests you get is incomplete. It's optional, but now it's permanently grafted into the open quests I have, and is impossible to hide. As well as the "discover the Flora" quest, where we really don't need to actively see it to remember "Hit the plants," being you learn quicly to, [i]hit the damned plants[/i].

[h1]All in All[/h1]
If you're looking for a great game to play which gives you hours upon hours of great fighting/puzzle content and a story which draws you in, then I highly recommend you at least [i]try[/i] this game. Smash that demo button, try it out, and feel the Godspeed of Lea's dodge abilities.

I played the extended demo back in 2015 for my Youtube channel, and I really enjoyed it.
Fast forward to now, the game is almost at full release, and I finally got around to buying it.

Early access or not, this game is pure gold, and is well worth it's price tag thrice over.

- Perfect music.
- Captivating story before the title screen or tutorial even start.

- There's records/organized sections for everything from botany to fauna to npc interactions

- Amazing devs

35734742.review:
This game is Early Access done right.
I may not have many hours of play time yet but I already really like this game. I'm loving the party chat, combat and puzzles so far.

I only have a few complaints thus far:

1.) Pressing the left and right stick down on an Xbox controller marks the previous or next quest for tracking. This causes my tracked quest to change frequently; being able to disable this would be very helpful..

2.) I think they went overkill on tutorials. There's three tutorials which take you through the basics. The first one is on the cargo ship, then you've got the noob dungeon and then you get quests to practice that stuff again. I don't think a game like this needs tutorials at all; the noob dungeon alone would be great and then maybe have tutorials accessible via the menu for those who like or need them.

3.) I'd prefer to be able to jump manually. People love running around and jumping just for the hell of it.

There are some negative reviews that are based 'solely' on the fact that this game is in Early Access or that it's been in EA for two years and have nothing to do with the game itself, so CrossCode should have an even better rating than it already does (97% positive right now). It doesn't 'matter' how long a game is in EA. What matters is whether or not they are developing a fun, high-quality game; and these developers definitely are. CrossCode is already worth full price.

TL;DR: Recommended, as shown above.

EDIT::
I just realized there's a built in Language Editor so players can easily point out typos to the devs. In a world where the number of people who care about the English language and not looking like a fool continuously dwindles, this was really nice to see.

this is just... such a beautiful game. i bought it a while ago and figured i'd wait until the full version came out before i played it, but i got bored & decided to check it out, and... holy shit, dude. it's incredible. the music literally made me tear up 'cause it reminded me so much of playing chrono trigger when i was a little kid. the art is amazing, the gameplay is INCREDIBLE and SO MUCH FUN, and it's just.... oh my god, dude. it feels so much like a SNES game - specifically, like secret of mana - but the puzzles are more advanced & intricate than anything from that time period. it's... it's just a perfect game for someone with serious 16-bit nostalgia. this is so damn wonderful.


edit: i'm a little further into the game now, and a lot of the charm for me comes from it being a single-player game set in an MMORPG, which, for a dork like me who likes MMOs in concept but doesn't want to ever actually deal with another person while playing video games, is, like, the ideal situation. also the level-up system is super cool and i'm enjoying the hell outta it. just... so much about this game is cool and fun and innovative, it's really a great game. 

like, my only complaint would be that a lot of the bosses are just more powerful versions of enemies you've already faced in the previous level, but that's just a pet peeve of mine and not something that reflects on the quality of the game at all. it's super good, man

35704574.review:
Just wanted to say, I played the demo a year or more back, and was floored by the game. Now I finally got the funds to ACTUALLY support the game. 

ACTUAL REVIEW -as good, or as bad as I am at it-

GOOD:

The premise of the story thus far is interesting, though I wish the characters had a bit more depth to their architypes. 

The graphics remind me of Secret of Mana for the SNES with an exceptionally detailed map. 

The game CAN be a bit of a grind, but that can become fun in itself, given the unique combat style.

The game isn't difficult in an unfair way. I've had much ease with some side missions, while others were frustrating either due to my own mistakes or due to the quest being a "drop" based mission. I will say sometimes THAT can be a little annoying, dealing with combos, ranks, and ensuring you have the right variant of enimies, but again that is not by any means unfair.

I love the sound track, from the BGM right down to the sound effects.

BAD: 

I know it's been mnetioned before but I think the narrative would be easier to digest if you had some VA talent.

I do wish there was some kind of phsycal changes to your character, through things like equipment, or element being used, or special costume items. 

Also, I do wish we could up the levels of earlier enemies to help the grind along a bit.

OVERALL:

I would reccomend this game to retro, and modern gamers alike. Am I saying this game is for everyone? No. But I would reccommened everyone at least TRIES the demo, cause there is a lil something for a lot of different people. 




Looking forward to the fiinished product!


UPDATE: With the Choice award around the corner, I nominated this game for the write in category "Beautiful Blend of Now, and Then"

What do I mean by that? I mean, I feel like this game was ripped right out of the 90's, but somehow also feels like an up-to-date current gen game. Who knows, maybe others will catch wind! :D

35600448.review:
买来的第一天我玩到了凌晨，第二天连续玩了差不多十个小时。但是后来我感觉这游戏就像一坨屎，屎一样的手感，屎一样的地图，屎一样的流程，屎一样的任务。“艹，咋又死了” “这tmd怎么走啊” “这真的是人能过的吗” "不行了，没药了” “哎？boss咋死了？？？” 之后小半年都没再动过。但我不后悔，因为我在游戏让我找到了小时候那种卡关了挠头不止，迷路了望图兴叹，耍任务几近吐血的感觉。也许这就是游戏最古老的感觉。这几天我又打开玩了起来，呵，还是那坨屎。僵硬的闪避，脚滑的跳跃，繁杂的任务，谜一样的地图，反人类的关卡，玩到现有剧情的最后戛然而止的感觉也跟屎一样。但是这都能让我沉迷其中无法自拔。不得不说这是长这么大少时能让我感到如此有意思的游戏了。（以上部分可以当我在胡扯，重点在下面）

总结一下优点：
1.多样的地图，2D的画面却蕴藏着黑魂一样的迷宫
2.有难度的解密，可以说这游戏的解密部分是目前位置最好的部分了，完成了很有成就感。
3.很讨喜的人设，还有很接地气的汉化。给我印象最深的除了女主另外一个就是那个中二绿毛阿波罗
4.很吊人胃口的剧情，就是不知道以后会怎么发展了

然后说一下让我感觉很不爽的地方：
1.键鼠操作并不舒服，跳跃的时候 不好控制，这让精心设计的地图走起来很累
2.有些关卡的地形很不友好，也许是故意增加难度的，但我经常卡关，讨厌卡关的朋友谨慎购买
3.有些任务过于繁琐，就比如一到一个区域就要割草，还是要割很多的草，有时候是为了找材料，有时候仅仅是为了解锁百科的条目，这个过程很无聊
4.目前完成度并不是很多，虽说有很多区域，但主线剧情真的少。别看我30小时才一周目，主线（不算神庙的关卡）真的没怎么推，时间基本都花在日常支线跟卡关了
5.这是我 最™不爽的，战斗的时候吃药，竟然不是无敌的，怪也不是静止的。有时候本来没事的，站着不动吃个三明治就挨了一下挂了。有些大的场景还好，小的场景都不敢吃东西补血

希望能早些玩到后面的剧情，88块还是有点小贵，但是打折的话强烈推荐买，指不定以后正式版会涨到多少。是时候给你的游戏库里添点清新又耐玩的佳作了

35465093.review:
Puzzle: 5/5
It has well build structure. They first give you easy basic ones with one idea, then develops on that idea - evolving into challenging yet very doable puzzles. It's very polished and it's clear they put a lot of care into their puzzles.

    Combat: 5/5
Aside from the feeling I got that melee build is lot more powerful than ranged, it's pretty good. The combination of butter-smooth movement and satisfying hitting sounds make a great combat system. Every enemy has their unique attack you should watch out for, and weakness you can exploit.

    Story: ???/5
It's not particularly good, but not bad either so far. I mean, the storyline isn't even released fully in this early acess version. I personally hope they could tone down the "Ancient" lores and "Master Sensei" vibes a bit.

    Visuals: 4/5
The pixel art part is absolutely beautiful. characters, worlds, enemies... the illustrations are bit plain. Their faces are in good balance between being cute and realistic, but the attire designs show the limits of concep artist(Sorry devs!). The armors are depicted as more or less square/sphere shapes, without any sort of filler details. I suspect that's the artist's weakness...

    Playtime: about 32 hours as of 0.97 early access. Not bad at all!
However I feel like they sort of overdid it with the first dungeon, it's crazy long! Thankfully I didn't have much problem due to me enjoying it a lot, but that dungeon really should've been split into two sections or somthing.

I'm not sure if they're planning to add cosmetics(items with different looks). It's probably not gonna happen due to the amount of work required while having no impact in gameplay, but I just want to play dress up on my Lea...it would be so much fun...

35461451.review: It isn't a stretch to say that this is the best ARPG I have ever played. The unique gameplay of CrossCode integrates itself into  the puzzles and the combat in more than just a few ways and does so wonderfully. The bosses are well thought out and very fun to fight. The world is built around the progression of your character, and even uses backtracking in a way that isn't annoying or tedious to deal with due to easy fast travel. The game lets you take everything at your pace, which not only adds a personalized player experience, but also adds a bit of replay value. The game is not done yet, so if you really want the full story and full expanse of the world I would hold off on buying, put it on the wishlist and wait until the full release. However, if you are into fast-paced, timing heavy combat with interesting and involving puzzles, then this game is absolutely for you, do not hesistate in buying this like I did.

I'm always skeptical of early access games, but this one really took me by surprise and I can't praise it enough. There's just so much to love here. All the environments are beautifully made, and when coupled with such an incredible soundtrack, it makes for a truly captivating experience. The story and characters are pretty charming; I never get tired of seeing Lea's smug facial expression pop up in the dialogue scenes. As for the gameplay, the combat feels solid and the puzzles are surprisingly clever. What I found to be a nice touch was the subtle platforming puzzles scattered throughout the overworld that will have you traversing multiple sections of the map. I've found myself getting sidetracked many times just from thinking, "I wonder how I can get up there to that item?" 

Radical Fish has done a wonderful job with this game so far and I'm really looking forward to the full release. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone - even in its current unfinished state there's tons of content to go through.

35109910.review:
Where do I even begin? First things first I'd be one of the first to say that this game is absolutly fantastic

Crosscode is a homage to the old style Legend of Zelda type puzzle games originally released for the SNES and anything of its ilk. The most significant dfference between Crosscode and its predecessors is that it also takes on an open world (Think World of Warcraft) that encourages the player to persue quests to upgrade stats and gear rather than simply finding or upgrading what you have. The world is large and divided into multple areas with various difficulties that increase as you advance. Simply traversing the terrain at times can be a puzzle but that's not to imply that its neccesary to do so. 

Crosscode also exceeds gameplay wise. Cross code has a level based system that gives you points to upgrade various skill trees as you advance. This encourages multple styles of gameplay and doesn't restrict you to simple button mashing (should you not prefer it).

The music is beautiful, the artwork is highly detailed and enchanting to look at, the story is intriguing and the characters are fun.

Normally I would not condone buying a game that isn't finished but the developers are wonderful at maintaing consistent updates and they even allow you to keep up with their progress live at their discord/twitch channel

TL;DR
A wonderful and content packed game that fufills the desires of the RPG and fast paced fighting communities alike. Do yourself a favour and buy it

34847437.review:
I am not really a reviewer (i don't usually write them), but I had to give this game a positive review. Here are my reasons for it:

Pros:
- Even though this game is still in early access, it feels complete and only thing that's still in work is main story and its quests (for now we have about half of it from what i can gather).
- Characers are not too complicated and fun. I don't find any of them lacking or too annoying.
- Contols feel great on keyboard as well as on controller.
- Has great mechanics. This game mixes slasher with puzzles perfectly. 
- Puzzles are not too difficult to do, although still require some time.
- Skill tree and the elementals system are great. Every elemantal has its weaknesses and advantages.
- Graphics look beautifull. Abilities are flashy and cool, locations look very nice and character sprites are good.
- Demo version.

Cons:

- Game is still in progress, and about half of story and locations are not avalible.
- If you want to get better items, you have to grind quite a lot since precentage of dropping for better items is quite low.


Overally, this game is a very good rpg with it's only con being the storyline that's still in progress. It has a free demo, so if you want you can try it out. I'll give it 9/10 for now, but I am willing to give it 10 if the story is complete.

34817986.review: Adding to what everyone else has already said. I do feel there is a lot of time and effort spent with this game. The developer definitely has produced a quality game, even in spite of it being Early Access. Lots of content, pretty solid controls, interesting story, and pretty much everything else that has already been said at length. The only thing I could add to this is that unless you like really like puzzle platformers, you might find yourself...wanting...for a more even handed approach. If you like a challenge, this game will definitely challenge you. Echoing what has already been said, you will require a lot of skill to progress in this game. There are certain, quests, where I became almost certain that the developer was a sadist. Cleverly made puzzles and challenge are one thing, and this game does have it. But there are certain side quests that force you through some extremely difficult challenges. If you just want to complete the quest and skip that...you can't. It's built in. For me I would prefer these kindof challenges to be optional in a sense of where I come to them on my own terms when I want to. Not have it tied to a quest that I wanted to finish, and you will never know ahead of time which quests are like this. Because these quests are always multi-stage, and will always have you do some menial task first. So you won't know which ones to put off till later, until after you've done them already. Not saying these quests are impossible, they are completable. However I feel these sorts of challenges should be left out of quests. I've been completing them up to this point, but...for me it just seems out of place. Though I must reiterate this is a personal preference of mine, and is not in any way shape or form, a strike against the game itself. I feel I need to put this here because I know for sure there will be people who will misinterpret what I am saying, and begin with the malicious fanboyism. Yes, this game has fans, and with good reason. But every fanbase has those, how shall we say, vocal components? Anyways thanks for reading.

34809405.review:
Please take into account that a 5 to me means average, anything higher is above average.  5-6 is serviceable but nothing special or groundbreaking, 6-7 is serviceable with some good aspects, 7-8 consists of good to great aspects, but a there are still noticeable problems and annoyances, sometimes to a degree that will turn a player off, and deter it from being a 9-10, or a game of masterful craftsmanship, where a game has very minorest, are either unnoticeable entirely or small enough that the rest of the quality in the game masks it.

The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past.  Secret of Mana.  Hyper Light Drifter.
CrossCode is the result of taking the very best mechanics and design philosophies of these three excellent games, and it never feels like an unispired clone of any, never resting on these laurels, for it never completely replicates these games.  

Story: 7.5 ( While they play with tropes, there are still too many )
The first noticeable difference when you start playing is the setting / narrative as a whole.  The plot of CrossCode shares almost no similarities to the plot devices of the other games.  That isn't to say it's completely original, which it isn't.  As it draws from the best gameplay mechanics of the three games already mentioned, so to does it draw from, or replicate the best concepts and themes of existing franchises, creating something better in the process, while managing to feel unique regardless of similarities.  

Some might compare it to the .Hack series, but in truth it is more similar to that of the high fantasy series Otherland, novels where people are becoming trapped within it's virtual cyberspace, comatose in the real world. And just like in the Otherland books, CrossCode has a diverse amount of areas, all with important and well-thought out narratives, quests, and characters, each one totally different from the next and never staying on one genre setting, stretching across the fantasy and science fiction genres.  It isn't just a science fiction story and world, and it isn't just fantasy.  It does a great job of balancing the two.  Unfortunately, it still uses tropes that have been repeated ad nauseum in this industry, and that's the anmesiac protaganist.  On the other side of the coin is the developers played with this trope a bit, making your character mute because the code of the MMO she is in isn't working properly with her avatar, causing you to slowly learn phrases over the course of the game.  You get flashes of dreams and visions as you progress throgh the story, but none do a decent job of really hinting at Lea's origins, almost as if the developer cares more the world's story than the character's, but this is only from the perspective of where the story goes to now, as there will be much more to come.

Because it's Early Access it's hard to judge how compelling the narrative is, or might become.  As it stands now, the areas you do get to explore that are essential to the playable story sequences feel like a patchwork at times, with a lot of dense activity in one area but not much further away it feels completely empty of gameplay of any sort.  Fortunately, in these areas you can easily see where something might be added.  Finally, in regards to the story is the Guild that you join, as well as other factions' quests. To put it simply, the Guild is my favorite part of the story so far, has the most promising of the main narratives, and the amount of quests you can find throughout the world that aren't even connected to the guild but to other factions, and even many that are completely unique, is very impressive, especially considering much more will be added.

Gameplay: 8 ( Great Combat Action / Horrible, Micromanagement Economy

The second thing that helps CrossCode stand apart from the other games, where gameplay is concerned, is the by having a combat system that has more depth than what you would except from a game of its kind.  Within the game-world, Leah is considered a Spheromancer class, which is the jack-of-all-trades.  There are five elements, one being neutral, each with their own skill trees and combat arts that you unlock throughout the game, and then switch back and forth between them.  While every element you use has the same type of combat arts ( Melee, Guard, Ranged, etc ), the skills for each of them changing depending on the mode, so you have a nice degree of flexibility in playstyles.  The four elements you get to use are capable of overheating after a fashion, so it forces you switch between attack styles and keeps you on your toes.  Finally, when you unlock a new element and skill-tree you will discover that you have the same amount of skill points to allocate as you did for the others, so every style will always feel equal and not underpowered.

While I applaud the combat and action in general, there are other areas that hinder the game from being truly exceptional.  The first of these issues is the economy and how acquiring gear, items, and materials work.  To be frank, it's obtuse, unintuitive, and downright awful.  It simply becomes a chore of trying to keep track of every material you need to trade for more of another material for more of another, to get a piece of equipment or a certain amount of item.  On top of which you still you need to spend your hard earned money as well.  It makes no sense to have a bartering system where the NPCs charge you for buying items that also require the several different types of materials.  They always require several types of materials, usually multiple of both, and many of these can only be found by trading other materials to vendors at a completely different part of the game-world.  Because materials are the only form of loot, meaning all equipment and items needs to be found via the economy and chests, their is a severe progression problem.

The gear that you do get after the hassle is actually a highlight, as besides the normal attribute changes, they almost always come with unique passive traits.  A gear might give you a bigger time window for making a perfect guard and counter attack, or make it quicker to aim, move faster, more critical hits, etc.  There are a lot of traits to be discovered, which can make a noticeable impact.  It is just unfortunate the amount of unneccesary backtracking and micromanagement needed to acquire items and equipment.  Even for consumables work in this fashion, where you need two to three types of materials, and typically several of each.  When you discover that some of the consumables, be it defensive gains or strength-based ones, come in three degrees of strength and a few degrees of length, the longest being sixty seconds, you will most likely not go through the hassle of acquiring them or will hardly use them because you will want to hoard them, despite them not being all that important.

You will acquire AI-controlled teammates which is a great addition to the game, and also a very perplexing one.  This is where, besides the graphics, the game resembles Secret of Mana the most.  You set tactics for your companions and that's all the control you have over them.  Their addition drastically impacts the gameplay for the better, each companion being a specific class and having their own unique abilites.  Which is where it gets perplexing, and in all honesty, disrespectful to the player / consumer.  The game goes to great length to explain six other classes that exist in this MMO game-world only to force the player to be the jack-of-all-trades.  You cannot switch classes at any point and there are not sub-classes.  The closest thing to a subclass is using particular companions, but so far in the game you basically only have two unique class-based companions available to you.  The reason is balancing issues, which is inexcusable when they basically tease you that they are there and you can't play them.  To be fair, it's more disrespectful than ruinous gameplay.

Graphics: 9
Sound: 7

Overall: 8/10

34671779.review:
I found this game really fun and engaging so I want to give it a push for good reviews. Since this my first review I'll put it in Lea's (main character) perspective. "Hi" :D  "..Lea" :) "...Why" :/  "Bye" :( . Oh oops kinda forgot the speech problem. Ok ok time for a actual review. First a quick one then a more detailed review.

Pros:
1. intriguing story I was hooked just from the demo
2. Fun battle system
3. intresting characters
4. lots of thnigs to look at and do
5. They don't coddle you and smother you with unneeded tutorials

Cons:
1. Enemies act like they'er some kinda homing device (they can be hard to dodge... or I just stink at playing)
2. Timed puzzles can get really annoying fast
3. Quests need variety ( but I know they'er working on that)
4. They don't have a place where I can see how to execute special moves ( I forget how to use them and can't remeber)

Ok that was a little longer then I was expecting, anyway onto the more detailed part.First this game is set in a setting where you can play as an avatar in an other world. Key word "an other world" meaning people are able to play on Earth as an avatar that will physically be walking and talking on a distant planet in space some where. Every person starts on a place called the bridge where you go through a tutorial so you know how the game is played. At least everyone is supposed to start there... Any way you first play through a prolog? maybe? kinda thing as a girl named Shizuka. She's trying to get to her brother and has to fight aganist some mysterious guy and his robots. When she finally does get to her brother, she gets there in time to see him.. well I'll let you play that part your self. Any way you wake up as a amnesic girl named Lea, who is at the bottom of this big ship (where first time avatars or avatars in general aren't supposed to be). While you are there a guy named sergey begans to talk to you via some kind of personal link connection that he has set up with Lea. We find out that Lea has speech issues with her avatar and sergey will have to help her with a work around for her speech. After the troubles he'll help you get through a tutorial and later on you meet some of the crew. You are finally let off the ship and put back where all little good avatars should be, a place what they call the playground where all the avatarsa are. You find out that since Lea has lost her memory that maybe if she played the game once again that maybe she'll regain her memory. And thats basically what you have to do the more you play the game the more mute Lea remembers. It gets more intense as she remembers more, and frustrating as Lea trys to get her memories out with the speech problems she has. I'll leave it at that so you can play the game yourself. Its fun and a challenging game. From mystery to puzzles. Its an all around good game. Also thumbs up to the developers who made this game. From playing as a girls perspective who offten sees fan service (girls protrayed as a sex symbol) or trying to make a political purpose/ stand, I find Cross Code does niether. It's just a game where I can play and not have to worry about that junk. Even Lea made the same face as I when one of the quest (bull on fire) ask you to put a bovine down and the man said he knew she'd fell bad about doing it but it had to done. She just made a yeah right face it was funny, anyway I said all that to say Lea is relatable and not some fan service poltical mess. Even though it's EA I can tell you devs will hold to your promise.
Buy the game people it's worth it. ;)
