34613922.review:
This game is a masterpiece, and nothing short of it.

Pros :
+Enjoyable, and even captivating, story.
+Great artwork
+Beautiful environments. (ties in with artwork)
+Good music.
+Phenominal gameplay. (combat, movement, etc.)
+Humorous where it attempts to be. Dramatic where it needs it. A nice balance between fun and seriousness.
+Full controller support (for those of you who despise mouse/keyboard)
+Easy to learn/manage menus.
+Easy to pick up, harder to master.

Cons : There is only really one or two Cons so I'll be a bit more lengthy with it.
-Could use significant difficulty adjustments. It's very easy to level (and therefor over-level) as you progress in the story. This makes many fights that should be significantly difficult, well, significantly easier. This includes bosses, side-bosses, and just general mooks to be cleaned up. There is no difficulty setting either so you can't make the game harder on yourself to counter act this. For some people, this isn't necessarily a bad thing, but for others it's a bit of an issue.
-Locked class. As we know, there are 6 total classes in the world of CrossCode. We only get to experience playing with one of them however. I have no issues playing with that one class but having the knowledge that there are other classes in the game - it kind of makes me wish you could play with those as well.

Seriously though, buy this game. You absolutely will not regret it.

34488137.review: 半夜忍不住来写评测,没有比评测一款自己喜欢的游戏更让人兴奋的了,夏剁没买感觉很可惜,但我实在是等不了冬剁入手了,这款游戏的素质是我最近几年玩过的这类风格游戏里最好的,游戏的背景设定有点类似刀剑神域,游戏主要内容就是战斗加解谜,首先战斗方面,游戏的动作出奇的流畅,打击感非常强,技能树(游戏里叫电路)也很丰富,技能树有四种元素(包括本身无属性就是5种),每种元素都有独立的技能树,这也使得游戏可玩性很高,然后说说解谜元素,解谜元素最主要就是寻找游戏中的宝箱了,因为游戏设定角色是不能跳跃的,然后地形是有高度的,所以游戏中会有大量的时间花在跑图上,因为你不能直接走上一个高点的平台,相同高度的两个平台之间距离够近,角色是可以自动跳跃过去的,所以你明明看到宝箱就在上方高地上,你却要绕路去拿(能随便就拿到宝箱,你也觉得没意思吧),也算是这个游戏的一大特色吧,,这也相对的增加了游戏的可玩性,然后就是游戏前期可能对新手有点不友好,比如小怪比想象中难打,但是你是又npc帮你打怪的,猥琐点打,把操作练熟,就没那么难了,最后再说一句,这游戏绝对对得住这价格,如果你喜欢塞尔达传说系列,相信你也会喜欢这款arpg游戏的,强烈推荐!!!!!

34374595.review:
I don't usually write reviews, and I also don't normally purchase early access games. All I can say is that this is one of the few early access games that does it right. What I mean to say is the devs supply the game with constant updates on its progress and they know what they want their game to be which is not usually the case for early access games. To make a comparison this game is handling early access in much the same way that darkest dungeon handled early access.  The only thing they have not done yet is finish the games story which to be honest is kind of understandable. I can't wait to see the whole game once it is finished

TL;DR
Early access done right

34362906.review:
Played it before release, good game. Fun interaction with other NPCS. Worth trying if nothing else. Wont go into too much details, seriously just give it a shot and feel it out, best way to find out if you like it or not, buy it, give it some minutes or hours of your time, refund if it doesn't feel right. 

No stress really, trying out the game is the best way of getting to know whatever it's something for you or not.

Wont spoil anything about the game, will however say it feels nostalgic in a way. I know this will indeed sound really..odd

But I honestly wish I could lie down in my sofa or bed, and play this on a handheld console.. It really does feel like something that I would to 100%, have played on my gameboy when I was younger.. That's the type of feeling I get when playing this game..

Hands down, playing this game on a PC doesn't feel entirely right. The game is still good and all, however.. A big part of me reacts to this game, I feel so nostalgic that even as I write this and think about CrossCode.. It feels like I'll just go lie down in my bed and play this on my GameBoy afterwards.. It really feels that way and that's why I think PC doesn't feel right.

I guess it's just nostalgia, someone who hasn't played handheld console, at least not these type of games on one... They wont probably feel the same way as I do.. 

But man, I really wanna pick up my GameBoy now.. Sooo, cya, got a game to play and thinking about a way to play it on a handheld console instead :)

34345788.review:
Pour l'instant un des meilleurs jeux early access auquel j'ai jamais joué !
-Le jeu est fluide (même sur config moyenne) 
-Le système d'inventaire et de compétences est bien géré.
-L'histoire, bien que pas encore finie, est interressante.
-Les lieux sont variés.
-Les décors et le pixel art sont magnifiques.
-Les combats sont rapides et nerveux et il est nécessaire d'avoir une bonne maîtrise de son personnage pour vaincre les boss.
-Les développeurs sont très actifs et les mises à jour du jeu sortent assez régulièrement.

On notera seulement quelques petits problèmes:
-les effets de profondeurs sont parfois dificiles à dicerner (ce qui n'entâchera cependant pas votre plaisir de jeu).
-Le jeu n'est pas en français et les textes anglais sont parfois dificiles à comprendre.
-La quête principale n'est pas complète.

En bref, un bon jeu plutôt original dans ce qu'il propose où vous pourrez facilement passer des dizaines d'heures à vous amuser si vous aimez les RPG.

这是一款很好的2D类RPG游戏，剧情上也很有趣，从游戏设定来看玩家就像刀剑神域一样带着那种VR机器从现实连接进虚拟世界中，而且从游戏氛围就带给你真的在和别人打网游一样刷刷野怪打打钱，做做任务升升级，而有艾米莉这样话痨的队友陪着让你减少了孤独感。
在战斗方面也有着很不错的打击感，虽然初见一些小怪时可能会有种“哇~这小怪贼厉害！“的感觉，但摸通小怪的攻击模式后就不会辣么得艰难。大BOSS战也不是特别难，死过两三次之后就基本可以过了，相对之下为什么我倒觉得小BOSS比副本大BOSS更难打。
队友方面虽然在前期并不是很给力，然而后期时    队友：“莉亚待在我后面，我来揍扁他们。“
同时谜题也是很有趣，也并不是很难，只要有点耐心就可以解决，有辅助线的存在也让难度减少了很多
总体来讲游戏十分不错，地图谜题也让人感觉制作组很用心[spoiler]用心到让我在地图上反复跑来跑去[/spoiler]
接下来是吐槽方面：[spoiler] 哇~你这隐藏宝箱藏的有点隐秘啊，不看攻略谁知道啊。哇~这冰要不要这么滑啊，跑起来刹不住啊。哇~你这炮台贼调皮啊，我好不容易跳过去的！哇~你这小怪比我还会闪避啊。哇~队友你什么时候补的血。哇~上面的宝箱怎么拿啊，不拿贼难受啊。哇~A级战斗条消失的好快啊，我物品还没刷出来啊。哇~分析植物要不要这么多掉落物品啊，你这是收集游戏吧。哇~蚁卵蚁巢也是植物是什么鬼辣。哇~任务NPC你这都知道我想说什么，我就说了个莉亚啊，你有心理感应么喂。哇~三分熟的牛扒能吃么喂。哇~以后版本会有成就系统，我老毛病又要犯了（强迫症）[/spoiler]

34323162.review: 作为一个传统RPG游戏，给我有一个玩下去的冲动。

34322610.review:
This game, despite being in early access, feels more finished than many games that aren't; it already looks absolutely gorgeous, has interesting puzzles, a fun combat system, and a varied world within which one finds a very interesting story. 

ALL OF THE NEGATIVES:
- The later available sections can suffer from grunt spam (i.e. they throw an overwhelming number of small enemies at you instead of having more varied enemy types)
- The enemies can sometimes go a bit overboard on the attacks that track you
- Depth can be a bit tricky sometimes
- There is one room in the game (only one, mind you) in which the camera is a bit irritating
- There are a few minor grammatical and spelling mistakes in various places (most of which are to do with singular/plural confusion)

If it seems like I'm nitpicking, that's because I am; this game is fucking great and, if it looks at all interesting to you, you should buy it as soon as you can.

游戏设定很吸引人，有一种在单机里面打网游的感觉，虽然队友都是NPC啦，不过这个真的是推荐手柄游玩的么，键鼠的难度比手柄低，不过也不排除是提高受虐抖M的快感吧，反正瞄准系统让我特别想摔手柄。
初见的感觉大概就是下面这样：[spoiler]哇这个boss真简单，我能躲开这个攻击，哇怎么还有二阶段，哇被打中好疼，让我吃个包让我吃个三明治回点血，哇吃个包都能被打断，卧槽还有三阶段，不玩了，啪（摔手柄的声音）欸这个小怪看起来就是个经验提款机，好的撸他！哇这个小怪怎么破防啊，怎么感觉比boss还难打，还附带其他小怪的群体仇恨，好了又GG了，不玩了，摔！这个任务看起来很好做，嗯，什么试炼挑战，哇就是跳跳格子防御炮塔的攻击的事情，简单。什么，还有不拿盾和限时挑战的？（炮塔打中会击退）这个有点刺激（然后无限落命落命落命）啊真难，总算完成了。妈耶怎么还有个在冰上的挑战，这么滑，停下诶你给我停下，不玩了，啪。	[/spoiler]
总之，抖M患者是必入的2333手残患者慎入，难度比较大而且很磨耐心，几个支线任务的难度其实前期特别恶心，[strike]摔完手柄之后去问大佬，然后我就刷了一个小时的野怪，把级别升上来之后就轻松完成了任务。[/strike] 而且收集这个方面吧，加入了跑酷元素还挺有趣的样子的，但是真的对手残玩家和收集症患者特别不友好，有的地方你得穿过两三张图往回跑才能拿到所以你能体会到中间如果不小心掉下来还得重跑的感觉么，特别是有的地方是特别特别容易掉的，你得小心翼翼地蹭着过去，而且你好不容易打开了箱子，发现里面其实都是很容易就能获得的物品，啊那种感觉，也就强迫症不会介意太多吧。有的收集路线也是设计太难受了，虽然反推基本都能找到，但是我游玩的大部分时间就耗在了收集这上面，当然还有不停的刷怪，因为你做任务经验是跟不上实际上剧情的推进所需要的等级，当然等级高了你容错率也提高了，这对于我等手残玩家也算是一种通关方法吧。
+不错的打击感和流畅的打击效果
+有趣的剧情和人物互动[strike]（等一个完结剧情的游戏发售，虽然还有点远）[/strike][spoiler] 另外就我一个觉得莉亚很萌嘛，当然是颜艺啦233[/spoiler]
+较为完整的人物技能系统[strike] （要是官方有空的话其实希望出一下其他职业的剧情和技能）[/strike]
+良心官方（不拖更是个好习惯2333）
+很棒的解密要素
-过于重复的刷怪和跑酷元素[spoiler] 还有一些很奇葩的怪物破防设定，也是醉了。那个火牛任务能再难点么，破防了还是打不动，那破防有什么意义。[/spoiler]
总之是一款很不错的像素风游戏，抖M必备2333很容易沉迷，原价入也值。不说了，等一个新地图更新。

34227534.review:
An all around good game.
If in doubt, PLAY THE DEMO! - The devs not only put up a demo in steam, but there is an actual IN BROWSER build of it working on their website. Give it a shot.

Excellent combat - Mechanically shallow with sparkling visuals typical of the "beat-em-up" style. It shines in how fluid it is, the developer's description of "butter smooth" does it justice.

Enthralling story - My perception is probably colored with my personal experiences, but the story is really gripping. It has the typical cliches but caters to them well. The front line NPC's feel human, while the unimportant ones (but important enough to be unique) fall into personality archetypes, none of them feel grievously corny. The story is made of several sub plots that exchange time in the spotlight without ever fighting for attention giving it an organic flow tightly linked with progression.

Good music, standard sound effects - The music design is rather good, I won’t be buying a sound track any time soon but it matches environments perfectly and is a joy to listen to. I never felt myself annoyed by its presence and I never found myself forgetting it's even there. The sound effects are fairly bland. Like vanilla icecream, sweet and enjoyable, but sorta meh. It fits very neatly into the world and is everything that should be expected, but it feels as if it fits too well. The sound perfectly matches the 16-Bit love story the devs have crafted, but seems flat in comparison to the more robust effects found in other games. Not good, not bad, just, vanilla.

Graphical Wonderland - The game looks amazing. The sprites and tilesets (assuming their engine uses tilesets, no clue) are bright and flowing. As you play through the game the graphics meld with the game play as the very physics heavy platforming turn minute details into intractable ledges and platforms. Everything about the look of this game is bright and fluffy, it compliments every other aspect from combat to platforming to story. Everything is crisp, intense secret hunting isn’t hindered by muddled obfuscated pathways hidden from view, everything is right there waiting to be seen, the spectacle of it all makes the little things hard to find.
(The jungle could feel more jungly, it feels like a shady forest atm. I never found myself in an “in the weeds” moment you would expect from a jungle area.)

HARDCORE PARKOUR! (sweet guitar riff!) - Nothing is greater than seeing a chest up on a distant ledge only to realize that it is the reward for a zone wide multistage parkour puzzle. Overboard? Yes. A little aggravating at times? Maybe. Rewarding as all get out? Hellz YEAH! Jumping puzzles fill the overworld as you look and hunt in every nook and cranny for my loot boxes, rare plants to harvest, or hidden caves. The trials are tough, the physics are fair, I am rather bad. I found myself failing time and again trying to get those elusive boxes due to terrible user error not mechanical failure on the game’s part. My only complaint, I also see as a good thing, was the eureka moment when i realized that I could climb up the little edges of these ruined buildings i needed to traverse. Harkening back to the 16-bit era, a half wall used to act like a full wall tile, this game does not function like that. It also does not tell you that and you never run into an occurrence when it’s an issue until you're about halfway through and you run into these ruins. Realizing my massive convoluted round about way of getting to a platform to run along the tops of the ruin walls and get the box I was going for was cut down by about 90% because of a little half wall I could jump up and then run up the destroyed bit of wall next to it was at first rage inducing (I had been working on the problem for about 15 min) but then a big ol AH HA as i started realizing where I could apply this elsewhere.

In it’s unfinished state I would give this game a 6.5/10
-This is made with the assumption that the story would fall flat in the end
-If the story pulls off the finale that it promises and feels like it is building to I would gladly give it a 8.5/10 there is just so much left to do, I hope it pays off.

34173891.review:
Being the type that doesn't actually write reviews, i couldn't help but make an exception in this case.

First serious-ish review. [strike]I guess you could say I got balls.[/strike]


An impressively good game! The pixelated graphics looks very good, and this comes from someone who is not a particular fan of the genre. The RPG feeling is well crafted, having an large range of features including the standard menus equipment, quest, items, and others. What i found interesting is that you can call, when possible, NPCs in your party in order to help with grinding or quests. The maps? So much exploring... as well as returning to previous maps in order to uncover the secrets and other things. The jumping off platforms makes an oddly satisfying, and puzzles are well crafted, making you love and/or hate them. 


The combat system is unique and surprisingly intense, featuring a combination of melee and ranged fighting topped off with dashing and blocking. Imagine combining all of them against enemies which don't actually wait for anything when you are engaged. The results are very satisfying once the battle ends. Additionally, you can change between 4 elements during the battle, and adapt the skills to your playstyle.

Soundtrack is great, and definitely helps with the immersion. it has been updated and the new battle theme is bae, as well as other songs being added.

The storyline is great, and it is best experienced, so I will refrain from talking about it. But damn son, this game managed to keep me hooked non-stop! It draws some parallels with other Anime MMOs however the characters and the overall premise gets more interesting as the game progresses. It is worth noting that the story is incomplete, yet there is plenty of progress to be made as of now. At the time of buying the game, the story ended relatively short from me. After a story update, and long time in exile from this game because i did all that could be done before, it managed to catch me back immediately.

Speaking of which, the game is indeed in early access and therefore incomplete. After you reach the end of the plot in its current state, you can explore the areas you wish and continue playing like you did before. This means that there are some areas that are available beyond the plot limitations, and if you complete a dungeon before the progress reaches that dungeon, the dungeon would stay complete. At least that's what happened to me.

i am not sure how these fancy steam reviews are supposed to work, but these are my two cents about it. For an incomplete RPG of this type, it managed to pull off (at the time of this review) a good 44.7 hours. Taking time and unnecessarily over-grinding tallyho!

This is a very very good and polished game, even in its current incomplete state. Buy it. It's offers a great and enjoyable experience at all times, and the updates only improve it as the game goes on. There is a demo ready and waiting if the reviews are not enough, but this game has managed to offer an amazing experience well worth the money. 

One of the only games which managed to make the word 'hi' and sandwiches rather symbolic...

34166433.review:
I really enjoyed the early content in CrossCode with a few minor frustrations with the cliff levels and the quest system being pretty barebones, however I found myself enjoying it less and less as the game progressed. The combat was quite enjoyable with a combination of melee and ranged and being able to switch between the options on the fly. However, I found as the game progressed I grew more and more frustrated with the enemies, with a lot of enemies required you to wait for them to use a specific attack in order to actually inflict damage. I found myself straight up avoiding combat in a game where a good chunk is intended to be about combat. 

A less significant frustration I had with the game was with the dungeon puzzle design. It's pretty good sometimes, but I found myself figuring out how to do a specific puzzle pretty quickly, but missing the actual action to complete it a couple of times and having to spend more time just going through the motions again. This was mainly in the timed puzzles with things like missing jumps due to icy ground or missing a shot and having to wait a few seconds to retry. A minor sidenote to this was how many puzzles you have to spend a few seconds to line up a shot up, although I can tell that the devs have tried to make this less annoying with the rebound puzzles in particular.

I ended up just giving up on the game partly into Farjo Temple (10-15 hours into the game if you like to complete most of the quests in an area before moving on) just because I found myself playing just because I'd already put in so many hours with several frustrations with the combat and puzzles just piling up into enough of an issue for me to not see the story through to the end and just play something else, which is a real shame because I was really interested in seeing how things panned out and the different town areas (which were really well done and very interesting to walk around in).

On a positive note, Crosscode has beautiful art and music throughout the portions of the game I played, and the character dialog is well written (I really liked the protagonist interactions in particular). I really enjoyed the towns, and that there were almost always things waiting for you to find if you just spend a little time exploring them. There are also a lot of little details (like party chatter and NPC conversations) scattered around the place that really nail the MMO world setting the game takes place in.

Overall, I have to say give this one a miss unless you think the art, music, and story is good enough that you can look past the issues with the combat later in the game and the other frustrating things scattered throughout the game.

33986628.review:
+精细丰富的场景
+精心的音乐
+一个好的故事架构
+完成度很高的act
+解谜内容很用心
-混乱鸡肋的装备体系
-鸡肋的道具体系
-鸡肋的任务体系
-怪物设定有些很恶心
-最大败笔弹射系统


>>序：

“寂寞是一个人的狂欢，狂欢是一个人的寂寞”
这句歌词不但想说这个游戏，也想说给作者听。
这是一款披着网游外衣的单机游戏，也是一款披着ARPG外衣的解谜游戏。而作者用他的坚持成就了一款有着良好架构背景的故事，作者也用他的偏执破坏了这个好故事下的体验。

>>初：

先感谢粉枪和作者的py，让我有幸有了这一次体验这款游戏的机会；
这款游戏有所耳闻，而且有过被安利的情况，游戏看过评论，口碑甚好。
初以为这是一款RPG，后来看到是ARPG，再后来感觉是一款跑图解谜，最后发现原来是射击解谜……
这是一款一个独立游戏制作人，从2015年上架至今还在更新进度的基于HTML5的游戏，不得不鼓掌，游戏整体质量偏上（是但从游戏的制作质量来说。）
但是所谓一白遮三丑，一胖毁所有。这款游戏可能注入了作者太多精力与心血，作者试图让这款游戏尽可能包容太多东西，导致游戏的体验会比较尴尬。

【以下可能会略带剧透，但是由于游戏未制作完成，本人也没有玩太久（10个小时的游戏体验），所以请放心的食用】

>>背景

1、剧情概要

游戏的主要故事为一个虚拟游戏ID为：莉亚的妹子因为失去了记忆，所以在游戏运维人员的帮助下来到这个虚拟世界寻找记忆的故事（而这个游戏是妹子在现实中的弟弟参与制作的，妹子的弟弟也因为过劳死[根据前面的一段小剧情推测]）由于游戏还在开发阶段，后续剧情都没有不全，所以至今除了作者没有人知道妹子的真正身份是什么，失去的记忆是什么，后面又有什么样的故事。
（个人无责任猜测是这个莉亚真的是虚拟人物，而且是诞生于虚拟游戏的虚拟人物，只不过因为某些原因[可能是因为现实中妹子本体弟弟的原因]，虚拟人物被当成了现实中妹子本体的替代品，还有一种猜测是现实中妹子的弟弟将自己意识虚拟化进入游戏了，现实中的弟弟死去，而现实中的妹子为了寻找弟弟，也尝试将自己的意识虚拟化，可能由于某些原因这个虚拟化的意识失去了记忆，而虚拟化的妹子就开始寻找记忆，找寻真相）

2、crossword世界（虚拟游戏世界）

而这个虚拟世界叫crossworld，但是这个crossworld又是真是的世界，（其实就相当于将某一个区域的人用一个连接方式将自己的虚拟化投影投在这个corssworld的世界，这个世界是真实的，非虚拟的，而crossworld世界的维护管理员其实只是起到了一个看门人的角色，并不能干预世界的运作。他们的作用只是维护投影到这个世界的人不受到干扰伤害，也禁止crossworld世界的原生物种跨出界线。

3、势力和形态

这个crossworld世界原生世界有四大元素，玩家也需要得到四大证明去踏上先民之路，寻找真相。

而这个世界又有四大势力，四大势力做着四类不一样的事情。我们在进入新手镇后会接触到这四个势力。

这个crossworld有本地居民和外来者，但是我们“玩家”可以自然区分，另外还有一部分“偷渡”的人，这部分人利用了漏洞（新手镇有个15级任务，那个角色就是个“偷渡者”

游戏分区域块，不同级别的任务在不同的区域，并且色彩明显（比如春天郊野、秋天树林、冬天雪山等）

>>表现

1、游戏是以复古像素2D风格演绎着看似是剧情形态的ARPG游戏，实质上更多的是射击+解谜。

2、作者近乎偏执的在一切可能让玩家接触的元素上都加入了——跳跃、跳跃、跳跃、弹射、弹射、弹射、割草、割草、割草；

3、游戏场景都是物理动态的，花草、流水、落叶、光影；而且在全部动态特效下，游戏基于HTML5还运行的比较流畅，作者功力可见深厚。

4、技能效果出众，四大技能体系、八大技能分支，在2D像素平面风的游戏里也可以如此出众，而且技能形态完成度很高，技能的判定也非常到位。

5、音乐与音效，个人认为音效做的非常好，尤其是环境音效，对于一款独立游戏来说，非常到位，细节之处非常棒。（山谷有风声，瀑布有水流，雪地有踩雪声，矿洞有回音等等。而BGM在我玩的两个大场景（第一个BGM总会突如其来的让我想起来东京hot，而第二个雪山的BGM非常有感觉，）总体来说音乐是成功的。

6、常规设定：常规设定一如其他的游戏套路（角色属性/升级/技能/装备/道具/天赋树/图鉴/ ；其中最值得称赞的是天赋树的设定，四大系，八个分支，实际上加点只需要点四个分支就可以自由切换八个分支的技能树；

>>问题

前面说了那么多，如果不了解的情况下肯定认为这款游戏非常棒，当然事实也是这款游戏单论质量是ok的，但是还是那句话“一白遮三丑，一胖毁所有”

这款游戏的“胖”点——游戏主体的本末倒置。

关于本末倒置的问题>>（或者说关于游戏重点方向的问题）

我玩过的很多独立游戏有这样一个很严重的问题，（国产独立游戏这个问题更显而易见）就是，宣传的和投入点，与游戏立项类型很偏离。（就是说我决定要做一个什么游戏，但是实际我的时间投入，物料投入偏偏与我决定的目标相偏离）

打个比方，国产很多做ACT游戏的，往往ACT都是这个游戏最弱的环节，反而一味地以场景/建模/CV/甚至剧本作为卖点，但明明游戏是ACT游戏啊，ACT系统做的却又很烂。

有的游戏，明明是推理解密类游戏，反而游戏的重心和卖点变成了立汇/CV/玩梗/卖肉卖腐等。


CrossCode是一款设定在遥远未来的复古2D动作RPG游戏。这里有红白机式的16位色画风和流畅的物理效果，有快节奏战斗和精巧的解谜系统，也有极富科幻色彩的剧情。

所以这个游戏类型的关键词是：动作/RPG（应该是APRG）、精巧的解密和科幻色彩的剧情剧情。

提取关键词，这款游戏首先是ARPG，其次包含了精巧的解密和丰富的剧情。而目前这款游戏ACT的部分做到了，精巧的解密部分做的太过了，科幻色彩的剧情，由于现在游戏未完成，坑太多，所以还没法子下结论。

按照我的理解，这款游戏，ACT是贯穿全程的，然后应该在剧情的演绎下嵌入解谜系统，而现在的状况是，剧情很乱，虽然有良好的框架，但是里面填的稀烂，ACT仅限于野外练级，练级只是为了进迷宫打任务。而任务就是解谜，所以最终剧情和ACT的部分都成为了解谜的前置铺垫，解谜才是这个游戏的本质。

而这个游戏的解谜体系简直让我觉得如果作者做这个游戏用了1年的时间，那么其中9个月的时间都在研究怎么设置谜题。

游戏的主要解谜玩法——跳跳乐/弹弹乐/躲躲乐；
相比于弹射系统，XYZ轴错乱的跳跳乐简直良心！
我看有人把这个游戏代入会说模仿塞尔达和刀剑神域设定。
但是我只想说，这个游戏始于解谜，也将终于解谜。

游戏里的迷宫和谜题我承认，都是精心设定的，哪怕都取出来拼成一个纯解谜类的游戏也是很棒的，然而一切罪恶的根源，来自于那个作者非常喜欢而又非常不符合人体工程学，反人类反手柄反鼠标的——弹射系统！！

>>恶心的弹射系统！

作者在游戏介绍里也说了，这是一款快节奏战斗的游戏，而且快节奏战斗，不但是在野外， 迷宫里也一样。而这一个先矫正瞄准，再带有蓄力的弹射系统，已经像一块膏药一样贴在了光滑的玻璃上，看着难受，摸着更难受。而且在怪物的类型设定上，有些怪物又是强制使用弹射去消灭的

战斗中，你能想象有些怪物你根本没法近身，你一靠近对方就瞬移，你根本摸不到他的身体，必须用弹射来消灭么！

而在迷宫解谜中，你必须用弹射进行瞄准，移动瞄准，瞬间瞄准、瞬发、蓄力瞄准、蓄力发射、移动发射这样的操作吗？


解谜很棒，解谜设定很棒，如果单纯的让我去解谜，我觉得会很愉快，解掉也会有成就感，而糟糕的弹射系统让我完全失去了解谜的耐心，尤其是在我一遍又一遍弹弹弹，弹走鱼尾纹的过程中读档、读档、读档再读档！

这感觉就像是，你很饿，你点了一个大餐，服务员把大餐端到你面前，你明知道伸手就够到了，结果他给打翻了，而且是在你面前一次又一次的打翻！

任务有等级压制我忍，打不过BOSS我要去野外频繁割草练级我忍，但是一遍又一遍用这个反人类的弹射让我去做那些干扰性那么强又非常别扭的，而且一不小心就要重来的和解谜无关的解谜动作，我不能忍。我当初玩黑魂3玩到那么心累，也只是会骂自己手残而已，但是这个我不能忍。

如果这个游戏完整形态有30个小时的周期，那么纯剧情可能只有7-8小时，练级可能只会占到7-8小时，剩下的时间都是在迷宫里解谜，而解谜不难，难得是一招错招招错的被弹射系统耽误的时间。一个迷宫的谜题可能我只需要20分钟就解决，但是加入了弹射机制的迷宫，可能我需要2个小时才能完成。

>>想不明白所以的版本阶段

玩游戏的过程中，我经常在怀疑我的人生，难道我就那么手残？于是我去网上找一些玩法视频和攻略视频看。

看过视频的我就学着人家视频里的玩法去做，但是……我更怀疑我的人生了！

凭什么人家可以轻易做到的我就做不到呢？为什么人家的可以空中冲刺我的不行呢？为什么人家的瞄准那么精确我的不行呢？为什么为什么呢！

后来我发现， 这款2015年上架的游戏，中途更新了很多版本，而不同版本游戏的一些设定是不一样的，而就我看视频对比的感觉来说，越早的版本，似乎游戏操作越人性化，越新的版本，操作越来越反人类……我不知道为什么这样做，我不懂。

>>最后的话

游戏是一个好游戏，我承认。
把这个游戏每一个部分单独拆开；
故事是一个值得推敲探索的故事；
ACT是一个无论效果还是判定都完成度很高的ACT
解谜是一个用了很多心思很多时间设定的解谜，很用心也很棒；
场景物理动态/音效也是很棒的制作水准；
然而拼在一起就问题凸显了，游戏的方向……玩法的内容占比上出现了偏差，这就让这款原本会很有趣的游戏，逐渐的失去让人玩下去的耐心。

游戏地图上一些NPC的关于游戏和作者的吐槽可以看出，作者本身在不断地制作更新的过程中，也逐渐的遗忘了一些东西，哪些是合适的，哪些是不合适的，作者似乎自己也乱了。

一款本身可以很棒的游戏，可能因为一个问题，就导致满盘皆输……
这款游戏，解谜原本应该是锦上添花，如今是夏日送碳！

游戏是好的，只是生了病。
作者是寂寞的，偏执的寂寞，寂寞似雪。

33919679.review:
I highly recommend this game to ALL action RPG gamers. I'm usually a turn-based RPG kind of person, and I generally hate real time combat. However, this game does it so well that even I enjoy the fighting. I love having both melee and ranged attacks, and really like that guarding and dodging are side-by-side – allowing for various styles of gameplay. The sprite art is gorgeous, the combat is enjoyable, and the areas are overall cleared with skill rather than levels or equipment. Even though I hate parkour (I have very shaky hands), it's manageable, even if the jumping is a bit finicky. Thankfully, there's no real penalty for falling off edges or into water besides losing hp, which regenerates outside of combat anyway. The regenerating feature and most of the fights being player-initiated are my favorite parts. It's so nice being able to go through the main areas without being ambushed. And thank GOD for quick travel. Although CrossCode is gameplay based, the story is interesting as well, and makes it much more worth playing.

Overall, amazing game, even though it's early access. Still more than worth the 20 bucks, and I can't wait until the full game comes out. Even as it is now, it's beyond worth playing. If you want to wait for the full game, that's fine, but you won't be disappointed with it if you buy now.

Pros:

- Customizable playstyles

- Challenging but enjoyable combat

- Engaging story

- Great soundtrack


Cons:

- Some things, like aiming, are difficult to pull off with a controller

- Jumping is a bit finicky

- Unfinished

33896915.review:
Highly recommended!!

Was looking for something with the snes zelda feel... and this game nails that and goes well beyond with unique gameplay, well developed characters, challenging puzzles, beautiful 16 bit art and hours of gameplay.

Pros:
- Nails a unique single player experience by creating a psuedo-mmo where you play with well developed NPCs that have believable personalities.
- Gameplay mimicks the better action RPGs, but creates many options and circuit system that recreates talent based play that can be changed mid battle.
- THE BEST early access game as far as content is concerned. The story is a bit behind the dungeon development, but what is in place is seemless and addictive.
- Some of the more challenging dungeon puzzle rooms that I've played, while still being doable.
- The audio tracks become more plentiful and better with every release. Have owned this game for some time now and seen every aspect improve exponentially.
- Armor system becomes unavoidable, as level alone will not allow you to defeat enemies past a certain point. This could be a con, but there are many ways and options for upgrading armor that add to the game, creating a need for strategic spending and weighing of options (Feels like I'm searching for the best option between 3 online shops).

Cons (I hate to say anything bad, but it is honest feedback)
- Certain rooms and challenges that require precise orb slinging seem more catered to mouse play. I had to switch to keyboard and mouse for some areas. This may be because I'm not as adept with a controller, but it feels like getting the precision to nail things with orbs across a room quickly and then get moving is much easier with a mouse and keyboard.
- I sat here for 30 minutes trying to think of another Con, but there aren't any. For the price, this is the most enjoyable and amazing game I've played in a long time. Reminds me of hours playing snes and sega games.

33857790.review:
This game is absolutely amazing.  I find the gameplay to be fast pased and the controls (gamepad for me) to be tight which makes for a good skill based game, meaning that you can overcome being underleveled or under equipped by the user playing the game better.  The game maintains throughout a good rate of increasing difficulty in congruence with equipment availability and unlocking more skills that make a real difference in gameplay.  In addition to this, you can use the combination of skills and equipment to really change how you approach battles, so you can play in a way that feels most natural to you.  Dungeon battles, not just bosses, are often challenging and require you to be well versed with your style of play.  Enemies also have a "break" state that often require a specific timing or procedure to "break" them for a short time, but allow you to do a significanly higher amout of damage making battles much easier versus brute forcing your way though them.  This creates diverse and engaging combat, especially when there are multiple types of enemies you're fighing at the same time.

Dungeon puzzles start off easy, but late in the game become quite difficult at times, but not impossible, and rewarding when you're able to figure them out.  Where puzzles in many games fail to nail the right level of challenge, this game succeeds.  Many of the late game puzzles are beyond brilliant when you consider how many levels there are to the puzzle yet managing to cram all of those levels into a concise space where many environmental features double or triple in their usage.  I would honestly like to shake then hands of the people who created them.  There are always subtle environmental elements that lead you in the right direction or give you just enough of a hint to figure out what you're supposed to be doing.  I cannot praise this enough as most games focus on creating an environment purely for the sake of immersion and fail to make the best use of the space available to them to enhance the manner in which the player interacts with the game.

Platforming is smooth and jumping is automatic thereby removing jumping fustrations common in many platorming games.  The one exception to this is the rare occasion when you can't tell exactly the height of a platform even after throwing a ball at it making it difficult to judge if you can make the jump to it.  Finding treasure boxes in the world by figuring out the often complex jumping path to get there makes for a great change of pace, though the rewards for doing so are often lackluster.

If you choose to do all the sidequests available to you, you don't need much grinding, if any at all, to keep up in level to where the game has been designed for you to be.  If however you are the type to focus on the storyline and skip a lot of sidequests, grinding will likely be needed on a continual basis depending on how skilled you are at overcoming the power gap.  Also, for those who are less patient when getting into a new game, the "tutorial-ish" section (tutorial + practice dungeon) is just a bit long (about 3 hours) before the game begins to open up.

I feel the graphics, sound effects, and music are all well above average for what it's trying to be; you can easily check them out for yourself above.  But if you don't like them, you don't like them, I'm not going to argue that you should.

At the time of writing this, the story has not been finished, but so far, to me, the story is kind of meh as it uses a slightly overused plot, especially so if you've watched mmo based animes.  However, each of the main characters provides a unique and interesting personality which is engaging in its own right and contributes to a game that succeeds in creating an immersive experience.

The amount of content in the game is good for probably 25 hours up to 50 depending on how good you are and how you decide to play it and the game isn't even finished yet.  It has a fair number of completionist elements, but has little replayability.  I really wish the game would offer online co-op as it is tailor made for it, but it doesn't sound like that will ever be an available feature.

For me (someone who has played video games most of my life), the level of challenge in battle and puzzles are perfect, but may be too difficult for others.  This is what I wish most of the 2D Zelda games were (apart from storyline/lore).
One of my favorite games ever.

33740210.review:
现在玩了30多小时，进度推到37级，来到了森林，在这里制作组直言有很多内容还没有完成，但是这不影响剩下的地牢和地图。我还是可以收集完所有的元素然后提前通关的，但我想了想，决定先告一段落，剩下的游戏内容打算留到正式版出来后再接着玩。现在来写个评测，希望对各位有帮助。

来聊聊我玩这个游戏的感受。
这个游戏绝对是2d arpg游戏中的上乘之作，有种2d巫师3的感觉，就已经完成的剧情部分来说，主线轻松又悬念百出，支线量足又不会乏味，就像置身于一部穿越动漫。
游戏的打击感十分赞，但首先，你需要有一点耐心，技能和属性攻击会在游戏流程中逐步解锁，不是一来就有的，换言之就是你前期只能平a，一旦解锁技能，这个游戏的打击感会更加出色。
同时，游戏有非常多的解谜要素，谜题难度适中，但在解谜的同时制作组还加入了一些操作上的难度，这让解谜关卡的总体难度上了很大一个档次，许多操作的容错率很低，再加上这游戏的地图系统比较简陋（静止平面地图），往往需要大量反复尝试才能过关，这一点我略有微词。
作为一个rpg游戏，它的收集要素也十分充足，有些地点需要反复思考，有些地方极为隐秘，有些地方需要很极限的操作......总之就是很难找全吧。再加上这游戏再网上也的确小众，攻略很少，讨论也很少，所以，你如果有收集癖或强迫症的话，该游戏可能会对您造成无法估计的伤害，但换言之，若是达成了全收集，那也会得到巨大的满足。
这款游戏属于纯正的arpg，它在继承所有arpg游戏的优点的同时，自己进行了改良和创新，最突出的就是战斗系统了，强烈建议键鼠操作，战斗的手感不同于我之前玩的所有arpg，这一点各位还是自己在游戏中感受吧。
最后说说画面和音乐，视角移动还算舒服，只是有些地形高低差一眼下来不是很好判别，你可以用远程攻击试一试。bgm不算出彩，将就着听吧，如果你长时间呆在一个图，那你就会被循环洗脑。。。

总的来说，我十分推荐购买这一款游戏，因为它十分耐玩也十分好玩，推荐给有耐心的喜欢rpg的玩家，就算全价入都是不亏的。

33734009.review:
好像是15年的游戏了，第一眼看到时我以为是RPGmaker游戏。也就没太关注，只是觉得卡通画风挺好的，我比较偏爱这种
然而第二眼就是一年多过去了，看见论坛里有中文化了的消息，而且价格也降低了，想着哪次降价再买好了。
没过几天突然发现有KEY可以申请，结果等了2~3个月，没通过也没拒绝，就告诉我失效了。
愿望单-1
第三眼就是昨天了，圣诞粉喵又丢了我个KEY，你猜是什么？
没错！
就是人工少女（雾） 

下载下来，发现居然只有373MB。
这个我到是没想到，现在的游戏怎么着也好几G了，据我所知这款游戏内容也算挺丰富的，竟然这么小。
打击感不俗。
运用了拉近震屏等手法，加大了震撼的感觉，然而像素风拉近就是超大的模糊像素，感觉很奇妙啊23333
任务种类繁多，可以做的事+1+1再+1。
估计全做完，游戏时间就要噌噌的上去了。
本身是一款单机游戏，但是却完全没有孤独感。
满地图的NPC造成你不是一个人的错觉，这点好厉害，以前很少见过有游戏愿意这样做的。

也许就是如此，让我联想起了当初打叶绿386的时候，于是充满了好感。 然后就玩的忘记录制时间了- -。

最后感谢制作组、汉化组、以及喵枪~


补充：
越玩的久越无法忽视两个对我来说极其致命的缺点。
一是任务目标过于粗糙，新手玩家不可能像开发小组一样清楚了解整个地图是如何构成的，只是单纯的像网络游戏却没有网络游戏的导航，导致你接了任务，却根本不知道去哪完成任务，就算你摸索个把小时找到了并且完成了，你又可能因为时间太久而根本找不到任务发布NPC，导致无法交换任务。
二是地图的层次感太过薄弱，平面并且是像素风格，本身就不容易分辨空间的围度，而该游戏经常有任务让你从第一阶，摸索方法跳到第二阶甚至是第三阶，耗时耗力，非常无趣。你只得靠发射子弹来判断对面建筑到底和你平行，还是比你高，这点非常差劲。
这两点对我来说就像是得到了西施，西施却有汗脚一样扫兴。
更改这两点应该不是小工作，但依然希望能改掉。

33646395.review:
[h1]Short and sweet:[/h1]
A hands-down recommendation from me.

On the pro side, the game is extremely polished. Everything from the combat system to the visuals and music are well put together, impressively so.
The biggest con is the sheer fact that the game is incomplete, hardly something you can fault the developers for. I greatly look forward to the completed product.

[h1]Slightly longer[/h1]
The developers have delivered an extremely polished experience, even if half the story is still missing (I'm guessing, we don't know where the story is going :D)

The combat system is challenging but visually clear. Openings and attacks are telegraphed but timings and damage numbers can have you sitting at the edge of your seat.
Personally, I found the game very challenging, but this is also something I'm personally drawn to. Your own experiences may vary.

There seems to be quite a bit of depth to how you approach your character's skill development and usage in combat encounters. Most encounters, however annoying, will have a weak spot you can exploit to push the fight in your favour.

Visually and aesthetically, I felt the game reminded me a lot of the Mega Man Battle Network series. The setting of an MMORPG gives a sense of life to the game, as other characters will always be running around you, doing their own quests and having their own adventures. It's simple, but gives the world a sense of being much larger than yourself.
A lesser gripe might be the fact that changes in equipment aren't visually represented in the game (so much so that an NPC comments on this fact during the storyline). Conversely, it doubles down on establishing a dverse set of main characters, colour scheme, contour, and all.

The worst element within the game strikes me as the equipment system. Despite the developer's efforts to make this part of the game more approachable, I still can't get my head around matching a character's level to appropriate equipment. In the end, I ended up slapping on the pieces that gave the biggest boost to the stats I wanted to work with. It's a shame,

In essence, despite a few gaps in the system, CrossCode delivers a beautiful and polished experienced, even at this point of development. If you're a fan of twitch-heavy combat, high difficulty and an anime-inspired art style and storyline, [b]I highly recommend this game[/b].

Nachdem ich jetzt den ersten Dungeon (und einige Nebenmissionen) abgeschlossen habe, verfasse ich nun eine kurze Review.
Als erstes möchte ich sagen, dass Early Access in diesem falle wirklich, wirklich gut funktioniert. So hat mir beispielsweie das kämpfen gegen Anfang des Jahres nicht einmal annähernd soviel Spaß gemacht wie nun. Mir sind bis jetzt auch noch keinerlei Bugs aufgefallen, was in Early Access auch nicht immer der Fall ist, leider.
Die Idee des Spiels, einer Art MMO funktioniert wirklich gut, so gefällt mir dieses Spiel deutlich besser als alle MMO´s, die ich bis jetzt gespielt habe (so 10 verschiedene). Die Steuerung funktioniert, zmdt. am Controller, auch erstaunlich gut. So war ich an keinem Punkt überfordert. Der Skilltree (ich nenne ihn mal so) ist auch nicht überfordernd, so ist er anfangs noch sehr klein (4 Pfade mit Erklärungen) und [spoiler]
erst im 2. Dungeon wird er komplizierter, da er durch ein neues "Kampfelement", erweitert wird.[/spoiler]
Die Musik im Hintergrund ist auch wirklich passend und motivierend, allerdings nie aufdringlich oder nervig.
Die Pixelgrafik tut dem Spiel auch gut und ist sehr passend.
Würde ich eine Kaufempfehlung aussprechen? Eindeutig ja. Würde ich sagen, dass man auf die versprochenen 60h Spielzeit kommen kann? Auch ja. Wenn man nicht sicher ist, ob es einem gefällt, gibt es auch noch eine Demo.

33541104.review:
This game is fantastic. And while I've only just made it to the first "real dungeon," I have a lot I can say about it. Keep in mind this is still in early access so all of this is subject to change.

[h1]First the good:[/h1]
 
[olist]
[*][b]The art style is beautiful.[/b] It captures that retro feeling while having some of the best sprite art I've ever seen. You can feel real emotion in the dialogue sections, even if your main character can only nod and say her name. The detail in the world is great. I love how little sections of the world disappear to reveal passageways and secrets.

[*][b]The combat.[/b] The combat is fairly difficult, and at times feels a little overwhelming, especially when dealing with multiple enemies, but never unfair. I really enjoy the break system to counter really powerful attacks. I love how fluid the combat feels. Transitioning from ranged attacks to melee is smooth and simple. Dodging feels natural, and pulling over cool tricks with the arts system (I think that's what it's called?) is amazing. I also really enjoy how you can switch between the branching talents at any time for no cost. Additionally, while some stats may seem a little vague, there's an extensive help screen that extensively explains anything you click on in a menu, which I find really helpful.

[*][b]The puzzles.[/b] From the dungeons to the little puzzles hidden throughout the zones, each one feels fair and fun to complete. Probably my favorite puzzle so far was the little monk quest right before the first dungeon, which was a test of your shooting and blocking abilities. I especially like the little jumping puzzles you need to complete in order to get to certain areas of the map. While I'll talk about some of the pitfalls (hehe) of the jumping system later, finding your way through the map feels great. 

[*][b]The feel of the game in general.[/b] It feels like you're playing an MMO, which is fantastic. The characters you meet feel real and talk about the game itself without making it seem too forced and game-y, if that makes sense. The flow from quest to quest feels great, even if some of the quests are a little boring, but that might be because I'm still in the second zone. I think having a game that feels like you're actually playing an MMO is one of this game's biggest strengths.
[/olist]

[h1]And now for some of the bad stuff[/h1]

[olist]
[*][b]Jumping.[/b] I'd say the jumping system is about 80% good at the time of this review. Some jumps can be difficult to judge. There have been countless times where I thought I'd definitely be able to make a jump only to have it actually be slightly too high, where it looked like it'd be the same layer. I think a good idea for the devs would be to add a toggle-able layer in-game that shows what height you're on and what else is at that current height.

[*][b]The tutorial.[/b] The opening section of the game can really drag on a bit. I think you get to the first real open section about 3 hours in? The tutorial is packed with story and guidance, though I can see why this might turn some people away.

[*][b]Some UI elements.[/b] When you have a quest tracked on the main screen it can obscure your vision of that area. There's no way to resize it or change it's opacity as far as I know. Also the way the stats menu is set up sometimes makes me think the value is for the stat that isn't directly across, but one below that. That's entirely due to the design of the menu and I would like this changed to avoid further confusion.
[/olist]

Overall, I think CrossCode is a fantastic game despite its few minor flaws. If you enjoy a good ARPG with a great story and an MMO feel, I'd definitely get this game.

33512122.review:
[h1]Review: CrossCode[/h1]

[b][u]Dieses Spiel verdient viel mehr Aufmerksamkeit![/u][/b]
Ich habe dieses Spiel kennengelernt, als ich geholfen habe einiges ins Deutsche zu übersetzen und ich war absolut begeistert!

[b]Zum Setting:[/b]
Das Spiel spielt auf dem Planeten Shadoon, auf dem es ein Spiel namens CrossWorlds gibt. Hier sind die Spieler eng mit allen Sinnen ihrer Avatare verbunden und haben die Aufgabe, dem "Pfad der Urväter" zu folgen. So erinnert das ganze ein wenig an Sword Art Online.

[b]Zur Story:[/b]
Vorab, ich habe die Story bei weitem noch nicht durchgespielt und befinde mich noch relativ weit am Anfang. Doch bereits hier war ich bereits von Anfang an gefangen! Die Charaktere sind sympathisch und der Dialog ist exzellent geschrieben.
In diesem Spiel, spielt man als Lea, einem Avatar. Lea hat ihr Gedächtnis verloren und kann außerdem, aufgrund einer Fehlfunktion ihres Sprachmoduls nicht mehr sprechen. Man glaubt, dass man ihr Gedächtnis wieder herstellen kann, wenn sie CrossWorlds spielt und so beginnt die Reise.
Vielmehr möchte ich garnicht verraten, aber ich kann bestätigen, dass die Story es wert ist gespielt zu werden.

[b]Zum Gameplay:[/b]
Das Spiel kann man mit Maus und Tastatur oder mit Gamepad spielen, jedoch bevorzuge ich das Gamepad, obwohl auch die Maus und Tastatur Steuerung sehr gut funktioniert. Das Spiel hat ein [b]Echtzeit, Action Kampfsystem[/b] und man kombiniert Ranged und Melee Angriffe und seine Skills um seine Gegner Stilvoll zu bezwingen.
Da hier ein Spiel in einem Spiel simuliert wird, hat man viele [b]Elemente aus MMORPGs[/b]. Jedoch ist der MMO Teil nicht echt ;). Alle anderen Spieler sind NPCs und dienen dazu die Atmosphäre eines MMOs aufzubauen. RPG Elemente gibt es jedoch genug, wie etwa neue Skills, Buffs, Perks, Ausrüstung, etc. Zuletzt ist meiner Ansicht nach die Balance zwischen Haupt- und Nebenquests sehr gut gelungen.

[b]Zum Sound:[/b]
Die Musik ist sehr angenehm und die Soundeffekte sind gelungen, jedoch nicht herausragend.

[b]Zur Grafik:[/b]
Das Spiel hat einen [b]großartigen Artstyle[/b], der dem Spiel so eine besondere Atmosphäre verleit. Weiterhin sind die Charakter-Portraits auch sehr gelungen und sehen super aus. Auch wenn man mit Art dieser Art nicht so viel anfangen kann, lohnt es sich dem Spiel eine Chance zu geben.

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Das Spiel sieht super aus, das Gameplay macht Spaß und der Sound ist gut! Weiterhin hat es einen großartigen Humor und eine interessante Story der man gerne folgt. Das MMO Gefühl wird super rübergebracht und die Charaktere sind glaubwürdig und symphatisch.
So, von mir aus ist das Spiel eine [b]definitive Kaufempfehlung[/b], es lohnt sich wirklich hier mal reinzuschauen! Wenn man sich nicht sicher ist, würde ich vorschlagen die Steam Demo zu probieren, um sich selbst zu überzeugen!

33459219.review:
An amazing product already with dozens of hours of gameplay for a low price point, and the game isn't even finished yet!

CrossCode is an action RPG following the main character Lea who plays the silent protagonist.  Knowing nothing about her past she is thrust into an adventure of discovering what events have lead to her current situation.  Although a common cliche of RPG's the silent protagonist is pulled off in a unique and amusing way and later dialogue choices are unlocked.  The characters you meet are decently written and the dialogue does a good job entertaining and telling the story.  I just finished the first major dungeon and I can't believe I have almost 15 hours logged (and this just unlocked the first of 4 skill trees!).

The pacing is moderate.  A more experienced action RPG enthusiast looking for a steep challenge can rush through the areas with what equipment is available or you can digest the areas and take time to appreciate the out of the way treasures tucked all over.  The game keeps track of your treasure completion rates and even after sinking 4 hours into the "mine" dungeon I'm still missing 2 chests... how is this possible... what trickery is this!???... 
Needless to say for a completionist this game will keep you busy and it does a good job teasing your brain with many solutions requiring planning out from several maps away or looking at puzzles in a different light.

The quests are decent.  Some of the dialogue is charming, for example one quest sends you on an information gathering mission... which proves difficult with your mute characteristic.  Several spirtes for your portrait are in the game and you can watch your characters frustration grow with your own.  Overall the quests add some meat and lighten the mood while providing useful items to advance the main story.

The sound in the game is decent.  It doesn't elicit any strong emotions, but it's enjoyable enough that I can listen to it while trying to hunt down all of those chests without getting annoyed by it.

Controls are suprisingly natural.  I played with a mouse and keyboard setup which seemed to work well.  Aiming with the mouse for projectiles was particularly satisfying since I knew exactly where my shots would land right away.

Combat is fairly challenging.  Even with an average gear level and a good level many fights proved extra challenging and make sure that I'm not dozing away while hacking aimlessly.  Many enemies have weakenesses that can be exploited such as returned projectiles.  The character has a progression tree that allows them to focus on defense, dodging, ranged, or close quarters combat.  These trees expand when the elements are obtained.  This feature isn't fully complete at this time but already adds a good level of customization that lets you feel the effects during combat, sometimes by modifying an attack or adding a perk (regeneration!)

Exploration: There is a platforming element with many objectives that require timed and precise jumps and there are time attack courses.  The puzzles also take some thinking through and feeling your way through them unlocks items so that you feel rewarded for your time investment.

I feel like that is a ton more I could say but this has already dragged on long enough.  For a small development team this project is polished and enjoyable.  The game plays well and is challenging.  Reccomend it to everyone except for those that have a hard time with moderately difficult games as even with gear stacking there are some areas that will take skill to beat without being crushed by frustration.  Two big thumbs up!

TL/DR: BUY THIS GAME.  You owe it to yourself.

33439559.review:
This is a labor of love for the developers, clearly. Fast and tight controls, perfect controller support, interesting and well made level design, interesting story, stable, really well made. And it's getting updates all the time, so it's not the usual abandoned early-access game.

But before going into it, be very aware what type of game this is. It's singleplayer, but emulating an MMO. So while there are other NPCs running around acting like players, and continual party chat from your friends, it is an offline MMO. It's also not a typical RPG, but rather an action/platforming game. So there are two MAJOR points to understand:

1. The game is a grind. Leveling up is not fast. Gathering materials for crafting is not fast. Completing collection quests is not fast. You have to be prepared to grind like an MMO to make progress, particularly since most equipment of value needs to be crafted from those rare drop materials.

2. This is a parkour game. Chests need to be jumped to. Crossing many maps means jumps. Even the second city is one big maze of multi-level jumps. Quests have you jumping to hard-to-reach platforms. Many paths take you several screens away to find the route up to where you need to be and 1 missed jump means starting over. 

But if you can handle the parkour and the grind, the game is very well made.

33388168.review:
I'm not the kind of person who generally likes to buy games for more than 10 dollars, but I tried out the demo of CrossCode and decided to take a chance on it. I have to say that I am more than satisfied with my purchase even though the game won't be finished until next year.

The story is very engaging - you are playing as a person who is, themselves, playing an MMO in the distant future. You've also lost your memory, which while a bit cliche is handled quite well, and your server connection is glitched so that you can't speak beyond a couple of hard-coded words which to me is the best implementation of a silent protagonist I've seen in ages. Despite being an entirely singleplayer game, CrossCode manages to create an experience immersive enough to feel like an actual MMO - "other players" can be seen running around on basically every map and have exactly the kind of dialogue you'd expect an MMO player to have. Your party members are accessed via a contacts list and can be called and dismissed more or less at will, but only if they're online and you aren't in an instanced area.

The combat system is pretty great. The best way I can describe it is that it's something of a mixture of Torchlight and Dark Souls. You have access to blocking and dodging from the start of the game and will need to use them constantly to have any degree of success in the game, but the game's forgiving enough that you can take a few hits and still be okay. You have both melee and ranged attacks, and there are enemies that will force you to use both kinds of attacks as early as the first overworld map. Projectile bouncing in particular is a fundamental mechanic of the game and is used in almost every puzzle. Enemies all behave differently and have their own attack patterns and weaknesses, which you will need to learn in order to beat them effectively. If you can stay in combat long enough you boost the drop rate which is very helpful (sometimes necessary) for gathering items, but this comes at the cost of not having access to out-of-combat regeneration. As you progress you unlock elemental modes, which change your damage type and available attacks, as well as your abilities. More on that below.

The gear system is mostly based on trading items with NPCs - these can be found as drops from enemies or destroyable objects, from chests, as quest rewards, or as part of a chain of deals. Each traded item has its own stats and its own special effects, usually up to 2 of them per item, and there are a [i]lot[/i] of special effects in this game. You could, for example, have improved invulnerability frames on dashing, reduced aiming time, improved damage when hitting an enemy during its attack, added health regeneration during combat (which starts at 0%, so it's actually very useful even at low values), and another 8 or so effects, and this is just from equipment. Gear provides most of your stats, so it's important to keep it upgraded or you'll probably get wrecked when you try to go to a new area, but you should be able to get most of the items for at least a couple pieces of gear just from doing side quests.

The level-up system is a node-based skill tree rather like a simplified version of Final Fantasy X's Sphere Grid or Path of Exile's passive tree. You start with a non-elemental skill tree - its passive abilities are always active but lose 50% of their potency when you're in an elemental mode. As you progress through the game you will gain access to elemental skill trees, which are only active while their respective element is active.

Some parts of the skill trees involving your active skills have two tracks - only one track can be active at a time but you can swap branches whenever you're out of combat and both branches merge back together after 3 nodes. Very few of the active skills feel useless, though some are more situational than others and every player will probably develop their own set of favorites as they play. (One of mine is the non-elemental single-target dash move, which is exceedingly effective at damaging most bosses and conveys a period of invulnerability when its charged version connects that has saved my life on more than one occasion.)

The dungeons in the game are Zelda-style dungeons, and are instanced so you can't take party members with you. The story dungeons are surprisingly long, almost too much so - they're probaly around 1.5-2x as long as what you'd expect from an actual Zelda dungeon. Each dungeon has quite a lot of puzzles, which is most of why they are so long, but they are extremely well designed and build on each other masterfully. In the first dungeon, you go from throwing bombs at rocks/blocks/enemies, to throwing explosives spawned by enemies, to shooting explosives to make them rocket off farther than you can throw them, to throwing and then shooting explosives to get them around corners, to throwing and shooting explosives around corners to launch a block in various directions while you're standing on it. There are also various smaller side dungeons scattered around, most of which are involved in a quest and are usually more challenging than the required dungeons.

There are some jumping puzzles as well, which can be a bit hit or miss as it can be hard to tell whether something can be jumped to or not. The most reliable way to tell is usually to fire a projectile and see how close its shadow is when it passes over your destination, or if it bounces off. When they work, though, they work very well - some of the jumping puzzles are just ingenious.

Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes action-based RPGs. The story is great, the combat is great, the gear and leveling system is great, the dungeons/puzzles are great, and there are even some obnoxiously hard but not entirely unfair parts for the people who like that sort of thing.

At the moment (version 0.9.5-3), the story content ends about 25 hours in but is supposedly 30-40% of the way through the game, so you can expect to be playing for 80 hours or more on a first playthrough. For a 20 dollar game I'd call that a pretty good return on money spent. There's a demo available if you're on the fence - the demo ends just after the tutorial boss so you can get a feel for the story and mechanics of the game and decide for yourself if it's the kind of thing you'd be interested in.

33281221.review:
[h1]这是一款难度堪比黑魂，画面十分精致的硬派ARPG游戏。[/h1]
[strike]（之前100+r，现在永降至88r，而且这几天（11.23）黑五降价为75r，有官中，比同样做像素的某某鱼好多了，还不快买买买？）。[/strike]
sfc式的16位画风，流畅的物理效果，引人入胜的剧情设定，爆棚的打击感，一定会给你不停的惊喜。
玩家在其中设定是扮演一个失忆的少（yan）女（yi），在未来世界中最著名的虚拟现实网游“Cross Worlds”（SAO？@桐人）中冒险并寻找记忆的故事。

整体的优缺点评价：这游戏是我生日，也就是6.10那天我朋友喵灵送我的。当时看了他的（xia）评测之后就把这游戏加入了愿望单，后来就成为了我的生日礼物。再次感谢喵灵dalao。
[b]优点：[/b]
1）抛开剧情不谈（以防剧透），流畅的打击感和较完美的“网游”社交系统，名词和氛围，如好友直连，公会，PVP，副本等，在第一次打开游戏时让我耳目一新。（只是NPC们还是只能重复那几句话，不停绕地图转圈有点让人脱戏。）[h1]真的非常期待真·联机模式出来的那天。[/h1]

2）充实的“网游”世界设定，丰富的细节，支线任务和丰富的技能盘都是让人能够瞬间被吸引的特色。
而且杀怪时还有等级评分设定，从D-S级，不同等级评分有不同的掉落物，具体掉率和等级要求可以在图鉴中查询。

3）尽管只有近战，射击，防御，闪避四种行动模式，但却十分硬核，比如在受伤瞬间攻击进行弹反，找准敌人弱点进行破防，通过蓄力打出更高的伤害和技能，用射击来远距离解谜等。地图的自由度也是很高的，一些墙头栏杆只要你能跳上去就能在上面跑。

4）搭档NPC在打怪时的自言自语和互相吐槽十分可爱，感觉真的是自己在和朋友一起在边玩游戏边聊天一样。
当然了网游里的那些所谓正义侠在这款游戏里面也是有的，比如有个绿毛一直怀疑主角开过挂，然后找事，被我狠揍一顿。
[strike]（第一次揍这小子的时候没准备好，输了，然后第二次约战我比他高一级而且DPS非常高，总算是报了仇。哦对了这两天官方还有表演揍这小子的视频比赛，奖品是可以在游戏里添加你自己命名的NPC或者其他东西。（比如菊花命名的叫做菊花的花怪？）[/strike]

5）而且主角在说话时的魔性颜艺和奖励码所提供的只有寥寥几句的魔性语音也是让人很是着迷。

6）怪物的攻击和伤害判定也是十分有特点，比如前期地图上的牛，会锁定角色冲撞+捶地。而且它前半身的样子是金属的，后半身才是正常的肉身，也就是说玩家需要攻击到它的后半部分才能进行有效伤害。
还有一些怪物和boss，必须玩家做出相应的攻击才可以进行强力的攻击。就比如第一个大副本的最终boss，需要你用火属性技能推动炸弹三次打中它才能破防，进行有效攻击。而这些，都可以从怪物的外貌和攻击模式来判断。

7）再然后就是画面部分了，emm，我也不知道该怎么说，各位自己进游戏去感受吧。
【这条算特点】因为剧情尚未完善，而且为了更好让玩家体验到游戏的精彩，游戏设置了预设存档，让玩家能够直接体验到游戏最精彩部分（副本和剧情pvp）。
8）原生的音乐，让人在游玩过程中也能得到心灵上的享受，尤其是进入盖亚森林的城市中时，被背景音乐和地图的宏大视觉观感所震撼到了。

说完优点，咱们来说一下[b]缺点[/b]：
1）解谜元素略显单调，高难度的解谜，经常跑遍好几个地图才能解开一个机关，然后开的宝箱得到的却是一些打草就能得到的物品和一些无关紧要的血药。过度注重跑酷有些过于喧宾夺主。而且地图的Z轴比较模糊，有时你看着能跳过去，但其实那块地方比你高一个头。当然了玩久后习惯了也就能自己判断出来了，实在不行射一下看看会不会被反弹回来就知道了。

2）怪物的攻击十分的高，一般除非你的攻击力更高能莽一波，不然在敌人攻击时基本除了防御就是无解，而且防御也有限度和角度，也会被破防和没防到。而且怪物的攻击是可以推动你的，一旦你被推下悬崖或者河流里就只能乖乖多受一波伤害。

3）手柄的操作略尴尬，防御和攻击不成一体，而且手柄的射击精度也较低。个人建议还是用键鼠较好。

4）RPG游戏特有的刷刷刷过程较为枯燥，而且你等级高了之后打低级小怪除非评分等级足够高，不然一只怪一般只有1-4点的经验值。当然了你可以通过接任务和击杀更高级的怪物来获取高额的经验，而且角色的等级经验条都是固定1000点不变，所以这一点不是太过于担心。

[h1]游戏作者是懂游戏的人[/h1]

[strike]啊啊啊啊，没有新版crosscode玩我要死了[/strike]

33253260.review:
This is a game that I have had my eye on for many months. It looked really interesting but I wasn't really willing to shell out $20 for it since most early access games have disappointed me in the past. Now that the steam summer sale is here and the price dropped I finally decided to give it a chance. I am only about 4 hours in at the time of writing this but let me tell you, this game is amazing!

 The soundtrack for this game is absolutely perfect and, in my opinion, is possibly the strongest point of the game. I have also found myself liking most of the characters that have been introduced in so far and the combat is very fast paced and rewarding. When I first looked at the game I thought the combat would be similar to a hack and slash. Easy, button mashing nonsense. I am very pleased to see that this is definitely not the case. While I definitely wouldn't call it a complicated system it does take some practice to get the hang of it. The game rewards skill and punishes mindless button mashing (at least in the parts I've seen so far). The hardest part, for me at least, is learning the fighting patterns of the new creatures you encounter, especially if you end up fighting a mix of several different monsters at once. The monsters themselves also do a fair amount of damage if you do get hit so it definitely pays to learn how to dodge early. Of course, I do have to mention that the graphics are very nice. Colorful, sharp and just generally pleasing to the eye.

My only complaint is that the start of the game is very slow paced and holds your hand for a bit too long for my liking. On the bright side, once it's over you're free so there's that. I also understand what many other people have said about the quest system. It can definitely be a bit of a nuisance trying to find out where exactly you are supposed to go but it would be a real stretch to say it takes away from the game's quality. Since I like to take my time and explore these kinds of games I usually end up finding my way sooner or later. 

Overall I would give this game a 9/10. Excellent music. Engaging combat system. Great graphics. Likeable characters. Challenging gameplay. Thank you for doing an early access game justice devs, keep up the great work!

33250157.review: Awesome game. Great feedback and dev support. No complaints. Now buy this game you fool!

33249250.review:
Was pretty psyched for the game when I checked out the gameplay trailers a couple months back, and I feel like I got most of what I was promised.

Environment is really nice. The respective color schemes for different areas match really well. Music is fun, whether it's the combat theme or the area theme. Overall, the visual aesthetics are really clean. I just wish 80% of the npc sprites weren't generically grey.

The characters in the game are limited, but are expressed fairly well. There's a couple of characters from the introductory chapter (who probably never make another appearance) that I actually liked a lot.

Combat in this game feels really good. It's actually insanely good relative to other games. It's fast, responsive, and impactful. The game does a good job of stretching your combat capabilities to their limits without being too frustrating; I tried to play a lot of the early parts of the game without ever using my shield. Bad idea.

I have OCD, so I spent a ton of time doing parkour trying to collect all the items in the various areas. It pissed me off. Is it good parkour? Probably, but I spent too much time frustrated to appreciate it.

Puzzles in the temple areas were fun. Parkour puzzles, less so :[

Missions were actually pretty fun. There's a nice variety in mission types, so plenty of different things for you to do. Rewards are pretty hefty too.

The game at this point is still in early access, so don't expect a complete product. The most significant portion of the game that seems to be lagging behind is the story. The most interesting story setup and development somehow all happened in the introductory chapter. Pretty disappointing.

I'm going to give it a 7/10 at this time, but I'm ready to change that as the game continues to develop. It's probably worth your money in its current state, so pick it up if you liked the demo a lot.

33133214.review:
[b]这款游戏就像一位多年未见的老朋友，让我念起了许多往事。[/b]

良性bug：
大跳：跳跃一瞬间，举盾(或近战攻击)+冲刺（可以去很多跳不过去的地方）。

[h1]闲聊[/h1]
游戏的剧情采用的是近年流行的网游话题，不禁想起初次见到此类剧情内心是激动的，因为儿时就常常幻想自己能进入到游戏世界里（笑）。游戏中玩家将扮演失亿少女Lea一步一步在虚拟世界（CrossWorlds）里找回记忆、揭开真相。

那么问题来了，如果现实科技真的达到了，人的肉体死亡，精神却可以保留在数字世界里，这个人还是之前那个人么？真实和虚幻的界限就如同游戏名一样Crosscode，真假不分，，但代码程序毕竟是人创造出来的，这样的后果是什么？能够见到死去的人，见到永远不会坏的东西，见到所有的东西都是美好的，只要想随随便便就能造出来一个桃花源。但是“真实”的么？还是变得会怀疑自身的存在是不是真实，真假错综。又或者这个咱们的世界，这个世界本身就是场游戏，大家其实都是另外一个世界的代码，只是没意识到是真实的。

扯远了（笑）。

游戏序章（虚拟世界），静的弟弟智史，可能在现实中已经不能活动了，被其他人绑架或者自愿在虚拟世界里“继续”编写着某种程序，在游戏过程中Lea每次下线都会来到一个类似测试的地方，这可能是静的记忆，静和Lea很可能不是一个人。那会不会静回不到现实世界了呢，弟弟被迫完成某种协议就可以放姐姐回到现实？出现在M.S号上和山顶上的蓝色虚拟人物就是静？当然了这都是个人的想象，就等他们怎么去讲这个故事了。后期再整系统错误，导致跟《刀剑神域》那种在游戏中死亡现实中也死亡就有意思了（笑）。

[h1]游戏[/h1]
游戏中，玩家可以利用四种元素来到达某些去不了的地方，有的谜题也需要互相配合。有《黄金太阳》的有影子（那游戏真的很棒），谜题设计的我感觉十分有趣，但有些冗长。有些解密的地方对手法要求不“幼儿园”，但熟能生巧练练就能过了。我感觉很不错的在难度掌控这块。有些谜题是真的挺有意思也很折磨人(笑），重要的再说一遍。

掉率设置的也十分有想法，之前玩过的RPG都是固定的，他这个就很微妙，打怪能提高评分，评分越高掉率越高。

我个人是非常不喜欢MMORPG的，山口山也好，FF14也好包括像ARPG暗黑那种刷刷刷的我个人都有点厌烦。这游戏中的游戏设置的就是MMORPG，在这种画风下我竟然刷的还挺起劲（笑），走主线没有故意刷过物品，基本上一路通关，除非打不过，掉血太慢，这时候才会去刷材料，支线任务做的挺用心的，大部分是不同的，除了MMORPG的通项找材料，打怪，升级，刷材料，打怪，升级，刷材料，打怪，升级，刷材料（笑）。

剧情引人入胜，脍炙人口的失忆也容易让人带入角色，而且主角只会说hello，byebye，lea等等也是挺逗人乐的，很多RPG主角都是不说话的（例如..伊苏（笑）)，这个不同了为了掩饰这点用这个代替了。各种颜艺的表情包呀（笑）。

游戏是html5的impactjs框架做的，在我印象里反正带Html都是类似flash的网页小游戏，反正我是第一次见到这么精良的html5作品。


[h1]简评[/h1]
不成熟的建议：
*可以在前期地图放一些，波和电元素的箱子。
*希望可以给查看地图设置一个快捷键。
*手柄瞄准太糟糕了，可能辅助瞄准和操作很难平衡。
*前期教程很好，长度可以改短些。

+很用心的作品（各处细节可以看出）
+远程攻击方式设计的十分巧妙
+手感很棒

-手柄瞄准优化不好
-部分内容太繁琐

个人评分：8.5分 
睹目思人，触景伤怀。
20余年，与人共鸣。

[b]最后感谢轻语工作室的汉化。更感谢从120多降到88（笑）[/b]

33097654.review: CrossCode is a brilliant game. It manages to be an homage to classic action RPGs like Secret of Mana with its gameplay, the original .Hack series with its story and setting, while bringing enough fresh new elements to stand on its own. The combat is  fast paced, but still leaves room to think and plan. The difficulty is challenging, but not frustrating. The level design is some of the best I've ever seen, and is topped only by the design of the boss fights. This may be RadicalFish's first game, but they have shown the sort of dedication, innovation, and attention to detail that is rarely seen even from industry veterans.

33058405.review:
An Action RPG that introduces you to a world comparable to that of an MMORPG, as seen from the eyes of our protagonist, Lea. An experience so immersive that at times you can feel that you're playing one of those older massive multiplayer online games, with friends following you around and fighting alongside you (and lots of random people running around, too.)
The dungeons have lots of puzzles that use that will keep you entertained for a while.

And at the moment of this review, a new update has just been released, which added a more story among other features (previously, there was about 15-20 hours of content). But from the notes, I can tell that the team behind this gem is working hard to polish it as much as they can. So if you like action RPGs, pick it up and give it a try.

33024253.review:
糟糕的升级经验设计、糟糕的任务与装备...
       首先是升级，大量的高级任务高级怪，高出主角好多级，完全是被怪物等级碾压，而主角想提升等级却是何等的艰难，几乎没什么好的经验获取方式，只能拼命的用肝来换取勉强达到任务难度的等级，各种繁杂的支线任务，几乎没有任何提示与明显的指引，只能根据少的可怜的任务文本来推测任务地点，以及浪费大量的时间来跑遍地图的每一个角落来寻找任务地点。
       接着你以为等级勉强够格就能打的过任务怪与BOSS了？错！你还没装备，这游戏的装备要消耗大量时间去收集大量材料，而且有些材料的掉落还特别稀有（别以为你终于刷齐材料就能松口气了，制作装备还要一笔不小的钱）
       最终装备做出来后你会发现属性还不怎么样，只够刚好勉强达到挑战BOSS以及任务怪的资格，想打过任务怪或者BOSS，你还需S/L大法+极限操作+靠NPC队友帮你拖延BOSS让你苟（吃）活（药），NPC队友如果死了，那就只能靠你自己的极限操作来苟命了。这个地图的装备进入下个地图马上就会被淘汰，而你不做装备又打不过当前地图的任务怪与BOSS............
       你以为自己玩的是单机，其实当你玩起来之后就会发现玩的是爆肝网游，用了9个多小时才过了图1进了图2，而且图1还有大量不明所以的支线或者找不到任务点的任务没做

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

说点好的：剧情引人入胜，优美的音乐，优秀的复古画风。

但是这些优点都被上面的缺点给掩盖了，毕竟这是个单机游戏，不是看图说话的Galgame，一旦玩起来就被会这些涉及游戏各方面的糟糕的设计搞的心情糟糕透顶，完全玩不下去...
33024253.developer_response: 您好，游戏本身有一定的PRG元素，打怪升级，寻找相应的素材是游戏的几个基本的玩法，目前游戏正在EA阶段，针对您提供的这些信息，我们会将您的意见反馈给开发人员，并且在后续的更新中不断改进的。感谢您的支持！

33020751.review:
Habe mir dieses Spiel über das Summer-Sale-Event genehmigt.
Ich selbst liebe RPG-Spiele welche über den RPG-Maker und Konsorten programmiert und entwickelt wurden.
Bin daher aufgrund der Steam-Prognose als geeignetes Spiel darüber gestoßen (habe zuletzt Rabi-Ribi durch gespielt)
Bin jetzt ununterbrochen seit 11 Stunden dieses Spiel am spielen.

Folgende Sachen sind mir bis jetzt erwähnenswert:

- auch wenn dieses Spiel nur zum Teil in Deutsch zu spielen ist, ergeben sich keine hoch komplizierte englische Begriffe
- die Musik ist zwar nicht die Allerbeste, unterhält und unterstreicht dennoch sehr gut das Spielgeschehn
- die Mmorpg-Elemente sind hammer gut umgesetzt; viele Featurs (humorvolle typische Questgebung; andere Player laufen einem über den Weg; Sozialelemente via Gruppeneinladungen und vieles mehr (will nicht zu viel spoilern)  
-> ein sehr großes Lob
- die Story (bis jetzt) ist sehr lebhaft gestaltet; gesunde Aufteilung von Sammelquests; Nebenquests und Hauptquests
- forderndes Kampfsystem mit Schwächeermittlung (genau wie bei Rabi-Ribi liebe ich es etwas schwerer bei Jump and Run RPGs)
- ein bis jetzt sehr umfangreicher aber nicht unübersichtlicher Fähigkeitenbaum
- einfache und dennoch umfangreiche Menügestaltung der Enzyklopadien (Bio; Charackter; Monster; ... etc.)

Es mag vllt. im ersten Moment abschreckend sein, dass sich dieses Spiel in der Early-Phase befindet (dank anderen tollen Vertretern diese Phase); dennoch kann/darf ich mit gutem Gewissen dieses Spiel als ein sehr fortgeschrittenes Spiel bezeichnen, welches (bis auf die Sprachumsetzung) keinerlei Baustellen erkennen lässt.

Kaufempfehlung meinerseits!

33004104.review:
2d动作解密游戏水平相当高的一作，按照官方说法是2018年发布正式版，目前游戏里对于主线剧情的描述都很晦涩，主要都是在游戏世界的事件，从剧情上讲算是比较生动的描述了网游世界的见闻和行动。
游戏性方面就不多提及，两个字，超赞。相信玩过老塞尔达的人对这款游戏的解密部分都会有一定程度上的熟悉感，而在动作部分也是打击感和操作感爆表。rpg方面，装备系统的获取和属性都颇有意思，就是部分素材的掉率也太坑爹了。。。而加点系统是类似d2的天赋树，虽说不及d2那种加点能决定bd走向的程度，不过也算是麻雀虽小五脏俱全，免费切换战技也是个很好评的地方（狗屎d2 1.13才有洗点，还是d3随便切来得舒服）。
总的来说这是个绝对超值的独立游戏，更不要提还自带官中，翻译上面也几乎没有机翻的痕迹，可以说是相当走心了。
买买买！

32960760.review:
This is one of those games that is just so much fun that you hope all of your friends will play it. Everything here is amazingly well polished, interesting and made with love. So much so that even all the announcements are worth reading just due to the amount of care put into them. 

But ok, why is this game so good? I might be a bit nostalgic here as this really reminds me of Megaman Battle Network series even though it's quite a different game. Yet it does have some things that do make that a valid connection - the characters are lovable, the mystery of the main plot and the plot itself are fantastic, there is also the concept of a connection between real and cyber life that is, like the rest, really well made.

Besides those things the game has a ton of stuff to offer - it's a great Action RPG with both elements executed amazingly well! The mechanics feel extremally responsive, partially thanks to the fantastic animations, and the RPG elements are engaging and clearly made with a lot of though put into them. There is a ton of side quests that feel more like easter eggs than anything else due to both humor and the way they need to be completed.

The soundtrack is fantastic as well... just... like, you get my point I think, this is one of those really special gems. 


Thank You devs for making such a wonderful game!

32929364.review:
This game man.

Oh man what do I say

Firstly, if you like games like Kingdom Hearts, Dark Souls, Hyper Light Drifter or are a fan of that metroid-vania genre, this game will be right up your alley, and if you're a fan of that 16-BIT asthetic, then most certainly give this a look

Even in early access, there's alot to do in this game, I've spent 6 hours and I don't even think I'm 10% done with it, and they're still adding more stuff! It's crazy. However, those 6 hours may account for alot of optional quests, which at first glance, seem skipable, and I can certainly say some of them are, all of them help to develop one's own understanding of how the mechanics and tools the game gives you, especially when every skill and attack has a different purpose, each suited for better situations more so than others

The combat is FAST. But not impossible to manage. The combat is part Kingdom Hearts part Dark Souls, in terms of how dodging and melee attacks function with a larger emphasis on the ranged attacks having monsters built specifically for the ranged attacks. And then there's the consumables with the heals and the buffs and what not, y'know, that good ol' RPG item shtuff

Music is also pretty nice, fits each stage and fight pretty well. Honestly whether you think the music is good or not is up to you, but the only way to find out is buy the game ;)

Visuals are pretty, but the first sorta section is kinda repetitive, the second being much better and having several distinctive set pieces. Hoping the rest will to

The story is also pretty intruiging, and while the whole 'amnesia' case is worn out at this point, the way its implemented into the MC works pretty well. Side characters are pretty well characterised, never really felt like any of them overlapped with each other. Wish some of the recurring NPC's had portraits, so they didn't feel so empty

I don't even know why I'm telling you this, there's a demo, go play it and make up your mind if you want to give the dev crew some dosh to make the goooooood shit

10/10

32780982.review:
感谢奶牛关野蔷薇计划给的key，[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/crosscode/review/2503268]首发于奶牛关[/url]。

这是一款ARPG，并且在极大对经验数值宽松的前提下，将解谜的要素完整全面的整合到了游戏里。带着刷+解谜的认识开始了这款游戏，结束现阶段剧情后才发现这个认识在度的方面相去甚远，刷想的太大，解谜想的太小。

游戏虽然是单人的，但游戏背景设定却是在一个网游的世界下，这种怪异的感觉不禁让人大叹可惜，要是做成能多人联机的多好（虽然真做成网游估计也不会去玩就是了）。游戏从整个剧情，游戏人物设计，到场景设计都是往网游的路子上靠，周围时不时有几个类玩家在你周围不断路过，城市里的交易区也设置了类玩家在摆摊卖东西，类玩家之间的对话也不断透露出这是一个网游背景下的世界。

刷的部分，游戏的数值控制的还不错，主要还是补足了玩家技术力上不足的地方。游戏在操作性上给出了很大的空间，一般的小怪很多都有无敌状态或高防状态，小boss和大boss则都是需要进行一定模式的操作后才能进入有效伤害阶段，这些都需要适配上玩家的操作，如果真过不去当然就是升级堆装备了。个人实际经历倒是只有在一两次会有大量怪的守护任务上卡了几次，但游戏对角色经验方面非常宽松，不管是任务失败了还是角色死亡了原有的经验都会保留，所以这种聚怪任务虽然难打也是个刷经验的好方法。另外装备制造则是和交易整合在了一切，游戏里分官方交易处和类玩家交易处。在类玩家交易处直接通过材料和钱获得需要的装备，官方交易处则是最常见的商店。

刷的部分还有一小块体现在了一些收集物品和击杀任务上，这个倒也无可厚非，网游的基本套路，也给有需要刷经验的玩家提供了路子，就是对一些有强迫症的人有点可怜就是了。

游戏中还有一个系统，植物图鉴，从打掉的某类植物上获得一定量的收集品即可解锁图鉴信息。听起来就是纯粹刷的一个无聊系统，一些玩家的评论里也指了出来。但是，在真正去刷它后能发现，这实际上是个让玩家体验到地图的设计是有多么用心的一个带解谜成分的系统。游戏地图因为有三轴上的设计，所以很多地图上的解谜融入到了地图跑酷里，而在跑酷到不了的一些地方，总会有隐藏一些珍稀的植物在其中。很多地方需要玩家在附近上下审查地形后，站在某个能跑酷到的地方以某个角度射出子弹才能打到。这块就只能靠玩家自己体会了，谁跟我说这是个纯刷的系统我跟谁急（？？

解谜和战斗在游戏中大概是五五分的， cc将游戏中的解谜做到了你所有几乎可见的地方，包括前面提到的地图解谜和植物收集，还有游戏中的地牢解谜（当然，因为现在开发进度的原因，剧情只到了沙漠开个头就结束了，所以地牢解谜实际上我也只过了第一个图的）。地图解谜不说了，很符合胃口。倒是地牢解谜，有点微妙，无法评价的感觉。游戏中的地牢解谜并非纯智力的，很多地方是带有动作的解谜，而且还是需要精瞄的动作解谜。这块大概是最痛苦的地方，遇到需要精瞄的地方只能手柄键鼠换着切。

游戏现阶段的完成度实在说不上高，但能看出心很大，仔细看就能发现地图上遇到的每一个人都有各自的名字，游戏里的一些对话也透露出现在没有任何图片和效果的装备是有打算进行开发加强的，地图上也有很多看起来没什么用但总感觉是留空出来的点等等。目前最高完成度的大概就是地图本身设计上了，还有对即将获得的四元素在地图的应用上，这块是现可见最成熟的几个部分。总之，仅凭这初始的第一个图就能耗去将近二十小时的时间，期待非常高的。

[b][i] i wrote this review is around 8 hours playtime...i'll wrote full review after finish the game later [/i][/b]

CrossCode is a game Similiar to Hyperlight Drifter, BUT, this game is more Crowded, more way to make your character, and Same Difficulty

The story takes place in Virtual Game world called CrossCode, where you play as Lea, the protagonist who lost is memory and the only way to get her memory back is by search it in the CrossCode world

i can't even believe this game is singleplayer, it felt like i was playing with other player...the NPCs is not like NPCs...i mean its like they all have they own characteristic.

Even our partner have they own Conversation and Comments in every intresting place, like commenting about the enemies, the point of interest, etc

The combat is so fluid and unorthodox, cant ask more about it, however, playing on gamepad is more comfortable for me then playing on keyboard for some reason...

Character Building in this game is almost the same like some MMORPGs out there, so you should be familliar with it, i mean, Skills Building, Stats, etc

The game is a bit Grindy, so prepare your time for leveling so you wont stuck at main quest

The SubQuest on this world is soo much, so don't bother to finish your main quest in a hurry, take your time and finish some subquest.

The Soundtrack is so amazing that i stopped in some area just to listen the music while i eat my snack on break


Still not finished the game, but i felt that i need to review this game.

Too Good To Be True
9/10

[b] I'll Write More After Finished the Game [/b]

32680335.review:
感谢奶牛关野蔷薇和开发者提供的体验资格。本评测为抢先体验评测，游玩了大约12个小时，等正式通关会补完评测。
[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/crosscode/review/2493763] 奶牛关完整图文链接	[/url]

[h1] 介绍	[/h1]

Crosscode这款游戏给我的总体感觉算是不错。虽然是像素风格，但画面很精致，可以说既能分清各种游戏中的物体，又做到了像素美这一点。音乐方面水准也比较高，虽然同一地方待得多听久了可能厌倦。

Crosscode发生在一个虚拟的网游世界，失忆的女主角要从网游世界的新手区开始，逐步探索，完成网游的主线任务和寻回自己的记忆两件事一同进行，找到网游与现实的关联。值得一提的是，制作组非常用心，整个网游的背景故事描绘得很详细，并把人物资料，背景相关等整理成百科全书，未知部分需要玩家在游戏中发掘。

游戏的战斗系统设计的很出色，采取按键近战攻击以及摇杆远程攻击的形式，仅用三个键就可以完成近战，射击，防御，闪避以及相对应的战技等各种动作。游戏的打击感非常好，和伊苏F和起源相较也毫不过分。同时游戏也有一定难度，本人除了boss战必死三五次以外，也经常被一群小怪团灭。虽然脱离战斗可以立刻回复血量，但是要获得好的材料则需要不停地连续战斗。

除了动作部分，作为一个“网游世界”，游戏的RPG元素自然也必不可少，属性，装备，技能加点，任务，怪物图鉴一一具全，甚至还有商人和植物图鉴。游戏的加点采取分支树形式，一开始便有防御，闪避，近战和投掷四种战技，通关神庙矿井后还会解锁进阶技能和火元素的加点。游戏中有四种元素，培养角色的方式自然也是多种多样。

[h1] 重点	[/h1]

这个游戏最重要的部分就是它的玩点——场景探索和解谜了，不同玩家对它的接受程度也不同，可以说，如果你接受不了这样的玩法，游戏的乐趣就会大打折扣。

游戏的探索设计中运用到最多的因素就是高低地形。没错，作为一个2D像素游戏，最重要的要素居然是3D有关的高低地形。游戏早期，大量的宝箱和隐藏地点都处在高处，需要通过低处不断纵向攀爬，横向跳跃才能获得，甚至要跨越几个地图。也就是说，你在这个地图看到的宝箱，可能需要在千里之外的地方爬上来再过来才能拿到。而且高低距离由于是2D游戏，所以不是很好估算高度，只能通过投掷球来判断。到了游戏中期，玩家习惯以后，这种玩法更成为家常便饭。不过个人对这种玩法还是比较有好感的，在2D迷宫中设计出了3D的感觉，而且熟悉后其实也并不是很难。

游戏的解谜部分算是中规中矩，同样运用到了高低设计，并与推箱子，弹射球等经典解谜元素结合，需要一定的思考，但又恰到好处。

[h1] 不足与建议	[/h1]

个人认为游戏有几个方面可以改进。最需要改进的是任务系统，首先任务指引做的很不好，经常找不到任务NPC所在地，具体的任务说明也不够详细，可以在地图上标注任务位置。其次任务真的做出了网游的感觉，没有什么代入感，任务内容也就是重复的刷怪，刷材料。另外材料的爆率实在太低，玩家无暇体验优秀的迷宫设计，却在不停地刷材料。

地图系统也可以改进。地图方面过于简陋，如果能把任务和宝箱数量显示在单张地图上玩家会方便很多。至于高低设计，个人感觉还是不要动的好，虽然可能会为难一部分玩家，但这毕竟是游戏的核心玩法。

[h1] 总评	[/h1]

8/10.优秀的ARPG游戏，不要因为像素风格而错过它。考虑到游戏的AVG，ACT，RPG要素的丰富程度，Crosscode的内容还是非常充足的，值得一玩。

32600197.review:
I -really- like CrossCode, and there's already plenty of people extolling their love for the gameplay, story, graphics, music and all that jazz. So I figured that instead, I'd focus on some minor foibles you may have with it.

[u]Unorthodox Combat System[/u]
The combat system's definitely a strong point for me, but it's certainly a bit unusual. Positioning your cursor is critical, and it determines in which direction you attack, guard or dash, all at once. Switching between these actions is very fluid once you get the hang of it; nonetheless, it may throw you off initially. Going purely by keyboard is not recommended.

[u]Grinding[/u]
You don't have to grind an ounce if you don't want to, but there's plenty of optional quests that have you do so. If you're like me in that you find sidequests of higher priority than the main storyline, you'll have to figure out some techniques to farm plants and enemies. CrossCode handles this in quite an interesting manner with its combat rank system, but grinding it is, so be prepared for it if you're a completionist.

[u]Experience Progression[/u]
Any game with sidequests has to balance their rewards to not render the player too powerful for the main quest. CrossCode makes a decent attempt by diminishing quest experience as you overlevel them, but does not resolve the problem entirely.
I enjoy rather difficult games, so overleveling is quite a concern for me. Characters will even comment on your excessive level if you come across a dungeon a bit too well prepared. It's therefore a pity that there's no way to freeze your experience. You can inhibit yourself by purposely equipping bad gear, but the fear remains that I'm not experiencing everything as the developers intended me to.
On the other side of the spectrum, if you're along purely for the story and ignore everything else on your path, you may find yourself in some tougher fights than you're bargaining for.
This is honestly more of a minor gripe with the genre as a whole than with this particular game, but it does suffer from it slightly.


Nonetheless, this is likely the best thing I've seen in Early Access thus far. Plenty of others have sung the praises I have, but suffice to say: strongly recommended.

32539074.review: Man, this game brings back fond memories of the 16 bit era, Secret of Mana specifically. I've just gotten to chapter 3 of the game and so far everything is solid. The story is good so far, the play control is great, the exp gain is challenging and unique, and the shopping is... well, interesting. As part of the shopping, you have to trade particular items to get better gear. It's a nice challenge rather than grinding money to stack yourself early in the game. I highly recommend this to anyone that enjoyed Secret of Mana, the Ys series, or the like. It's a good game for younger gamers as it well reflects the genre in the mid 90s but is up to date.
