32530895.review: CrossCode is a game that is completely worth it's price. From the fantastic soundtrack to the intruiging plot, I am completely satisfied with my purchase. It can be rather tedious to grind for specific ingredients (cough cough winter thorn) or dying multiple times against a boss because I suck, but I have fallen in love with this game through only 15 hours of playing. The many references, relatively challenging puzzles, and smooth combat make the game an amazing experience, and I am eagerly awaiting the next update. 11/10 would purchase again

32517547.review:
I originally purchased this game largely because of the insane amount of overwhelmingly positive reviews. Just reading some of these reviews you'd assume the game desended from the heavens on a golden chariot to lead all the chosen people to the promised land. After about 5 hours of gameplay I was ready to rule this out as people being overzealous; the game was good for sure, but I didn't see any golden chariots around. I'm glad I didn't review the game at that point... Since then my appreciation of this game has done nothing but soar higher and higher. The game is so much deeper than I thought.

Pros: (There are so many)
-> Core gameplay is dynamic and interesting. There is a huge variety of skills to master and you can form different gameplay patterns based on how you want to play the game.
-> Enemies are incredibly well balanced. At no point have I ever felt something was too easy or insurmountable. Strong enemies will almost always take several tries while you discover their weakness and learn to exploit it.
-> Death isn't punishing. Feel free to sack a life to understand more about your opponent. It won't set you back and you'll get back to the action quickly
-> Boss design is incredible. They look and feel intimidating and make your victories feel hard-earned and satisfying.
-> The dungeon puzzles are very well done. Nothing seems obvious. It's very much in the spirit of old zelda games, but because you have different abilities than Link the puzzles are new and interesting.
-> Everything about the game is incredibly well polished: menus, facial expressions, fast forwarding cutscenes, help tips. It all exudes a feeling of "some guy really spent a lot of time on this, good job".
-> The game is VERY deep. There's so much to it to explore and optimize. At the same time, how well the game is balanced let's you work around this complexity if you don't want to be bothered or pick and choose what aspects are fun to you. For example: I couldn't give a toss about the crafting system and don't feel like purusing the traders for slightly more optimal equipment/temporary stat boosts... So I didn't. I completed side quests to improve my stats adaquately through leveling up and played more of a Dark Souls style of 'git gud' gameplay.

Cons:
-> The story at this point is very weak... I know the devs are still working on this, but it has to be mentioned.  Almost 20 hours in and the main protagonist does not seem to have a strong driving motivation. She knows she's lost her memories and that playing the game might help her remember and thus far she hasn't remembered anything of consequence. Beyond that I guess her motivation is "the game is fun so I guess I'll keep going"... which in fairness has also been my motivation for playing despite the weak plot.

Anyways, that's my take. I picked up the game at 30% off. It's been worth every penny and there's still so much more of the game to go.

32494822.review:
Reasons why I don't recommend this game

1. Start of the game is too slow and feels really boring.
2. Quest tracking is really old fashioned. There's no mark on the map, you gotta find. Sometimes it's really tidious cause there's too many side quests.
3. Battle is tiring. It's really coold system but then you gotta dodge most of monsters attaks cause it hurts alot, even from start of the game.
4. Continue'd from #3. Battle is too hard. Not just a system, monsters often has really annoying patterns like running away and then shoot high-damage attakcs from ranged... It starts even from the first map you'll start to hunt monster

I would give 7/10 to this game. It is well-made in many ways. Just really un-friendly and too old-fashioned for nowadays.

-Updated

Wow, I wasn't expecting comment back from developer.. Since I got a reply, I would provide more detailed versions of my complainants.
 
1. If it’s connected story, I can’t complain much there. But... some dialogues you put to makes character more vibrant, sometimes it feels just another yari-yari-yada skippable blah. Could be it's just my problem.

2. I would appreciate little more detailed location, yes. But right now sometimes it’s really vague and maps are complicated already.. And you said already recognized that problem. So i'm hoping to change it one day.

3 and 4. "Challenging" fight is always a good excuse to use. If you’re targeting the certain group of players (which are skilled, into challenge), then yes. But the game doesn’t warn people that “Challenging” game play is must to new players. I wouldn’t mind if the battle is hard. But then battle is already hard and also there's “annoying” monsters. Even “zako” enemies have really annoying patterns, like running far far away and snipe you. I do not think all the battle have to be challenging constantly. (Also, to snipe back, character’s basic ranged attack sucks really hard. It almost feels worthless to use until certain point.)
In my opinion, that annoyingness is problem. Reasonably-challenging game is good. But If it’s just annoying to play, constantly, then it's just pile of stress. Not a stress reliever.
My suggestion : Easy mode. Monsters use less pattern. Some people just wants to have fun, without too much challenge and stress.
32494822.developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback. I wanted to give a few responses to that

1. Unfortunately changing the beginning right now is difficult since it's strongly connected with the plot. If you can give us more details which part exactly you thought was boring, we may be able to adapt a few things
2. Quest marker are unfortunately very difficult for us to implement at this point, but we plan to at least provide more detailed location names for Quest NPCs. You'll still have to lookup map names, but it should still help
3. CrossCode has purposely challenging fights where dodging and guarding are essential. We wanted to avoid generic Hack'n Slay Combat. It probably isn't for everyone.
4. Again, this is intended and also an aspect that a lot of our players seem to appreciate. Note that upgrading your equipment is essential to keep fights manageable - that's a fact that's currently rather poorly communicated and we're working on that.

I really like the story, and the mood/tone of it all...it gives me a warm and fuzzy kinda feeling. The controls and mechanics are really tight and the world is fun to explore as well. Normally, I'd avoid adventure/RPG/action games that lack a "jump button" but this game made me enjoy it without having one.. and I'm still kinda surpised. Because of the way that this game is being developed, I think it'll be a must-play for anyone looking for 2D games with cool a story for years to come. As long as the devs aren't planning to cut content and sell it to us like a lot of the Bigger Publishers/Developers are doing, I completely stand beside and support these guys. 32396855.review: I have rarley ever written a game review, but this game deserves this, to be honest rpg games in the past have never intrested me until now, This game changed my whole perception not on just this game but the genre, From the very first moment i got the satisfaction of hitting an enemy and the sound drew me in. The combat is impactful and the AI in the mobs is just the right amount of punishing for getting hit. The puzzles and lay out of the fields and dungeons is great for someone that gets bored with games real easily i can say i was never bored. The questing could use some work with navigating but other then that this game is a gem, I sat here for days wondering if i should but 20 dollars down on this game and after playing through alot of it i wonder why it took me so long. If you took the time to read this far BUY THE GAME , steam even offers refunds under 2 hours but you wont need that because you will be hooked. Thank you for this masterpiece of a game.

A fairly well-polished traditional ARPG I would say.
For pros it will basically be the great art, decent music, nice story, smooth fighting et cetera.
However there are several things one might want to know. [strike]First of all it does not have cloud save, which fucked me because my hard drive went boom with my save (well, I don't think people usually destroy their hard drives that easily but no cloud save is no cloud save).[/strike] IT HAS CLOUD SAVE. Then there's all those parkour and marathon quests, as well as challenging puzzles. Leveling up is not that unpleasant as long as you've grasped the point and have a healthy liver like any KanColle player.
IMO Crosscodes is worth 17/20, which would make a decent Premier League player (in Football Manager scales, if anyone is wondering).

32380222.developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback.

We know that Early Access has its problems in particular for story-driven games like CrossCode where you essentially have to wait for the conclusion of the story.

That's why we're thankful that so many players still get Early Access to support the development of CrossCode. It is thanks to those players that we can afford to develop CrossCode as we have imagined it and without cutting any major corners. Without Early Access, CrossCode as you know it wouldn't be possible.

If your last sentences is a hint that you think that CrossCode is too grindy: we're always open to feedback to tweak the balancing, since we don't want to make a game that strictly requires you to grind for long hours. By doing most of the side quests (most of them should have unique objectives and/or interesting background stories) you should not be required to grind enemies for too long, unless you really want to get all the best trader equipment, which is entirely optional.

32357484.review:
[h1] 游戏译名为《穿越代码》或《交叉准则》[/h1]
兹以为这个游戏的名字具有多重含义
[list]
    [*]游戏设定在一个由代码写成的虚拟大陆，我们操作的玩家事实上是“真实世界”中玩游戏的玩家，有一种楚门的世界的感觉，现实中的虚拟与现实中的现实的一种“交会”，游戏里面还经常有一些要回去写作业这种梗也是蛮好笑的。
    [*]游戏通过各种交错的传送轨道将各个大陆连接起来并设定了传送点使玩家穿越其中。
    [*]主角Lea是个失忆而迷失在虚拟网游的神秘人物，通过序章笔者推测她与她重病身亡的弟弟一样是用某种可以穿越于虚拟与现实的物质构成的，网游中的她丧失了语言能力，因此“真实世界”中的博士不断为主角修复词汇代码以及记忆代码的剧情成为了贯穿整个游戏的暗线。
    [*]明线是主角在“游戏中”是探索虚拟大陆的起源，闯关各种地牢神庙，code也有密码的意思，而游戏的解谜元素也是涵盖在方方面面。
    [*]cross也有通行的意思，体现在游戏中各个大陆版块之间需要特定剧情给予的通行证方可通过。
[/list]
[spoiler]好！以上只是我臆想而已。嘻嘻[/spoiler]

言归正传，官方给自己作品的定义是复古2D像素类RPG。[spoiler] 好呀！正是我的爱！[/spoiler]
剧情方面，这个游戏在开头就给我们挖了一个巨大的深坑，引用一位主播的分析，
[quote=CriticalMass]“主角的神秘身份、静的弟弟临死前忙着赶工的神秘程序以及遗言中‘离开这里’的话语，都指向了主角本身很可能是通过非正常手段进入的虚拟网游，这种非正常手段就可以被称为‘黑客程序’，而不是‘密码’。”[/quote]
那么主角到底是谁？这个网游到底是如何运作的？故事的发展又将带我们走向何处？主角的最终命运是怎样的？[spoiler]欢迎收看今天的[strike]走进科学[/strike]今日说法[/spoiler]层层迷雾加上诙谐风趣的人物对话成为了这个游戏剧情引人入胜、让人欲罢不能的重要原因。

画面大家看游戏截图就知道不必多说，本作画质精良，细节突出，键鼠操作打击非常带感，加上丰富的技能树带来的战斗系统更是让你在各种打怪过程中找到自己的享受方式。谜题方面可能会有一定难度但也是增加了趣味性，而且重复性不高，同时不会让你感到乏味。

缺点有玩家说贴图层次不分明以及音乐枯燥还有掉落物难刷、汉化错误等，我觉得仁者见仁智者见智吧。

目前游戏怪物地图等都已基本开发完毕，据说年底前会将剧情补全，啊啊啊啊啊啊[spoiler]如果不是烂尾结局[/spoiler]怕不是一部神作啊。给你9.9/10！还有0.1是等你更新！

32356054.review:
Very awesome game.  It has fast paced, action combat and gameplay with strategic elements to it, but it still has that good old retro RPG feel to it with the music and charming graphics.  Lots of puzzle solving making it have a Zelda feel as well.

When I first bought the game I was a bit worried on how I would use a keyboard in this type of game.  It started off rough, but as I got used to it I'm actually really enjoying it.   It's basically using WASD to move around and then mouse clicks to attack and defend in whatever direction.  If you are close range you'll melee and at long range you'll shoot.    Holding down mouse buttons will do overcharge attacks.  There is a skill tree to choose branching skills, etc

The thing that makes this all come together is that most of the enemies have unique patterns of attack that you have to figure out how to approach them, especially in the boss battles and other mini quests.   It makes for some boss fights where you may die multiple times before you win making it more satisfying.   It also helps that the loading time after you die is so fast that it doesn't derail from the game much at all.  I really appreciate that about it.

Now obviously with it being in Early Access the story is not complete.   As of this review it seems like it may not even be halfway there.    That being said I do really like how it is going so far and can't wait for more updates.  I could see myself playing for another 10 hours easy though on what is available as far as quests and such though which would give me almost 40 hours(maybe more) in a game that is at best halfway complete.  Not too bad IMO and well worth its pricetag  especially if can get it on sale at all.

32353313.review:
I know the game isn't complete yet, but so far, I've played through all of its available content in several different versions, spanning over a year now.

•TL;DR version•
[b]This game gets a solid 9 / 10 from me.[/b]
It respects your time by allowing you to save anywhere, it's overall easy to learn, the combat is fast paced, fluid, and not overwhelming, The characters are adorable. The pixel art is really good and the soundtrack really blends in with the ambient.

•Actual opinion version•
[b]•All the good things•[/b]

Everything in general pretty refined. The difficulty has a nice pace, It doesn't overwhelm you. The 1000 exp for level up system works pretty well, making lower level enemies give you less experience as you level up, somewhat forcing you to move on forward. The destructible plants also help sell the character's abilities, because everything is linked to the combat.

I'd say that the puzzles, world exploration and combat are masterfully woven together, and I definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes to beat up some baddies and scratch your brains to solve some nice puzzles. It has very well adapted controls for a modern audience (as opposed to older games with stiffer controls and 8 way directional movement), and the pixel art is just to cry for.

The story is simple and accessible, all the characters are likeable (so far).

Emilie really helps breaking some of the monotony by talking to you every once in a while when you're sometimes just walking around to previous areas, getting some S ranks, trying to get all the materials you haven't got yet, or just whacking some plants.



[b]•Minor complaints•[/b]

-The amount of initial quests that are given to you can feel a bit overwhelming. Specially for someone who is new for this kind of game (which is not the case for me), but I can see a few people getting a bit confused with switching between which quests are going to be showing up in your HUD initially.

-When I got into new areas a couple of times I couldn't tell the height of some of the platforms to jump onto, but that's a limitation of the camera angle itself (and probably some lack of shading of taller platforms ). This was very very rare but it definitely happened. I got kinda frustrated because it broke my "flow" of jumping around as i got Lea's face smacked against a wall and fell into the water.

32310375.review:
2015年玩过crosscode的demo，当时就觉得demo的完成度非常高，新手流程做得很好，解谜和战斗部分很吸引人。后来一直有关注这个项目。上架steam后由于价格偏高一直没入，直到最近永降+打折+汉化一出，果断+1~
游戏的早期和之前demo基本一样，代入感很强，[spoiler]【特别喜欢游戏的设定：在一个单机游戏里玩MMO】[/spoiler]，现在已经把EA阶段的剧情通了。下面说下游戏的优缺点：

优点：
1.完成度很高
2.高质量的解谜系统
3.熟练后非常爽快的战斗系统
4.收集要素非常多，适合收集控

缺点：
1.2d场景里的高低平台不好区分
2.解谜和战斗的难度都比较高（经常想摔鼠标）
3.（EA阶段的）剧情一般，没有想象中的吸引人
4.（EA阶段的）BGM很一般。。

总体来说，十分推荐，虽然玩的过程中经常有摔鼠标的冲动，但坚持下来通关时成就感也是很强的。好像回到小时候玩的ARPG一样，每一个敌人，每一个宝箱都需要认真思考，反复尝试，熟练后快感十足！
现在已经迫不及待想玩后面的正式版了~

32302394.review:
It's hard for me to play games. Every hour I'm playing a game is an hour I could have spent writing some useful code, getting some chore done, or exercising under the preposterous delusion I'll ever be skinny.

This game breaks through that and asserts the value of the occasional diversion. It makes me smile when the world around me is a never ending stream of negativity about politics I stopped caring about long ago. This game made it so the Xbox 360 controller I bought doesn't just sit on top of my workstation collecting dust.

I won't bother talking about the game itself. It's all already been said. You should buy this game. Don't wait for a sale, just get it.

I just wanted to say thank you Radical Fish Games. I am eternally grateful for the small piece of happiness you've provided me.

32272587.review:
这个游戏的趣味性在沉迷其中的十几个小时中已经得到了充分的体现，无须多言，悠闲的曲风，有趣的NPC对话，刺激的boss战斗，烧脑的地图跑路，各种迷宫的解密，无时无刻都在诉说着这个游戏的魅力。
操作手感在玩过的许多游戏里也算的上乘，简单的操作，便能释放出华丽的攻击，将敌人卡在角落里默默的输出，实在是非常爽快的体验。
但问题也有，游戏本身的装备机制是硬伤：我不会指望自己会花费很多的时间去获取那些稀有材料，然后制作只能用上那么一段时间的稀有装备。这个游戏没有强化，没有给那些其它属性优良但基本属性已经开始跟不上主线脚步的装备留下一条后路。整个冲击主线的所有时间内，基本都是靠着放置在各种角落的属性优良的装备在开路，根本没有去多看一眼那些繁杂的制作菜单，那些林林总总的稀有材料。
作为一个RPG游戏，金钱的作用在这里几乎没有作用：我表示自己玩了14.4小时，金钱甚至已经到了10W+，几乎没有动用过。因为自己不算是手残，打boss死亡的次数并不算多，用药的机会也不多，路上捡的药也基本够用，所以金钱这个概念对我来说在这个游戏里基本是十分模糊的，这是一个很大的浪费。
我觉得就目前看来，可以有更多利用的方式：比如可以以发布赏金的模式来获取材料。这样既实现了金钱利用的目的，也可以省去许多自己辛苦搜集材料的时间。作为一个大型游戏，从怪物身上获取材料去打造装备这样的机制我其实是很喜欢的，但是，这不是大型游戏！所谓的大型游戏它是个背景！对我们玩家而言，更多的它是一个单机游戏！所以这个机制就出现了硬伤：效率问题，以及物质交换的问题。
除去这里，游戏不能切换视角也是一个问题：很多的地方对路痴来说就是一个灾难的代名词，它有着能够完美暴露出路痴属性的判别作用，所以，地图上的设计，我希望能够能合理一些，这个我本人并没有什么很大的感触，所以给不出什么好的意见。这个部分是稍微提一下。
总的来说，游戏我很喜欢，即使它有着一定的瑕疵，但依旧不会掩盖它的闪耀。
最后，我总结一下个人的的改进意见：①希望金钱的作用能得到更好的体现；②给辛辛苦苦搜集材料打造稀有装备的努力者们一条可以看到希望的路；③地图可以改进一下。
那么就这些了，祝大家游戏愉快！

这是我的初期看法，有的留言确实警醒了我：我对这个游戏的了解还不够深，对此，我会把整个游戏更全面的了解一下再去对整个评测进行最后的总结。
但我单独对金钱的看法还是不会改变：即使说后期做装备需要大量的金钱，那初期和中期呢？金钱就用来为后期打下基础？那对于一个游戏而已，金钱的存在感也太弱了吧？前期跑主线，后期拼命赚钱，那样也未免太过枯燥。对我个人而言，金钱应该有更多的使用方式，而不是单单禁锢在制作装备需要的这方面。

32241069.review:
[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/crosscode/review/2453493] 牛关完整配图版求点赞	[/url]
前言：

花了两周+的时间断断续续的把这游戏在现阶段版本通关了，虽然还有零星点点的一些收集要素以及支线任务没有完成，容我等到最终版后再慢慢补齐吧。

整体系统（单机版网游？）给人眼前一亮，但一些细节上的设定让人觉得是为了突出自己系统而特意为之。

剧情则埋下了很多伏笔，就不知道后面的主支线任务会如何处理收尾，希望能带来惊喜。

操作：

个人更倾向于用手柄去玩这类游戏。但这款游戏，无论解密、boss战、小怪破防状态都很依赖于主角的射击弹幕 + 并不是很大的怪物模型 = 手柄的右摇杆瞄准很受苦。最后演变成，用键盘我走位不灵活受苦，用手柄我瞄准精度不够伤害不够受苦。[spoiler]主要还是我太菜wwww[/spoiler]

而手柄的防御与闪避同一个按键的问题，在我做和尚跳跳任务的时候一直困扰我。本来是防御接转向，一个不当心就变成旋转跳崖了。[spoiler]关键还是我太菜wwww[/spoiler]

剧情：

rpg游戏自然不能不提剧情要素，很轻小式的游戏穿越剧情，不过与众不同的是这个游戏世界和现实世界是同一个世界，就出现类似现实人物进入游戏世界冒充npc（严重怀疑那个探针系列任务就是这样）之类的另类展开。

通过现实世界剧情→游戏内主线任务→主角的回忆构成一篇篇章节；各支线任务的暗示埋伏笔；好友的下线、线上聊天完善真实世界及人物。

但是刚刚结束新手关正式进入游戏后，会一下接触到很多游戏内的专有名词导致你看对话看的一愣一愣的。

总体来说，剧情的确写出了那么一个世界，不过又是很常见的世界。希望将来版本完结时能带来惊喜。

系统：

这款游戏的系统不得不说是很大的亮点。从模拟出网游的世界到主推的跑酷，从技能加点的电路到可近战可远攻的战斗系统，虽说每一个都可以看到点其他游戏的影子，但把这些系统整合起来并配上自己的特点，使整个游戏系统很完善。

社交：

这个社交系统是为了丰富网游世界而设定的。作为一个网游当然有公会、好友、组队等等，这些都可以在这游戏当中实现（虽然都是预设定）。虽然由于剧情的设定，你体会不到其他职业，不过通过社交的组队，你可以变相的安慰自己，试过了每个职业的特色。

值得一提的是，期中有个剧情关是PVP，真的有让我惊讶到。

战斗：

看似简单粗暴，只有防御、闪避、近战、射击，并给这四种状态附上蓄力技能，以及4种属性。但其中也有相当硬核的部分：在受伤瞬间使用防御的完美防御，使用强力射击反弹打到怪物弱点打出硬直，使用合适的属性攻击触发怪物破防状态……

而怪物的模型也不单单只是一个攻击判断，怪物的不同部分会有不一样的受伤判断，而这些都可以通过怪物外貌的特征去判断。

技能加点：

看到这个加点方式的时候，这不是FF10的技能盘嘛。不过他也有自己的特点，通过大方向线来粗分基础属性方向，在每条线路里又通过分支来让你进行技能二选一。除了中间的无属性（普通元素）电路盘外，四个方向又分别有四种元素单独的电路盘。

小细节：因为元素盘在四个方向，与他相反方向的属性就不会在这个电路盘中有路线，特化出每种元素所擅长or不擅长的属性能力。而这四种元素又和职业相呼应…

PS：每个元素的电路盘是单独结算的，所以根据你人物切换不同元素，人物的属性能力、技能是会随之改变的。

跑酷：

这个系统是这游戏的亮点之一，也能感觉到开发者对这个系统很满意（无论剧情还是任务都有单独提到这个）。但是我觉得这个系统在展现自己特色的同时也是一大败笔。

通过这个系统，游戏地图不在是单纯的xy两轴，而是真正意义上的多出了z轴。很多内容都体现在这个z轴上。但是！

感觉开发者太在意这个系统，以至于地图的设计，道具的隐藏位置，一些任务的解谜要素，一些任务的收集物品都在围绕着这个跑酷，有一点喧宾夺主的味道。而在过了初期体验这个系统之后的后期地图，添加了很多跨多个地图的跑酷爬楼，就会让人觉得有点烦躁了。

杂谈：

当然除去上面说的这些，这游戏也有很多有趣的细节，丰富的梗，多样的任务等你去发现

太长不看：

优点：

+单机游戏表现出网游的世界

（+）剧情构建出一个充实的世界，并有很多伏笔。

+丰富的技能盘

+相较于其他同类游戏多了跑酷玩法和z轴

+丰富的细节，以及多样的任务

缺点：

-解密要素还是有点单调

-过多的注重跑酷导致有些喧宾夺主

-真的有点尴尬的操作

相较于其他同类游戏，通过跑酷系统，体现出z轴的立体地图。无论是主线中的大BOSS还是支线任务里的小BOSS都是硬派的战斗，有一定难度。喜欢2d像素风ARPG的推荐体验，受苦爱好者也可体验一下战斗。个人感觉还是硬派动作>解密探索。

PS：隐藏道具可以通过推断杂草来估计大致从什么位置上去哪张地图开始；射击解密则可以通过观察目标点附近成斜角的墙，基本在同一个屏幕内有解。

评论目前针对完成v0.9.4版本游戏主线剧情，如有错误地方欢迎指出，欢迎留言讨论

32234370.review:
非常棒的游戏，战斗的感觉不错，有一定的难度，有BOSS战，手残的话多刷等级刷材料吧。
收集是这个游戏的一个重要环节，会花不少时间，但也不怎么无聊，比较死脑细胞（当然设计地图的哥们可能脑细胞死得更多）

女主角由于语言模块缺失导致台词量少，但是配合各种表情反而更加凸显主角天然可爱的气质。
游戏背景是一个网游世界，这个世界的人包括主角、技术人员、普通玩家、幕后黑手。
主角和一般玩家不同，肉体状态不明，类似脱离肉体的灵魂，或者类似于一个AI，通过技术人员的帮助在该游戏中寻找失去的记忆（主线）。

游戏细节不错，普通玩家匆匆忙忙的在城市和野外来来往往，营造出一种网游的感觉。
一些人物的对话比较有意思，比如一个普通网游玩家和NPC对话，NPC只会说一句，让那个玩家十分无语。

不过目前游戏是半成品，据某评论说剧情没完工但地图基本完工了，后面可以无视剧情继续打后面的地图。
但是后面没剧情也没啥意思，打完后面的图，我估计以后出了剧情都不会想回来玩了。
所以现在剧情推完，我打算把这游戏养个一两年等剧情出多一点再回来玩，反正也不急。
[spoiler]到时候莉亚的本子也。。诶嘿嘿[/spoiler]

32200565.review:
强烈推荐一波Cross Code
永降加官方中文十分良心 [spoiler]可是端午节买第二天打折感觉有点不爽[/spoiler]
根据游玩体验来说还是对得起这个价格了

解谜
每张地图都有解谜要素 需要熟悉的时间 第一次游玩会有不舒服的感觉 谜题很良心 目前游玩到沙漠感觉没有重复感 感觉很特别 喜欢解密十分推荐这一款游戏

战斗
不得不说 怪物都有准备自己的破防 让游戏提升了一个档次 怪物很特别 自己的技能也十分有意思 本来以为几百M的游戏  重点在解密的话 战斗就应该水一点的 但是丝毫不马虎 而且还很有难度 就有一点差一点点过不去的感觉 药品的种类也很多 虽然这个系统个人不太喜欢用 装备的确有点难刷  升级方面也感觉有点慢 爽快感可能会有些许不足 快餐玩家可能就会比较难受 但是可以使用游戏内自带的预设档来游玩 可以说是十分贴心了 不过我没有用完 不知道里面的存档是什么样的

剧情
虽然看不太懂 说实话 现在这个版本的剧情内容有点少 可以做一个期待吧

价格 
虽然感觉偏贵 内容来说比等价游戏来说 内容感觉已经十分丰富 如果不能接受 打折在入 肯定是最好的 全价入 也对的起 这个游戏的谜题

我很喜欢这个游戏的风格 虽然我不期待大家对这个游戏都包有好评 但是我仍然希望 你们不要错过这款游戏 可以感受到制作组对这个游戏的付出 

同时期待着后续开发。
因为以解谜为主 所以也不建议看攻略。

32193916.review: Great game with an interesting story. The only issue I have with this game is that some of the quests can become extremely frustrating. For example, the challenge of aspiration, trial of progression, and so forth. If you get frustrated or annoyed easily, then I wouldn't recommend this game. And if you have anxiety, then I probably won't recommend this game either. If you're looking for a challenging game with a great story, then this game is for you. :) It can be pretty fun at times, especially when you complete areas on the map and progress to the next village/town. Also, some of the quests can get repetitive, and some enemies and bosses can be pretty hard to beat right away.. so you're forced to farm and grind for better gear and for higher levels, but that's common in most games though.

40+小时全收集，全宝箱达成。
又花了几小时做出了巴辛堡的几个装备。
钻头早点升满，割草效率真的快很多。
卑尔根村的几个挑战真的很难，而且很容易烦躁，给的东西也很一般，过不去的话可以放弃。
目前盖亚花园有几个箱子是拿不到的，话说拿不到就不要放在那啊，浪费了我好多时间。
目前游戏难度一般，毕竟是RPG，感觉后期的几个BOSS都比较简单，除了史莱姆BOSS都是一遍过的，全部打完大概能升到47级，电系的近战技打BOSS真的超强。
感觉游戏的解密比BOSS战要难一些，但解密难度其实并不高，一般玩下来应该很少会卡关的。
目前游戏流程真的不长，地图也不大，期待后续的更新吧。
建议新手先吧主线的几个神庙打完再回头来找箱子，可以很大程度上缩减游戏时间，满地图找漏的箱子真的很花时间。
最后感谢送的免费KEY。

32186187.review:
tl;dr: A frustrating mess that I wanted to love, but honestly it's just not fun. Go buy something else.

Don't get me wrong, there are actually a lot of great things about this game. But it is very far from perfect, which one might think based on the very high approval and reviews it gets here on steam.

Many, many, battles are long, repetative, boring, and frustratingly difficult. I see many people say they are 'hard', but these battles are just poorly optimized. You know what else is hard ? Lifting heavy rocks, but that doesn't make it fun.
In battle, you have to continue to make near perfect moves and one slip up can often cost you 70-100% of your health...resulting in you having to replay the battle from the beginning (of the first phase of a sequence of battles, as will often happen) and you having wasted ANOTHER 5-10 minutes of your life (depending on end boss, or whatever you're fighting).

The challenges are equally frustrating and I've found myself having to replay each one so many times that by the time I complete it, I can speed run through it. That's the type of profeciency they require to simply move on. It's absurd.

Healing also takes an absurd amount of time. Like 2 seconds of having to stand still during the heat of a fast paced battle. It's ridiculous. Honestly, when using a health in battle I often am hurt 80-150% of how much a full heal accomplishes. Meaning, a heal will usually result in a very small amount of health gain, or more often than not you actually lose more than you gain from having to stand still and getting injured.

I have other gripes too, and may edit them in later.
There's a lot of potential, and I do understand that it's early access (rightly so), but it has a lot of optimization problems to deal with, especially in main battles (which consists of 90% of the game since they take so stupid long to finally win).

In a lot of ways though, it has potential to be a really fun game, but I honestly don't understand why it has such a high rating on steam. It's good, but no way is it that good. So I wanted to give a honest, contrasting opinion to all these 'best game ever created' reviews.

So, while overall I do enjoy aspects of the game, and think that it has the potential to be a great game. It falls flat. It is simply too much of a grind and not an enjoyable experience.

32164917.review:
非常出色的游戏，虽然真人投影到载体，在用载体在现实世界中搭建的“游戏世界”冒险这样的设定并不算罕见，但是依旧是个十分有趣的设定。加入一定量科幻元素以后也有了深度的感觉。
可能也是因为做了这么久，内容非常的丰富，核心系统简洁明了但又有可挖的深度。动作系统非常的出色，手柄游玩手感非常好，4向技能树我也很满意。非要在鸡蛋里挑骨头的话，难度阶梯是一点。游戏的基础引导部分足够了，但是难度阶梯布置不是特别合理，一些地图高低差谜题的设计有些挑战性，任务又一次性可以接一堆，难度高低不一，非常有网游感，但是要完成却需要消耗不少时间去反复挑战、尝试——这也是一种乐趣，但是引导还是可以做的更顺滑一些的。

32163320.review:
По неизвестной мне самому причине купил по скидке, попробовал, и...это лучшее, что попадало в мои руки за последние несколько лет.
Залпом прошел всю имеющуюся сюжетку(15 часов, при этом по ощущениям это даже не середина сюжета еще) и был прерван надписью "Сюжета нового пока нет, Эмилинатор не будет с тобой в ближайшее время болтать, новый спутник пока не полностью имплементирован в игру, зато ты можешь попробовать два данжа и одну локацию наперед сюжету, который будет к ним относиться в ближайшем будущем"

Самое яркое впечатление - под конец условного первого акта был сюжетный квест с пвп против персонажа твоего класса и..это был классный челендж. С базовым шмотом и отставанием на 2 уровня эта битва(в формате бо5 к слову) была весьма сложна, и далась мне только с третьей попытки. И выглядело достаточно экшоново - шары летали с обеих сторон, скилы кастовались, Эмили вовсю тебя поддерживает. И это при том, что в первом акте еще недоступны элементы, которые разбавляют боевку Водой, Землёй(на самом деле молниями), Огнём и Воздухом, превращая вас в Аватара местного пошиба. Самое забавное, что побеждать в этой дуэли совершенно необязательно, но это было дело принципа.

Мне бы хотелось в будущем видеть больше пвпшек с другими классами. Разрабы после релиза(в начале 2018) обещают арену, но я пока не совсем понял что это, ибо кто-то пишет, что это аж мультиплеер арена. Звучит классно, но странно, учитывая что достигнув максимального уровня и выполнив все квесты ты должен получить достаточно скилл поинтов, чтобы открыть каждый талант в игре, что лишает тебя специализации, но, вероятно, для арены будут другие правила действовать. Но я был бы не против арены и против ботов в том числе

Из немного напрягающего - поистине корейские проценты. Если игра говорит, что чтобы выбить со снеговика морковку тебе должно прокнуть 20% - ты можешь уничтожить с несколько десятков этих снежных товарищей, прежде чем тебе выпадет драная морковка. Самое смешное, что постоянно тебя сопровождает квест, где тебе нужно собирать мясо. Что сложного в том, чтобы собрать мясо? Помимо шанса выпада в 12(!)% он начинает выпадать только с ранга B. Что есть ранг? О, это очень просто. По умолчанию ты ранг D и чем больше монстров ты убиваешь подряд - тем выше ранг. Время между битвами ограничено где-то семью секундами, и основная проблема в том, что если хочешь набить ранг - ты обязан бегать между локациями(они небольшие и все заполнены джамп паззлами), ибо мобов в одной едва хватит на ранг B. Из положительного - помимо выпадения новых вещей повышенный ранг так же повышает шанс выпада вещей, что приятно, но я видимо невезучий, ибо все равно убил с 4 десятка снеговиков ради 5 морковок.

Пусть сюжет останавливается...я не знаю...ни то на середине, ни то на трети, все равно рекомендую опробовать. Геймплей меня не отпускал ни на секунду, поэтому после Кросскода я уходил спать в 5 утра

32140150.review:
So I originally wrote a review that was ranty because I don't like sidequests... much. They 'can' be a nice distraction but they're mostly platitudes and abusive of some of the most ancient cliches. That said, changes have been made where there are fewer of them, and even some of the ones that reamain, are quite interesting. Most noteably is the sub-arc about the girl whose kindness is exploited by a guild to bring in 'Seekers' to help with grunt work for some diabolical plot of this guild..... that hasn't been revealed yet.

Before the change the game was already a 10/10 in my eyes, now it's more like 11/10. I cannot get enough, and I cannot say enough good things about it. It's not just RPG in the level grinds, you can surpass obstacles a variety of ways, including a skill tree that actually makes the character feel powerful, and equipment that can be customized for several different playstyles.

The story starts out with this kind of 'anime' style opening, hooking you with a mystery, a sequence of action-packed events that just leave you wondering what's going on. But there's a catch: Lea is introduced as an amnesiac, surrounded by people who seem to know more about her than she does. This includes the main villain. I won't say any more than that, so as not to spoil, just give an idea of what to expect.

Every character is colorful and loveable. Emilie is a faithful sidekick, perhaps a bit ditzy but not in an annoying way. She is actually my favorite supporting character, an endless source of adorable. Apollo is definitely an over-the-top rival, the kind of obnoxiously righteous punk but fun to be around in doses, which is exactly how you're treated to him.

But by far the most important thing in any video game is the gameplay itself. And CrossCode delivers immensely. Switch between melee and ranged combat seemlessly; dodge attacks gracefully or put up a directional shield; use circuits to buff your abilities and add a variety of new ones; use elemental attributes to exploit enemy weaknesses. Almost everything flows in this beautiful dance and you can always learn a new technique or adjust your patterns. And if you use a gamepad, you will be delighted by how buttery smooth Lea can move.

Seriously cannot wait for full release. If you value 'fun' and respectable challenge curve more than pretty graphics, buy this game.

Jogo é excelente mesmo estando incompleto, vale o que é pedido, gráficos simples mas muito bem trabalhado, vários npcs andando pelos mapas também, efeitos de neve, efeitos de vento no deserto.
  A história é interessante, você entra num jogo de rpg online com sistemas próprios porém o jogo é todo offline pelo menos por enquanto, o jogo é totalmente criativo, criou sistemas únicos pra ele, inclusive o sistema de combate que é totalmente próprio. Lembra Secret of Mana , é um action rpg com party members, porém esse Cross code é cheio de quests, armas únicas, um sistema de evoluir skill baseado no sphere grid de final fantasy x.
  O combate é excelente mesmo, cada chefe é unico e os inimigos são bem desafiantes, você morre bastante mesmo se jogar bem.
 E o jogo tem bastante dungeon inspirado em Zelda, cheia de puzzles dificeis e bem elaborados.
 Basicamente é meu jogo favorito da Steam e a equipe está deparabéns!

32110663.developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback.

It is true that CrossCode has a fairly abstract map system much like Super Metroid where you only see the room you're in and not the location within the room. Likewise, you don't have markers to quest NPCs and similar things. We're aware that this makes questing less comfortable. Unfortunately improving these features at this point would be very difficult to do, which is why we don't want to make this promise.

For Quest NPCs we try to always tell you the name of the room that you can look up on the map. That means you only have to find the room on the map view (you can easily see names by hovering the room) and afterwards search the NPC within the room. It's less comfortable than a marker, but you don't have to search the whole area that way.

As for the control scheme: a lot of action like attacking, guarding and dashing can and often must be executed while aiming with your right analog stick. That is why face buttons simple are not an option for these actions. Despite that we plan to add support for Face buttons for actions like "close combat attack" and "guarding" in addition to the shoulder buttons with the next release.

Yes, the control scheme of CrossCode is somewhat unique and therefore not the most intuitive, but overall the feedback for it has actually been very positive.

32108088.review:
Es el primer Indie tipo RPG que he jugado y me ha encantado, es sorprendente lo que sus creadores han estado realizando desde sus inicios en 2015, han estado puliendo el juego para bien, tenemos una gran variedad de habilidades y el sistema de pelea es único, bastante fácil de usar, tanto con control como con teclado y ratón. Además cabe decir, que  los puzzles presentados en este juego son muy buenos y divertidos, esto con una historia bastante entretenida.

Solo queda decir, que si te gustan los juegos tipo RPG no dudes en adquirir este juegazo, a pesar de ser un juego Indie, no hay porque ignorarlo o pasarlo por alto, ya que al final te enganchara o atrapara su sistema y modalidad.

Como último dato, no estaría mal que sus desarrolladores lo traduzcan al español, le daría un gran plus y un gran auge para todas aquellas personas que aún no se deciden en comprarlo, ya sea porque se les dificulta el inglés o simplemente no les apetece jugarlo en ese idioma.

Claramente lo recomiendo, créeme no te arrepentirás de haberlo hecho.

32089360.review:
EDIT:  I now have hours on Steam because I had to play through it again.  This game is just so fun.

I have no hours on record on Steam because I pirated it first to see if it was any good.  I'm reluctant with 8/16-bit games as I've been burned too much in the past.

That said, I got to the "current end" of the game as it is in that copy I got.  I was floored.  This game is amazing.  The combat feels so good and so rewarding.  The story is adorable and it pulls you in rather quickly, I am actually upset it isn't finished.  It takes place in a fictional world called CrossWorlds.  You are an MMO character named Lea and you meet friends along on the way.  There is something different about your character, but none of your "MMO friends" pick up on it.  I almost felt like your fictional friends were real people.  The world feels alive with random NPCs dashing around.

It feels like Diablo and Chrono Trigger had a child and this was the game.  I normally hate A-RPGs, but something about this game just feels so rewarding when you play it.    

The only cons I can think of is the quest interface and questing, and the vendors.  To trade pretty much any item, you don't just trade Gold/Credits and receive the item.  You also have to trade components from around the world.  I am not a fan of that.  If I grind the money, I'd like to just buy the item without any additional items needed.  That was frustrating.  And the quest interface leaves a lot to be desired.  A mini-map with directions would be nice, you get pretty overwhelmed with the amount of quests in the early game and trying to clear them all out is a hassle because of the interface it gives you.

Other than those two gripes, if you are on the fence, pick it up so you can also be disappointed when you get to the "end" of the current iteration of the game and just want more more more.  I'll be keeping my eye out for the official release so I binge play it for days on end.

32085548.review:
作为刚玩了9.9个小时只解锁了火焰系天赋的玩家，已经安奈不住写下这篇测评。

优点大部分测评都有阐述我就不提了。提几个现有的问题，
1.任务导向（需优化），也许是我个人比较懒，我觉得大部分任务应该有一个交任务的提示，这个交任务的提示在地图是上是不显示的，这导致我在做完任务后要花很长的时间去找交任务的人，有时候任务很多一时间忘了任务在哪交，我需要花很长的时间寻找交任务的地点。可能是我比较矫情。
2.无论是boss还是玩家希望加入“冰冻”，这个负面状态，因为我看到机器人对我一顿乱喷，这华丽的效果应该是减速玩家，久后冰冻，然后boss连招会造成巨额加成伤害，也许在冰冻系天赋中有体现，如果已经有制作请忘记这点。
3.火焰天赋里的炸弹天赋，闪避蓄力会放下一个地雷，这个技能因为AI智商太高的原因，显得十分鸡肋，因为你闪避蓄力后是一个逃跑或者进攻，速度快的怪物都会走位避开地雷，或者围绕着主角摆开阵势，，地雷会被冷落，希望加入地雷"引力“天赋，或者将这个特性附加到某个道具上去，地雷可以作为一个吸附敌人的引力体运转一段时间把小型单位吸引过去，然后爆炸，这样也可以为玩家创建更好的连击环境。
4.任务剧本的干货缺乏。其实我觉得每个任务都是展现这个世界生态环境的契机，这是一个非常好的大框架，但是缺少真正的“玩家”互动，因为很多故事我粗略的感受都是草草了事。例如小偷的故事，这个小偷完全可以设定为“玩家”，以玩家的设定和“玩家”的想法去发展小偷的这个支线，也许可以变成，这个虚拟的真实网络游戏，有很多人利用自己的能力便利去行窃。让这个网络世界产生更多的矛盾。
5.我很喜欢企鹅和地鼠领袖这两个怪物，也许是我比较多余，但是我更希望加入更多的文字剧情和任务剧情去告诉我们这些玩家，这个地鼠为什么要成群结队的袭击人类，为什么企鹅会拉帮结派，可以增加怪物和这个世界的互动也能给下面剧情给出更多的铺垫。将这么优秀的boss放弃深造机会我真的深感遗憾。

希望这个游戏越做越好，不要输给波兰蠢驴啊！

SFC版イースVを彷彿とさせるドット絵アクションRPG。
MMORPGの世界が舞台なだけはあって、クエストやアイテムトレード等、ネトゲプレイヤーの方なら「あーそうそう、こんな感じのヤツ良くあるわ～」とクスっとさせられる要素が散りばめられています。
萌えに傾倒し過ぎていないキャラデザは適度に可愛らしく、キャラクター同士のちょっとした会話も小気味良いです。
主人公はとある事情から無口系なのですが、表情がコロコロ変わるため見ていて飽きません。
残念ながら日本語は今の所非対応ですが、使われている英語は簡単なのでそこまで困らないかと思います。

攻撃方法については独特な為慣れが必要かもしれません。

SFC世代の方に是非オススメしたい作品です！

32058166.review:
首先，我很喜欢这种像素风格的游戏，毕竟童年是各种颜色的宝石GBA
其次，我可以说这个游戏是格斗型的RPG，技能很多，研究技能点我觉得也是乐趣之一
然后呢，这个游戏整体难度偏高，解谜的时候真的很想给游戏策划来一棒子，不过解密成功之后内心也是美滋滋的
还有就是，这个游戏的装备非常多，装备各有特效，可以自己搭配，真的是很舒服hhh
对了，这个应该是德国出的游戏，各种严谨啊（然鹅被我玩死档了hhhh我也很绝望啊，客服态度很好，正在帮我解决了）

然后来说一说缺点吧
1.游戏对新手太不友好了，几乎没有什么提示，出现了新道具或者新的迷宫设备，几乎都是自己摸索出来的
2.游戏的迷宫真的是太太太难跑了。。。难道只有我自己觉得真的好难吗
3.主线剧情到第二个副本就没了，接下来的路都是没有剧情的，看不到萌主角说你好和再见了，好桑心啊
4.游戏里对装备特效没有注释，而且非要买了装备在身上才能看到特效的效果，还有一些装备特效说明写得模棱两可，表示完全看不懂啊。。

总之我觉得真的很好玩，第一次写测评，不会被打吧hhhh

32034968.review:
The control scheme isn't my favorite, considering you can only do melee attacks in the left, right, up, down, and diagonal directions, things are a bit awkward to attack in that regard.

The missions aren't "Get this!" "Kill this many things!" or "Talk to this person!" over and over, when you get a mission this game makes you really feel like they have purpose rather than an npc making you their arrand boy for an hour while you colect some random useless shit somewhere.

Since the game is in early access I should mention that this gme isn't even in its complete stage (no duh), but even so, for the content that is available (Time wise in my case 15h 52m worth of play time.) I feel as though I never wasted a moment doing something that wasn't fun for me to do. (sure, some times things get fustrating but thats part of the fun imo :3)

In conclusion, aside from my own very insignificant dislikes such as the limited keyboard melee directions. I feel like this game is worth the 20 buckaroos I paid for it, also I hope that anyone who does buy this game also finds the same enjoyment. :D

32034766.review:
首先感谢好友 MockingBird 的礼物。

这是一款非常不错的游戏，如果使用键鼠的话，操作性能极强。手柄操作略别扭。顺便强烈推荐不要把画质调的太好，3就够了，这样你才能得到最佳的像素风格，让你想起你玩16BIT主机的那些难忘的岁月。
游戏剧情引人入胜，代入感非常的强烈，仿佛让我真的有了作为女主角进入了这个庞大而又复杂的虚拟世界中的感觉，这里的每个NPC都活灵活现的行走于在场景之中，部分NPC之间还会有行动对话，如果你能耐心的看完他们你会发现这是一个相当有意思的设定。其中主角的小伙伴非常的有爱，她会经常性的和主角进行对话，内容主要包括路边的怪物太可爱、她快挂了、这里景色很不错、这是一个激光桥等等等等，让人感觉到她仿佛真的是一个存在于世界中的玩家。
战斗系统相当的可以，没有任何多余的按钮，只用非常少的按钮就可以完成近战/远战之间的操作、防御/闪避的快速使用、如果使用手柄还会有力反馈系统，同时在场景中移动也是行云流水般的丝滑，控制就在你的手中，你掌握着整个游戏。真正做到了是你在玩游戏，而不是游戏玩你。但值得注意的是游戏整体难度有点偏硬派，非常像过去的16bit的看游戏，非常考验操作力和反应力，稍有不慎就会残血挂掉，但如果操作到位和熟悉了敌人的动态，你就可以割草了。
游戏细节非常的出色，无论是水的刻画、NPC的小动作还是敌人的描写都达到了一个非常高的水准，能做到这些并不稀奇，能用像素来做到这些就可见作者有多么的用心去做好这款游戏。

目前来看最大的缺点有4个：
1是部分地方场景的高低差不是很明显，容易让人费解并迷路。
2是游戏大部分时间都在刷怪，且BGM重复度极高，长期容易枯燥和软疲。
3是汉化有些地方翻译错误，导致我浪费了很多时间和绕了很多的弯路。
不过总体来看，在操作性和带入感觉上，这游戏是相当可以的。
4是战斗等级判定，这个实在是太烦人了，有些任务需要的材料只有打敌人的时候战斗风格刷到B级才会掉落，掉落率低不说，等级高的时候几下就能杀死敌人，这就让判定直接是D了，太痛苦了。。

顺便谁来告诉我那个”奖励代码“是什么，百度无力。

32022025.review:
[h1]强烈推荐一波Cross Code[/h1]
这个游戏简而言之是[b]一款2D像素风的ARPG，融合了丰富的解谜和战斗元素，游戏的剧情设定也很吸引人。[/b]
如果你对这个游戏感兴趣，期待你能看一下我的这篇絮絮叨叨。

去年就关注了Cross Code，但是当时觉得还在内测，于是一直观望。
正好5月底答辩完了没事可干，一看这游戏出了官方中文，而且当时是88元，没记错的话跟我最初关注的时候相比打了7折，果断入手了。
目前是v0.92，还在内测，按照开发者的话来说目前地图已经开发放出的差不多了，但是剧情方面的进度相比较为缓慢，我目前已经把现有的五个地牢都打通了，而主线剧情应该还停留在第二个地牢的入场券那里，不过不影响，所有的地图和地牢目前可以无视剧情直接探索。
今天刚打通目前的内测版本，忍不住又出来写写感想，因为实在觉得很不错，希望更多的人能够看到它。

[h1]解谜[/h1]
这个游戏的很大一部分就是在于解谜，游戏中有4种元素形态，结合主角的远程攻击方式，在各个地牢中分阶段设置了非常丰富的解谜关卡。地牢中的各个谜题种类很丰富，根据剧情的推进，在一个个地牢中应用不同的形态解开各种机关。
前两个神庙的地图很大，跑一圈错综复杂，但是只要循序渐进，作者给你规划的路线也十分清晰，虽然没有明确的指引，但也不至于迷路；后三个地牢没有前两个那么大，但是解谜元素更加丰富，玩起来更加爽快，当你身处地牢，会觉得作者对于这些地牢解谜元素的设置真的是非常用心。
我觉得有的地方解谜确实有点难度，不仅要观察好如何去解，还需要一定的反应速度和操作速度，卡住一些时间点。

[h1]地图[/h1]
这个游戏让我更加觉得惊喜的是它的各个地图，尽管不是游戏中的地牢，但是[b]几乎每一个过场地图，都是一个解谜场景。[/b]
通过游戏刚开始就教给你了的简单的地形跳跃，如果你想收集每一个场景地图中的那些宝箱，需要仔细观察每一个场景地图的地形分布，去寻找那一个通向隐藏物件的一段道路。这个游戏，不得不说，我花在场景地图上的寻找宝箱时间，基本上是这个游戏主要的时间，有的时候甚至地图上想找到一个通向宝箱的道路比解开一个地牢小场景中的谜题还要麻烦。从卑尔根之路开始，往后的过场地图越来越丰富，甚至到后面有的图[spoiler]需要从前一个图，甚至前几个图的特殊路线开始行走，才能到达这个图的宝箱位置。[/spoiler][strike]如果你像我是一个抖M收集控，恭喜你，你有福了。[/strike]

[h1]战斗操作[/h1]
游戏毕竟是2D的像素风ARPG，玩起来很流畅，操作和战斗非常舒服。首先是它的远程弹道，我用的手柄，刚开始不是很习惯，不过到后来也觉得用起来很舒服，指哪打哪；近战的攻击也很有打击感，特别是后期蓄力的AOE满屏跳数字的时候。
而且这个游戏中，大部分敌人有元素适性特点，而几乎所有的敌人，都是有弱点的，特别是里面的各种大小BOSS战。[spoiler]你需要观察并且记住每一种敌人的破绽时间，及时地给出反击，让敌人进入破防状态，造成有效打击伤害，无脑莽只能让自己死的更快。[/spoiler]
游戏不能更改难度，对于我来说难度比较适中，比较难的战斗基本上重试个4~6次基本上找到敌人的行动模式和破绽也都能过，不过还是需要一定操作的，不然有的地方由于手残而死活过不去的话还是有点影响游戏体验的。

[h1]剧情设定[/h1]
整个游戏的设定在未来，主角战斗的这个大陆是一个虚拟大陆，整个场景设定有一种[spoiler]SAO(刀剑神域)[/spoiler]的既视感，NPC的互动程度目前来说也还可以，有人跟你组队，有工会成员可以跟你远程聊天，虽然这个社交系统目前还是很基础的状态，但是这个游戏的整体设定给人的代入感已经很强了，[strike]仿佛自己和几个网瘾少年在玩虚拟现实的网游。[/strike]
这个游戏的剧情中，一上来给你埋下了一个悬念，但是目前的版本中，剧情的放出程度并不高，所以主线上基本还讲述得不多，还是很期待后续这个完整的主线故事。
主角莉亚设定上[spoiler]语言故障，但是颜艺还挺丰富的，有的剧情对话因为语言故障的原因也挺有意思。[/spoiler]

[h1]任务/物品收集[/h1]
游戏除了主线之外，有不同的NPC给不同的支线任务，大部分支线是跟场景地图有关的，主要是提供经验和一些小物品，在主线之余扫扫那些支线也挺有趣的，也需要花不少时间。由于任务在地图上不会有明确的指引，需要靠对话或者任务本身的说明去定位地图，因此有的支线接的位置，或者是任务中需要寻找的东西的位置也挺隐蔽的，[strike]让你在游戏中学会乖乖听任务说明。[/strike]
在各个过场地图中，有各个主题场景对应的植物，通过打怪/割草，可以收集到不同的材料，用这些材料来兑换当前地图等级的装备。结合之前整个游戏的设定，有时候需要打怪练级割草换装备，还是需要偶尔小刷收集一阵的，有种网游的感觉。
游戏中也有一些稀有装备，通过特殊的手段获取，通过特殊的商人和材料进行升级，期待后面的完善。

[h1]小缺点[/h1]
因为是2D像素风格，有的时候地图高低差不明显，需要稍微仔细判断，偶尔会影响过场地图中隐藏路径的寻找。
[strike]2个月更新一次啊啊啊啊啊！！没有后续可玩我要死了！！[/strike]据说17年秋季左右就放正式版了，期待。
[strike]目前这个游戏知名度似乎不是很高，网上基本没攻略，各种解谜完全靠自己。[/strike]

画面：8/10给我的印象非常好。虽然是像素风格，但是细节很出色。属于我个人比较喜欢的类型。
操作：9/10人物动作非常流畅，打击感不错。虽然我比较手残。但是玩的还是很开心。
战斗：8/10战斗和解谜都有一定难度，虽然手柄跑路很舒服。但是要瞄准依然得用键鼠。
剧情：8/10目前玩的进度来看，只是冰山一角。希望能带来更多惊喜。
汉化：有简体中文，加分
缺点：对手柄不友好。汉化中规中矩，任务汉化上有一些错误，导致任务很难完成。

个人评价：8.5/10

31985707.review: Beautiful game, the story is simply one of the best ones I've had the pleasure of experiencing (and I've played a lot of games: consoles, handhelds, and the ever-loving Master Race :D). The combat is extremely fluid and it's always fun running around murdering hordes and hordes of hedgehogs and mole rats (is that what they are? imma just call'em diggletts). For an early access game, there's not quite a lot of the story implemented in the game yet, but the number of side quests are enough to keep you busy until you ACTUALLY have to get whatever parts of the story are in the game done and be sad cuz the whole thing aint there yet. Some quests which require finding items may be a bit of a chore but there lots more interesting side quests to do. Although the game is good enough to play already (and I haven't encountered any sort of glitch or bug, lucky me :D), I suggest waiting until the full game is released which is pretty soon (I remember it to be this year but I could be wrong) but if you want to support the dev's in this endeavor, go on ahead. Oh and play the demo, you'll love it (and help you decide wether or not to buy the game rn).

31929422.review:
战斗部分是标准的动作游戏，招式通过技能解锁，装备只改变角色属性，如果角色外观能够自定义就好了；
战斗节奏比较快，打击感不错；

有点像网游，NPC会给你任务，包括打怪收集素材，装备也要用地图上的素材去换，有刷刷刷的成分，但是量不多，不会让人不厌烦；
虽然像网游一样，经常需要跑图，但是角色移动速度比较快，跑起来还是比较舒服的；
有相当一部分的支线任务有专门的副本，这些副本都挺有意思；

副本难度适中，副本中几乎有一半的内容是解谜，解谜设计得不错，作者脑洞可以；

总的来说很好玩，十分推荐。

31921757.review:
木然视频推荐过来的，已经推完主线剧情。
首先非常感谢汉化组，虽然有些地方的汉化有存在一点问题，比如找4颗树的那个任务有个地方弄错了，还有怪物图鉴有些地方也 没翻译。虽然并不是太影响游玩，但还是希望能够尽快修正下。
       CROSSCODE这款游戏出彩的地方还是很多的，流畅的战斗，操作反馈也顺畅，音乐听着很舒服，让我想起了冒险岛STUDIOEIM的音乐。最让我兴奋的地图和迷宫的设计，一张地图可以挖掘的东西非常多，虽然迷宫解密这种东西让人又爱又恨，（才不会说为了做神庙迷宫的收集7个激光锄的任务花了两个钟呢！）。剧情方面，由于还没有后续完整的剧情，这个方面感觉有点薄弱，可以理解。在人设方面，给我最大印象的就是女主的无口属性（菜单里面居然还有统计女主说“Hi”的次数，真是满满的萌点）。
      不足的地方还是有的，装备系统方面有点平平，和游戏里的技能系统相比有点落差。支线任务没有什么故事，有种就是为了得奖励而刷任务，如果能有一些有故事的支线任务来侧面反映游戏里面世界就好了。（虽然里面本来就是个MMO游戏）。
     总的来说还是非常值得入手的游戏，从之前的一百多降到88元，还自带简体中文，如果你喜欢ARPG，这是一款不能错过的游戏。ps:非常期待后续的完整剧情。感谢开发组各位能让我玩上这么一款优秀的ARPG游戏。

中文出了，该给好评了

再不更新剧情我要死了

这个游戏是什么：
失忆主角在SAO里找记忆，邂逅各类网瘾少年的故事

有什么：
组队刷刷刷，平台跳跃，解谜，BOSS战

优点：
内容多，不糊弄，解谜难度适中

缺点：
当前版本的前期流程有问题，难度过高，第一个副本建议等级18级，然而在通过第一个副本之前根本没有愉快刷级的途径（愉快刷级得拿到火元素+法爷队友，都是过了第一个副本才有的事），最后10级拿头撞，痛苦一点，还是过了，毕竟地牢解谜成分占大头，然而BOSS战死成狗确实不是啥好体验

俯视角+2D游戏+平台跳跃=你根本找不到路，因为很难体现出高低差，好在地牢设计比较用心，视角限制不大，但是大地图就没那么走心了，找路找到头晕

31855041.review:
优秀的画面效果(以2D低像素游戏来说的话)，优秀的游戏设计，优秀的配乐，优秀的故事剧情和背景设定，中文翻译质量也很好，整体难度中等。
虽然可以选择键盘鼠标或手柄游戏，但还是建议用键盘鼠标玩，游戏的战斗操作更偏向键盘鼠标向，手柄玩起来的话，瞄准会比较麻烦，不过键盘鼠标操作的话，鼠标左键寿命会加速老化= =左键点击频率比FPS高多了。
虽然不能联机，游戏系统和界面也比较简洁，但感觉玩起来满足感比格兰蒂亚秘闻要高。
根据游戏内的百科完成度推断，目前游戏整个流程可能不是太长，不过因为场景中融入了不少解密环节，而且等级和装备水平和怪物相比太多的话，会比较难以打过，所以还是需要花一些时间用来刷刷刷，以及熟悉BOSS攻击套路的。
游戏有试玩版，感兴趣的童鞋可以下载下来玩玩，目前的价格买来很值得，让我回想起了小时候玩的GBA塞尔达传说。

31831763.review:
This game is totally worth the $20 in my opinion! 

It's an extremely charming game right away and had me hooked within the first few minutes. I actually didn't know that this was an early access game until just now. 

Pros: 
- Super charming art style and solid character dialogue
- Great music (although some of the songs are a bit silly/repetitive, overall I think the music perfectly fits this type of game)
- Fairly indepth character progression system with skills, gear, powerups to level up, etc. 
- Cool story so far
- Interesting puzzles that help to keep a variety in the gameplay. I think they were going for a "Zelda" type of feel with this game, and they totally nailed it. 

Cons: 
- A few minor things are "missing" from the game (but it's early access). These aren't anything major that take away from the gameplay, or story, and I haven't experienced bugs or crashes so far. Just a few minor "immersion" type of things are missing. 
- I found the quest system to be mildly confusing at first, but quickly figured out how everything works.

31717898.review:
Quite possibly one of the highest quality indie games I have ever seen, [i]and it's not even out of Early Access.[/i]

CrossCode is an effective love-letter to the era of SNES action RPGs, with smooth, engaging combat and challenging puzzle segments.

The combat is varied and requires different strategies to take out different enemies. You can fight enemies with both melee and ranged attacks at the same time. There are a huge amount of ways you can upgrade and customise both of these methods of attack.

The puzzles combine a wide variety of mechanics in order to provide various challenges for the player, which are always very satisfying to complete.

The 16-bit graphics are absolutely beautiful to look at, with extremely fluid and detailed animation, as well as stylish interfaces and character design. The game's characters are all well-written, unique and very likeable. Even the main character has a very clear personality, despite her vocabulary only consisting of around five words. This game is absolutely filled to the brim with witty dialogue.

CrossCode has an intriguing story, which involves the game's (mostly) silent protagonist trying to regain her memories and uncover her past. However, the game is currently unfinished, so you may have to wait a while to experience the story in it's entirety. (Even now, the game still has enough content to be worth the price tag.)

The developers of the game are constantly adding to and improving the game, though, and they are especially responsive towards the community.

31707975.review:
This game is early-access yet I feel I have gotten my money's worth already, and I'm very excited for the full release of the game. 

The art is incredible. 
The game feel is smooth and satisfying. 
Combat is enjoyable. 
As a huge music nerd I find the music in this game to be very well-done.
The dungeons are a great balance of being a challenge that gives you a sense of accomplishment without being so hard you lose all interest in the game.

The one con I found is that there is a big jump early on for what level you need to be, which involves a few hours of grinding. Surprisingly this didn't happen again as I progressed through the later areas. The enemies were placed at intervals and frequencies which got me close to recommended levels for how far in the story I was.

I'm not a fan of early access, most indie, or even pixel-art based games but this one really stands out. Add it to your wishlist and wait for a sale. Hopefully it will be closer to complete by the time you buy it.

Edit: Turn off the voice-acting also. It's not as good as the creators think it is.
Edit2: Nevermind, it was an April Fools joke.

31621515.review:
I first found this game as a demo on GameJolt, where I was amazed by the little story I could get and the fantastic gameplay.  I've always been a fan of pixel graphics, and with a mix of stylized text boxes, interesting mechanics, and a general plot that intrigues from square one, this game hits an interest point with me that most AAA games could only hope to achieve.
The game is only complete up to the middle of the fifth chapter, but each chapter has interesting story mechanics, as well as an upgrade system that I personally love.  I absolutely love this game - especially coming off of free-roam games like Skyrim and Tales of Berseria, and as a person who goes out of his way to find indie games like this.
Because I don't want o spoil the story, I'll end the review here.  However, as a final note, take care to all players who try to charge through levels without doing sidequests or grinding - you may have a hard time with a certain area.

31576476.review:
so, this is to be my first time reviewing a game on steam, and man, its a good one.

i hadn't played any RPGs before this one (unless you count the pokemon ranger games) and i went into it not knowing what to expect. fortunately, i noticed the free demo as i was about to click off and thought: "hey, what the heck, i'll give this a go."

from then on, as soon as it booted up the title screen, i was hooked. the combat feels really great and the dodging is just as offensive as it is defensive, allowing you to pull off range-melee-special (in that order) combos and do massive damage in seconds.

after i finished the demo (if you're unsure go play that) i immediately bought the full game, even though it isnt finished. i didn't care, the combat was so good, there is light bits of humour every now and then too, the characters were lovable, the story was better than i thought and i rarely play games for story (thats a lie, i own "to the moon"), and the world was awesome. now, the story goes (dont worry i aint spoiling anything) that you are a girl called lea who has been hacked into this mmo to try and get your memory back, now while it isnt an mmo, i remember myself constantly thinking: "if this was an mmo, i would play the heck out of it," because the world was really well designed. now as you travel through this world you meet new characters, the main side-character is called emilie and she accompanies you mostly throughout your journey in your party (yes there is a party system, i heard those are pretty common in RPGs), but whether she is or isnt available depends on if she's online, MORE WORLD BUILDING which is really cool cause it makes you feel like you're playing an actual MMO. 

the sidequests are mostly pretty good and save you from grinding if you do them before you over level and the amount of exp you get from them becomes negligible. the dungeons are well designed and the bosses look and feel cool. especially the first one which is just the "hit the enemy crab in its weak spot for massive damage" https://youtu.be/kF8POaO-9TY?t=135

in conclusion, whether you're going in for the story, the characters, the awesome combat or just because the art style looks nice, i would highly recommend this game and even more so when it comes out of early-access. it has introduced me to the world of RPGs and you can be sure i'll be looking out for more in the future.

12월15일 한글패치가 되었습니다. 한글은 옵션에 가셔서 언어- 한국어 설정을 하신 뒤, 껐다가 다시 재 시작을 하셔야 적용됩니다.참조하세요.

액션만을 강요한 것이 아니라 때로는 퍼즐을 이용해 보스를 잡거나 플레이 진행을 해야하는 경우도 종종 있기에 도트+퍼즐+소소한 액션을 즐기는 유저라면 추천.

단점이라면 퀘스트가 주어질 때 해당 아이템이 어디서 떨구는지에 대한 상세한 설명이 없다는 점과, 해당 맵의 어느 위치에 있는지에 대한 미니맵, 퀘스트에 대한 미니맵 표시가 없어서 상당히 불편한 점이 있습니다.

(예시로 퀘스트 내용에 식물에서 나오는 잡템중 저녁에만 나오는 잡템도 종종 뜨는데 잡템 아래 설명을 자세히 읽지 않으면 영영 못 찾을 수 도 있다. 심지어 이 아이템 드랍률이 상당히 낮다는 점.)

또한 아직 완성된 버전이라 그런지 일부 메인 퀘스트 및 마을안 건물들이 미개발 상태여서 개발중이란 문구도 종종있습니다. 계속해서 추가적으로 나오고는 있습니다만, 스토리가 도중에 끊긴 부분 때문에 뭔가 찜찜한 구석도 있을겁니다. 그렇지만 서비 퀘스트가 너무 많은지라... 다 깨실려면 시간이 사당히 소모되니 걱정 안하셔도 될듯 하네요.


매우 매끄러운 움직임과 머리를 써야하는 퍼즐, RPG요소 덕에 값어치 이상의 본전은 물론, 플레이 타임 시간이 길다는 점으로 볼 때 충분히 그 값어치를 한다고 볼 수 있습니다.

31498789.review:
CrossCode is so far one of the top indie games of the last decade, and it hasn't even been released yet.

I've already put over 50 hours into this game.

I would rate it's difficulty overall as "very difficult," but absolutely fair, and I think that is a very accurate rating. The overall quality of this game is top-notch, with its attention to detail going above and beyond. The feel and pacing of the combat, the ingenuity required to solve some of its puzzles, and the ability to synthesize new techniques based off skills you've already learned in order to more overcome and solve new situations and obstacles. CrossCode does all of that, and nearly flawlessly.

This game is as puzzle-heavy as it is difficult with combat. Every nook and cranny in the game has some sort of adventure and treasure behind it. This makes the game's progression a bit predictable, but this kind of game style also isn't for everyone, as it can be "too" much in that direction for some players. I think CrossCode does this all really well though, and I was really really impressed playing the game.

The layout and aesthetic of each puzzle in CrossCode is top-notch, particularly the path-finding ones around Autumn's Rise and Bergen Trail. The colors, intricacies, and layout of each area take hold on your thoughts as you try and piece meal it all together. Almost all of CrossCode's secrets felt fair and worthwhile, and so I did them all without any real hints. Visually, later on, you'll encounter a really lush, dense environment that reminded me of the scene of stumbling across Tesla's 'castle' in The Prestige.

The music tracks are very relaxing, which was really nice. The game keeps a sobering pace with the appearance of 'tough' enemies: just as you think you've come out an area, something far more brutal to your life and your party's comes into your attention. The combat is varied and easy to get into, with different strategies required for almost every new enemy encounter. As well, Radical Fish Games has put a lot of effort into giving the player a really meaningfully clear and seamless transition to navigate, peruse, and switch out and use your gear and health items.

One thing I wish could have been explained a bit more was the saving system: The game saves whenever you change screens or visit a new area. This means that if you spend 20 minutes in one area killing baddies and searching that one piece of treasure, if you die, you lose all of it! But once you figure that out, saving becomes pretty quick.

To make this a perfect game for me I would want to see Radical Fish Games add in a little bit of a bigger splash of spontaneity into the game. There are a few areas where they have done something like this already (Pumpkin Funland???), but I want to see this spontaneousnes grab CrossCode by its horns and say "Hey! Don't forget about this!" Something to keep player thinking after they have already solved the game. But CrossCode isn't finishd yet; we have yet to see how the story and all its characters will play out.

The first time I accidentally aggro'd two friendly-looking enemies later in the game, they wiped my team and me in under 3 seconds. Those kinds of moments were some of the best, An enemy I initially hated grew to be one of my most liked after a particular encounter forced me to take them more seriously than I had before.

tl;dr it's as if Dark Souls took its combat and wrapped it in the clothes of Secret of Mana. 5 Stars, highly recommend.

31431924.review:
Best ARPG in human history (only a personal view though). The maximum discount is 15% (16% in Chinese yuan), so feel free to purchase it whenever you want.

Let me introduce the element of this game:

[h1]Background[/h1]

The game is set in a far future, where human colonize among the galaxy. A big corporation have been used a planet as a playground "CrossWorld"for their players, using "instant matter" to build artificial bodies "CrossGear"safe upon destruction, for players to log in.

[h1]Story[/h1]

A girl who has lost her all memories wakes up in a CrossGear on the ship the game corporation owns. The staffs advise her to play in the crossworld to regain her memory. The girl called Lea even has speech problem in the crossgear - but luckily she meets a nice and outgoing French girl Emilie, who teams up with her and takes her to a friendly guild.

[h1]Music and Graphic[/h1]

The game has two kinds of fighting - outside in the nature, where the heroine and her friends teamed up to smash hostile and innocent monsters; and inside the dungeon, where Lea must rely on her own to solve puzzles, and use the environment (such as barriers, bombs, bubbles, lightnings) as advantage, to fight alone with techniques.

While in the nature, there are different biomes, with gatherable items, each with a group of music with styles. What I personally like best, is the oasis area in the Maroon Valley, where dragonfly like creatures fight with their flames, also "palmapples" and "cactones" to harvest.

Inside the dungeon, there are more asethetic decorations, corresponding to the theme of the whole dungeon (like the 4 elements - cold, fire, shock, wave). At the fire themed dungeon, there are even a beautiful sightseeing platform to let you rest for a bit.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Features:
[list]
    [*]Teleportation: As you are playing in a story based "online game", you can technically teleport to every landmark at any time, instead running for a long time.
    [*]Trading System: You can trade botanic fibres, loots, existing equipments, for gems, unique food, better and even legendary weapon and armor. Which is more realistic than a crafting system.
    [*]Skills - they are implemented as "circuits" - which contains many branches. You consume CP gained at leveling, to activated the modules you want - and you can reset the circuit anytime for a small fee. There are 4 kinds of combat arts - dash, throw, melee and guard, also 4 element modes gained by finding in dungeons.
Puzzles - I have to admit there are too many puzzles, which can make the player fatigued  - but it's worth it - given the powerful loot (outside) and the perks (inside, in dungeons) you gain.

[/list]

31357586.review:
[h1]Quick summary:[/h1] CrossCode is a game set in a viritual mmo known as crossworlds. You play as Lea, A mute sphereomancer with amnesia, she got hacked into the game because it was beleved she could get her memories back from playing the game. So now you are playing a singelplayer simulation of an mmorpg that feels more like a true mmo than other big titles in the gangre.

[h1]Begining of the game:[/h1] The game begins with a tutorial level set on a cargoship where the story is gradualy revealed to you as new game mechanics are introduced, After geting introduced to the core mechanics of the game you meet the captain of the ship, he explains your situation you are in and tells you to have a look around the ship.
After talking to the crew of the ship your final test before geting to crossworlds begin, You need to destroy a turret to prove you have understood the games core mechanics.
[spoiler]While fighting the turret a mysterius figure apears and attack the ship claiming he knows who you are, however to test if you are ''Worthy'' you have to figth a gigant crab made of scrap, this is the actual final boss of the tuorial.[/spoiler]
After all of your tests you finaly get to crossworlds where you encounter you main rival called Emmelinator, You then encounter your first dungeon where you are finaly allowed to experience the real game, You clear a few interesting puzzles, fight some lesser minions and fight another boss, After that you unlock the circuit (otherwise known as your talent tree).

[h1]Main Game:[/h1] 
[list]
    [*] Combat: Crosscode uses Action combat with quick thinking and fast reactions. The game gets hard quickly and you will have to learn how to use the combat system in your favor, Your character plays the role of a  Sphereomancer, Sphereomancers uses small projectiles known as viritual ricochet projectiles and quick movement to confuse your oponents. You also have 4 unlockable abbilities based on each of your core functions (Shield, Dash, Meele attack and range attack). Some monsters and bosses are a combination of puzzles and combat because you have to solve a problem when fighting them. The game handles combat great and i never reale feelt cheated by an enemies abilities.
    [*] Elements: Over the duration of the game you will unlock elemental combat, there are 4 elements in total (Heat, Cold, Shock and Wave) excluding your neutral attacks. Elemental abilities are more powerfull versions of your basic combat kit and they all bring a new mechanic to the table. However because these elements are so powerfull you have a special restriction called Elemental overload. When you're using elemental abilities you gain overload, after your overload is maxed out you reach elemental overload making you unable to use elements for a while so only use elements when its requiered for a puzzle or to combat specific enemies. Elements overall brings a more diverse combat system to the table and gives you more of a choice in combat.
    [*] Circuits: The main circuit is divided into 4 major paths (Health, Defence, Damage and Utility) and in my experience all of them are usefull in their own areas however i feel like a balance between all of them is the best way to go since all the paths give you special abilities that are almost required in combat. There are also a circuit for each of your elements, these however are not as linear as the others and they're all over the place, i would much rather have the main circuits 4 paths in all circuits because i just end up spending my points randomly becuase there realy isnt any way to specify in an area of gameplay when you are using elements. 
The circuits overall help you develop your own playstyle, atleast in the main circuit. There is still a few issues that i think could be easily fixed but it's still a very interesting way to handle a talent tree.
    [*] Puzzles: The puzzles are by far my favorite part of the game because they are so cleverly done, they are difficult enough for it to be a chalange but it's so well made that no puzzles realygets frustrating. Most of the puzzles work together with the games core mechanics in a way that makes them both shine. There is not much i can say about the Puzzles, They are great and by far the best part of the game. If you like puzzles i would realy recomend this game to you.
    [*] Trading and Equipment: The trading system in CrossCode is quite unique in the sense that you don't just buy equipment and consumables with money, you also need the to own the required resources to craft for the itesm you want. As an example, if you wanted to buy a rookie helmet you might need 200G, 5 petals and 7 scrap. I like the crafting system because it doesnt just let you buy gear and blaze trhough the game, it somewhat slows dont the story and introduces grinding to the game, Sure grinding isn't realy a good thing but i think that in small amounts it gives you more content even though some people might argue it's Bad content. Overall the trading system is prety solid even thoguh it takes some time to get all the materials you need.
    [*] Secrets: The overworld is covered in secrets both big and small, it couldbe a secret path that leads to a chest or a whole new are that you had to find by yourself. Anywhere you go there might be secrets o keep your eyes open. Some secrets take understanding of the game to reach and some just arent avalable until you find a new element. It seemed like i found a new secret every time i went through an area, sometimes you dont procede with the story just because you realy want to kill a secret boss or finish a special quest. Secrets give you something else to do other than just doing quests and folowing the main plot.
    [*] Social: During the game you meet npc's that are created to act like other players of the game, These character cover all of the other classes that Lea can't be, These characters can be invited to the party and are very usefull if you need help with killing a monster. These characters can not participate in dungeons however so don't get to dependent on them, The first character you meet is called Emmelinator. [spoiler]She is your main rival in the game, she is a french girl who gets in trouble alot because she plays Crossworlds with Lea instead of working.[/spoiler] I like Emmelinator, She is very competetive and gives you a nice early companion to play around with, she is also very usefull in combat and can tank damage for you, she plays as a Pentafist wich is prety much a brawler class.
The game also includes guilds where you can meet other npc's that you later might be able to invite to your party. The guild is also good if you get stuck because they will give you info about the game so can easily procede.
    [*] Graphics and sound: Im not realy one to care about the graphics in a game but i realy like Crosecode's theme and artstyle, The game is a 2D retrostyle game with a 3D enviroment, For instance there are elevated surfaces that you can ump from and that kind of creates a parcour like element in the game.
The music is realy solid and i dont have any problem with the diferent soundtracks, the only issue i have is that the songs get a it repetetive at times but it realy isn't that big of a problem.
    [*] Story: [spoiler]The story in Crosscode is devided into 2 parts (Lea's story and Crossworlds story). Lea's story mentions that she lost her memory and was found by a group of people who though she might get her memory back by playing Crossworlds, While venturing through the game you start to relize that Lea is part of a bigger sceeme. Meanwhile in Crossworlds the players are folowing the path of the ancients. The path of the ancients is the main quest line in Crossworlds and it makes the players walk in the footsteps of the creators of the world to figure out what kind of people they where and what secrets they hid away. [/spoiler]
[/list]

31354841.review:
死命推荐。

1.游戏性:可玩度非常高.复杂的地图，各种各样的支线任务，非常真实让人感觉不到寂寞的会Direct Link你的NPC们，即使是单机玩这个游戏也完全不感到孤独。
而且说真的，这个剧情相当有意思的，是属于，让人玩过，就想一直接着玩下去。不只是觉得爽快或者有趣，还有想要搞清楚将要发生的事情，就类似看到喜欢的小说的精彩剧情一样。
不同于一般的arpg，除了打怪买装备升级加技能，这个游戏，特别是Dungeon里，非常非常注重的一点是解谜，推箱子啊丢炸弹啊一点也不无聊，稍稍动点脑筋真的非常有趣味。

2.音乐：赞到我想拿来循环。古早的风格曲调却不会让人感到厌烦，唯一可惜的是现在还没有正式，所以也没有ost。

3.操作性：虽然一开始Cut和Ball用鼠标操作可能有点不习惯，但是习惯了之后，哎呀，这个手感，我给你讲，赞！
而且这个游戏的技能非常懂什么叫做实用和浪漫，技能用起来非常、非常舒服。
3能量槽的大技更是让我想起了当年已经忘却的何为浪漫。
三连闪避用起来也是舒服的不要不要的。

4.关于敌人：杂兵攻击模式普遍算不上多彩，到后面才有一些有意思的，不过基本上都是模式掌握就问题不大。
Boss很有气场和Boss风范，按照血槽削减变强也是让人回想起以往。

不管是怀旧，还是喜欢这类的游戏，抑或者其他原因，这个游戏确实非常值得一玩。

31309618.review:
In general, I try not to review early acess games, as any complaints or issues may or may not be solved. But every so often, a game comes along that deserves an early review. CrossCode deserves just this. Despite being unfinished as of yet, this game stands out.

Cross code is a game that will not hold your hand. It will teach you the controls, but from then on, does not hold back ethier. 

Despite having clear snes insprations, this game has an identity of it's own. Fights happen in real time and leave you to figure out how to solve them. It's not a "mash this button to win" kinda of deal. Knowing when to dodge, when to block and when to fire abilites is critical.

Where CrossCode stands out especially well for me is it's writing and presentation. Despite having some things that still need work, the "game world" feels vibrant, immersive and fairly well polished. 

There are witty comments and asides on the nature of gaming in general hidden all throughout. Party members comment on what your doing in a non-intrusive, often character driven way. Even random NPC's in the game respond in a way that seems to imply they have their own lives.

Honestly, the characters in this game each appear to have a personality of their own, with great moments of well placed facial expressions or moments of mystery. This even extends to the char you play, named Lea. She is unable to speak much, but is far from your typical slient hero, coming off charming despite barely saying anything.

Now, being early access this game does have a few issues. Particularly there are some balance issues to overcome. Sometimes the puzzles or boss fights can be overly punishing, expecting you to do near perfect to achieve a goal, or having some obscere angle that is required to pass an area. Platforming in this game is a major factor, and while working well most of the time, can be frustrating.

There is no "jump button." Walk to an edge and you'll jump, weither you want to or not.. meaning if you are trying to line up your character, you might instead jump before your ready and have to repeat the whole thing. Upgrading gear isn't too straightforward ethier, meaning you'll be farming for an upgrade for awhile many times, or will come across bosses that can nearly one shot you.

Then too, at this time, it should be mentioned that being an unfinished game, the story line is NOT complete. Despite these frustrations though, the game overall feels rewarding and fun to play. The RTS elements mean each fight is engauging. Even trash mobs take some forethought, such as how many you can take on and who is doing what when.

Indeed, while there is some rough edges to the game, the care that has gone into it is appearent. The game tries a few things to give some variety to the standard "beat up this to win." For the most part, this is done sucessfully. Also, the devs are active with their game and their community, with proper reasons why something is going to be happen. They have clear goal in mind, but are also not beneath having some fun with the masses in the process.

I am glad I purchased this game and dispite it's early acess status, I do recommend it.

31287708.review:
Crosscode.... where to begin...



I can count the amount of games I've really enjoyed from start to complete finish (or in this case, almost finished) on a single hand. This game has great potential. So far? It's been pretty good. Let's get into it!


Story: (?/10) Can't rate the story since it's not finished, but thus far (8/10)

You can't talk. You can't remember. You make funny 'ha-ha's' with your 'why?' (..Not gonna spoil that too much, but it made me laugh a bit). That's pretty much it. A story of self-discovery for the most part. Oh, right.. and you have a creepy blue avatar stalker senpai.

Gameplay: 8/10

What I played was good. Fast, responsive, tactical, impactive and hard (depending on the situation). My most memorable events in this game would be taking down Apollo without a single scratch, and taking on the 'lighthouse' when it was just a 100 monster room without healing items. Got all 100 in a single go, but it was a decent challenge.

When enemies out level you, you'll definitely feel it though. They hit like bricks. Barely take any damage, but there's a single great thing. The quests, and story itself. It feels like a good mix. There's your super serious quests, and the funny ones. Take the Legendary Bunny one as an example. It has a decent mix.

The monsters are rather interesting. From raging bulls (of doom!) to snowmen (of doom!). To the cute little bunnies, sorry bunnies but I needed those exp points.

Hope you like puzzles, because some of them require a bit of thinking.


Sounds: 7/10

The music is amazing, the sounds for the attacks, and various other things are great. The splash sound when you purposefully jump into the water. However, this was made only better by the most fabulous voice acting (during april fools, doesn't affect my score). The songs were catchy, though... maybe Lea should get her own unique them? I mean Apollo's got that thing going on. "Hi... Hi.... Hi... Bye...Hi.."


Graphics (?/?)

Sorry, while the game looks amazing, I do not rate games on graphics. To be frank though, I'm still waiting on a giant rat boss.


Overall (8.5/10)


This game has the potential to be something great. For the first time in a good long while. This is a game I don't want to have an end, and go on potentially forever. Of course, all great things must come to an end. This game, fortunately, will still have some surprises for me. Hopefully, the game will have quite a bit more story after collecting all the elements, but time will tell.


Now, the big question. Is it worth the twenty dollars in its current state? Quite frankly? Yes, it's worth every penny. Despite not being entirely done, even if it doesn't (you better >.<). You still get an amazing experience for the value.

As of 11/25/2017. Still definitely worth it.

地图探索完毕开启机关后，可以大大减少后续路程的时间，但我觉得这个减的还不太够，不过因为是2D且地图也不是很大，熟悉路径的话也花不了多少时间，然而我还是经常在某些地方掉下去要重来啊啊啊啊……
技能树加点这个……除了被动全点我真没觉得有啥特别要选的，而且因为是四系技能分开，所以就是普加了，据说可以全部加满，但我看现在的等级和经验，不太可能。所以游戏里的洗点到底有啥用……又不是偏重某系要重新选择，本身涉及到技能分支的地方还可以自由切换。
哦，差点儿忘了，之前说找不到riped apple，妈蛋我是去autumn'rise 找的啊，人家是在autumn'fall产出的啊……我心中一万头草泥马……深深的感觉自己是个傻逼……还有basin keep的黑市进入任务mushroom kingdom，明明就在黑市上半部分入口右边的那个房子里，人家房门口写的open，我走过那么多次都没看到……真心服了自己……不过总算全最强装备齐了，秒怪好爽，hiahia~

总之
买买买走起，你还等啥？不过也可以等正式版吧……上次公告说在六七月……我自己是有得等了

首发于4月19日：
我靠，这游戏确实值这个价。。。一兆一块钱啊。。。进第一个地宫的时候我都已经21级了，;-)
我是野外割草狂人。。。开始的时候还没觉得，打第一个地宫的时候才发现作者脑洞略大，后面估计有更多惊喜~~

4月28日更新：
http://crosscode.gamepedia.com/CrossCode_Wiki
（这是个好东西，推荐一下，基本都能查到，不过也不全毕竟游戏本身都还在开发）
首先，要吐槽steam这个莫名其妙的中文输入框，实在是太烦了，我受不了用记事本打完了之后复制粘贴进来的。
其次，steam记录的游戏时间是不准的，因为老婆和娃有事儿随时可能离开，然后就挂机了……游戏内记录的时间是38个小时（其实这个时间也有不少是在挂机的）。

言归正传。
目前30级，打到fajro temple，还没有打完，中间打了一段到tim的时候被卡的想哭，实在受不了跑出去刷材料做武器giga spiral drill。
我是没太搞懂里面的一些属性影响，开始的时候打Tim（小头目）老半天破不了盾，破完我攻击力太低一次砍不到1/3血，这货有盾被攻击会发小火，喷火没啥，但是冲撞范围大还带追踪，我试了好久都搞不懂要怎么去躲。查了wiki，里面说要靠墙，好像是有点儿效果，反正我不耐烦了，出去做了装备进来硬杠正面，一轮就打死了……
打完中段boss之后我以为很快就到守关boss的，结果我真是太天真了……后面的机关比前面还多而且还麻烦，继续死脑细胞……我觉得我都快玩出braid的感觉了，那个可是没有查资料自己想出来怎么解通关的。玩这个解不出谜题受不了的时候我就上youtube查视频了，话说这游戏在国内几乎找不到什么资料。
作者脑洞真是大啊，各种要素各种组合机关，开始的时候想怎么解，想出来了还要试不一定对，有些是解出来了还要手快，可怜手残……从前面到目前的进度来看，各方面都是循序渐进的，不会觉得突然很难什么，也可能是因为我太偏重探索，基本是清完地图和任务才继续主线。


几个问题。
circuits的设置似乎复杂了点儿，我打到现在才有点儿搞明白，技能因为只有描述没有展示，最后我基本都加了被动除非没得点了；
status里的modifier类其实东西挺多，不过效果不明显（大概是我不敏感吧……）反正基本看到怪都是直接莽的；
哦，对了，说到怪物，基本每种怪物都有特定弱点，搞定出弱点好打很多，这个wiki上都有列的；
ripe apple、sunset dew还有几个其他道具，在wiki是能查到掉落的，然而游戏中botanics下面却找不到，更重要的是，我按照wiki上的资料去野外刷植物，打了一个多小时啊啊啊啊，一个也没掉啊啊啊啊，简直扯，我怀疑要么是改了要是没实装，有了解的同学求解惑，感激不尽。


总之这游戏非常推荐，虽然现在没中文，不过据说有汉化组接手了。然后作者说正式版只会更贵，正式发布一年内不打折，我屁颠颠去原价买了，然后第二天降17%……Orz
