28333925.review:
I bought this game two days ago. I have played 18 hours. I am also in the middle of finals. In conclusion: I am not a smart man.

CrossCode is an amazing game made by an awesome team of developers, I honestly wish I knew about this game before so I could have backed the crowdfunding. The combat is smooth and the amazing control scheme on the mouse and keyboard makes for an "easy to learn, hard to master" style of gameplay. When combat gets boring, interesting puzzles consistently push the boundaries of the game's mechanics.

The art and animations are beautiful. Motion looks fluid and detailed, making combat look stellar once you master the basic concepts. One criticism I will give, however, is the forgettable soundtrack. Nothing particularly stands out as awful to listen to, though Bergen Village is slightly annoying, but nothing really stands out at all. On the same note, during lengthy battles you will sometimes notice a lack of sound effects with some enemies' attacks and this can be a bit odd.

That aside, I absolutely adore CrossCode and can not wait for the final release with the entire story. There is so much potential with the already loveable Lea and extremely interesting world that has been set up. If you're a fan of MMOs or RPGs in general, you will enjoy this game.

28300803.review:
AMAZING to say the least.

This game takes old aspects in games and brings them anew. The art style is marvelous, the characters are likable and the gameplay by far is STUPENDOUS! As you progress through the game, you get rewarded with even MORE gameplay. I would recommend this game to anyone, new or old.

Graphics [NOTE! This game is 2D, but I don't think it detracts from it's score] 10/10: The details in the sprites and just the overlay in general is enough to leave your jaw dropping. Some of the best art work I've seen in a video game. Considering these were hand draw, they came out FABULOUS and you can just tell that whomever drew the cutscenes did so with much love and care. The world it's self is drawn in a detailed manner it's self and the sprites are very appealing to the eyes. I can say nothing less about the art in this game.

Gameplay 10/10 - As you progress through the game, it gets only better and better. Elements are a big component in this game. Not only that, the punishment for using them is not that severe and they look SPECTACTULAR! You feel as if you're powerful, without a detraction from the difficulty level. The game proceeds to be difficult and though weapons and armor can make a difference, the game still remains difficult. The puzzles are immersive and very well thought out as well. Well place and well done. Though, it may be a detriment to those who don't enjoy that style, I feel it brings moments where you're challenged to know how the game works to progress forward and getting better at doing so. New trees open up to you as you obtain new elements and the game doesn't punish you completely for building in certain ways. You can even switch what you want if it's important enough. And of course, the enemy designs are guaranteed to challenge you too. Knowing which element to use at the right time can make all the difference in this game.

Story 7/? - To be honest, I don't know what the complete story is so far, but so far it's been pretty great. The characters have been likable and though it starts off a little "cliche", it's fitting of what's happening. They kind of start you off with the whole your character has amensia thing, but there are other elements to redeem it so far. I leave the question mark as a symbol of whether or not it should get a better score or not because there have been certain things to hint for a better story and again, the characters are very likable.

Music 8/10 - The music's pretty good. I can see inspiration from other games and can tell the musician put a lot of work and time into the music to match it's environment. The "Zoom" reminded me of a part from Chrono Cross for example in one part of the game. (You'll see if you get past the first city) I felt there could have been more power behind the instruments but they still met their purpose.

Overall 10/10

This game has overall been amazing. I have been nothing less than impressed.

28186350.review:
Short and sweet:
Fantastic early access game with really satisfying gameplay certainly worth the $20 price tag.

Tad bit longer:
CrossCode is a throwback to old retro 2D arpgs. The premise is fresh and the setting believable. Gameplay is highly rewarding with very smooth and natural feeling controls (I play with a gamepad), and the art style is very pleasant.. The story is, so far, interesting, but I've personally found it hard to engage with it completely, often times being overwhelmed with the exposition (probably a personal issue and not one to be found in the game). As of today, I have only run into one area that was incomplete, as the game is still in early access. But, it makes you feel like you're really setting out on a journey and I'm certain the content will keep you happy for many hours. I'm already almost 10 hours in and just barely getting to the very first legitimate boss.

I'm doing  a series on the game if you'd like to check it out. It's a Let's Play and not a walkthrough, so expect commentary (bad commentary).
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWoBlfBG5Ww
If you like the video, please leave a like and subscribe to support my channel!

虽然现在剧情只完成了40%, 但战斗和解谜部分已经很令人上瘾了，忽视剧情的话已经是很不错的游戏了。
特别是新出的第三种元素模式——[strike]wifi[/strike]“波”挺新奇，有些“脑洞大开”的感觉。（其他三种元素——热、冷、电倒是比较传统）
全部完成后，从现在的情况和制作组的说法来看，估计有20小时的主线，加上支线任务等等收集元素，我觉得玩上40个小时没问题，这个售价虽然有点贵但是挺值的。

现在大概有两点担忧：一是开发进度，制作组已经好几次推迟预计的最终完成时间了，从一开始的2017年初，推迟到第一季度，再到第二季度，到今天刚公布的最晚2017年9月。不过制作组一直在积极地公布开发进度，看起来比较顺利。
二是剧情，为了防止剧透，制作组一直没有对剧情进行大的更新，目前来看核心可能是现实世界和虚拟世界的“交错”——这类剧情也比较老套了，估计很难写烂，但这么长的主线剧情能不能满足玩家的预期还要打上一个问号。

27914675.review:
CrossCode makes me think of a game I would've bought on a whim for the DS or GBA and be engrossed by the systems and fluid gameplay with its charming characters and excellent art. It's not finished, but it feels very polished and well-realized in its current state as of writing this.

I can't wait until this is finished. It is one of the rare games I actually continue thinking about after a session, wishing I had even more time to sink into it.

UPDATE for clarity: CrossCode is an Action RPG with a heavy emphasis on dodging and positioning, which can be done quickly and the controls feel tight (using an Xbox One gamepad). There is a skill progression system; they are mostly passives, with a few exceptions of the Active skills, which can be switched on the fly to a different branch. The music is fantastic as well as the art, which received a huge update since the last time I played it, which was back in the demo (I want to say early this year?). The dungeon design is heavily based on puzzle-solving. I have found all of the puzzles (haven't finished the Wave dungeon, yet) to be unique and interesting!

27912563.review:
From what I've experienced so far is great.

The combat is fantastic, it evolves as you progress to new zones. With the combat you utilize your skill sets and time attacks to render enemies vulnerable. However, it has a drawback sometimes and can end up hurting you. So be quick on your trigger fingers to weave around your enemies and dodge/block, it's more useful than you think.

The game is set in an MMO world that has the usual mmo elements like quests and dungeon instances. The dungeons contain a dungeon crawl aspect like LoZ Link to the past. 

Some issues that someone could come across is if the player can't handle fast-paced bullet hell style of gameplay. The penalty on dying isn't too bad as you always respawn at a check point. 

In short: if you like funny dialogue, bullet hell, puzzles, and grinding from time to time this game should appease you.

[list]

[*] Interesting Places to Explore
[*] Challenging Puzzles
[*] Tense Combat
[/list]

Crosscodes takes place in a [b] Virtual Reality [/b] game, also named Crosscodes, where the people and places are [b] real [/b] and the players aren't.  The "Playground" is a designated place where avatars, the player, could explore and try to find out about the Ancients, the creator of this world, which is part of the game's game's plot.

The Protagonist is [b] Lea [/b], an avatar who seems to have lost her memory.  Stuck with a dysfunctional speech system, Lea has to find out about her past while exploring the game she is currently playing.

This is a truly wonderful and addicting game.  Worth the $20.

27892743.review:
The amount of hours in game is probably more than the time i actually spent playing. As of me writing this review I haven't finished all the playable content that is available, and I haven't played in a while. I have finished the Faj'ro Temple, in which [spoiler]you receive the second element[/spoiler], if that gives you a better idea of where I am. It is by no means a bad game; it just falls short of the potential I saw in the original demo and has some caveats that make the game unenjoyable at times, which I currently don't see reflected in the reviews.

There are a lot of good ideas behind this game. However, due to the nature of the many features (like leveling, an expansive skill tree, equipment, and consumables) that they tried to shove into the game in combination with the existing combat, the balance has suffered and your character is incredibly overpowered. To compensate, they just made many of the generic enemies harder to hit, which just makes the game more frustrating. You spend a lot of time running around not only to avoid getting hit, but just to get the right timing and aim necessary for a few hits on your evasive enemies.
The player's strengths and weaknesses are not as reflected in these enemies strengths and weaknesses as they should be. The experience gains are also ridiculous. Just the quests alone will overlevel you, not even taking into account grinding with the exp and item drop boosts of the rank system, or the puzzle dungeons.

[b]Pros: [/b][list]
[*]Great exploration
[*]Decent puzzles
[*]Well structured boss fights
[*]Transparent dev team (if you're into that)
[*]Beautiful assets
[*]Resettable keyboard and mouse controls. Decent controller layout (but not remappable yet)
[/list]
[b]Neutral: [/b][list]
[*]Story starts out well, but slows down considerably
[*]Quickly switching elements while moving may be difficult on the default keyboard layout
[/list]
[b]Cons: [/b][list]
[*]Poorly balanced
[*]Tedious generic enemy fights
[*]Easy accidental overleveling
[/list]

[b]Other features of note: [/b][list]
[*]Expansive element based skill trees
[*]Quests with dynamic exp gains based on level
[*]Equipment
[*]Item drops
[*]NPC trading and shops
[*]NPC party system
[*]Various stats and lore menus
[/list]

Overall, the devs seem to have bit off a bit more than they can chew at this time, and the execution has suffered. It's not a bad game, but there are games with similar combat that play better.

Also, for anyone wondering, this game does support the Dualshock 4 controller.

27861577.review:
CrossCode has great, fluid combat, it is difficult yet fair, easy to pick up, but hard to master. The rpg style progression is well done (lots of skill tree choices, the ability to swap branches). The loot system is the best I've seen, it actually makes sense what creatures drop, and that you trade those drops in to traders for goods and equipment. The story shines, and although it obviously has influences from popular shows and games, it still keeps itself unique. The characters have great personalities; Emilie is a fun and relatable companion; and Sergey, while mysterious also is likeable. I've not seen enough of the other characters to form an opinion on them. The artwork of the game is a prime example of pixel art done right, it truly is beautiful. Between the gameplay, story, and beatuiful artwork, it is hard to find a flaw in CrossCode, but if I had to find one, it would be that, between quests and traders, the drop rate on some loot items isn't enough to obtain them in a reasonable amount of time. I often found I would be overleveled for the quest rewards once I managed to finally collect the resources. 

Although the game isn't close to its finished form, it still is a blast to play, and doesn't lack for content. The story stops at an early point (for plot purposes), but has other content to keep you playing. Unfortunately I prefer to complete the story slowly and explore everything at the same time, so I will not play until more is released. That said, even if you find that an issue like I did, it shouldn't keep you from supporting the developers through early access, they definitely deserve it.

27767108.review:
There's a really strong nostalgia factor to this game, in spite of not directly referencing any game in specific. It's a real love letter to the SNES era. It feels like a Super Nintendo game in every way (even thought the SNES would have NO hope of ever running anything like this). The gameplay is solid. Combat is tight. A healthy mix of skill and empowerment meets difficulty. The level design will have you possibly scratching your head for hours thinking "How on earth do I reach that chest?", which is a good thing for sure. The puzzles progress in challenge very naturally but the game nevers treats you like you're dumb.

Every bit of this game needs a quick brain for problem solving and quick fingers for spot-on reflexes without being too hard. The story is engaging (even if the prologue isn;t much touched on at this point (still early-access)) and the characters are lovingly enjoyable. The spin these guys have put on the "silent protaganist" is clever and deeply satisfying.

The visuals are stunning, the mechanics are sound and just....

I never want these guys to stop making this game. I want more CrossCode to keep coming out!

1年左右没玩，再次打开游戏，地图、剧情、人设、RPG元素都大幅度增添和改进，稍微有点强迫症的我在rookie harbor逛两圈发现几个捡不到的箱子和对话不了的人物心里特别痒

初期在autumn's rise的乌龟、地鼠、面具牛已经打得够呛，不低的攻击欲望+各种精准的诱导攻击（地鼠的石头、乌龟变球滚）+主要战斗按钮分布在L1R1R2+怪物扎堆仇恨联动，使得整个战斗系统都略难[spoiler]特别是初期到bergen trail打到PvP部分，9局5胜，我都打到赛点了，还是被无耻的有脸的剧情NPC莫名其妙的技能连放虐惨了，凭什么都是初期角色，你丫的扔球平A都没碰到过我，就能无限SP随便放skill，嗨呀好气啊！[/spoiler]

玩RPG游戏习惯性每个可对话NPC都对话完毕，能从NPC口中知道不少有趣的事情和游戏背景世界观知识
[spoiler]比如开头rookie harbor第一个地图靠左边的NPC支线任务会教你利用可站立的栏杆到达一些看上去不能到达的小区域，游戏前期puzzle+教学关卡的boss，在完成关卡后有2个NPC会对话，boss第二阶段台阶远离的时候可以顺势跳上去而不需要靠远程攻击在下面射老半天[/spoiler]

吐槽几点：
1、游戏没有中文
即使我可以通过翻词典勉强看得懂，但以背景故事MMORPG为底的故事还是略微吃力，特别是某些NPC的对话(只有像素人对话框，没有立绘特写那种)是自动推进的，很容易看漏

2、商店分布不合理
开头rookie harbor的集市有很多摊档，但里面绝大部分商品都是3W+金币加中后期材料换取，对于初期刚开始的人物来说很鸡肋。不过考虑到这游戏开发那么久才基本搞出一个大地图以及设定上庞大的世界地图来看也情有可原

3、游戏开发进度极慢
在登录greenlight之前开发组也在indiegogo和kickstarter众筹了不少钱，再加上光从steam评测看出来的600+*127RMB的钱，开发资金应该还是有的。也许是游戏背景过于庞大，编剧脑洞又不够大导致开发进度慢了？

总之对我来说是个好游戏，少有的在剧情和设定上吸引我的像素风ARPG，战斗系统还蛮不错，很期待游戏故事线的发展[spoiler]希望有生之年能看到完整正式版。[/spoiler]

I'm only 3 hours into this game and I must say I'm rather impressed!  I usually finish a game thoroughly before deciding if a review is necessary. In this rare case, the quality & originality of this game compelled me to write an early review.

A few facts you might want to know beforehand. Hopefully these facts will be beneficial and pursue you to purchase this game.

• Maybe not the first best impression but honestly I had a hard time setting up a gamepad to play this game. It took me some time to adjust playing with a keyboard and mouse. If you have a gamepad controller, you might want to do some research and find out of your controller is compatible. Sadly, mine was not. The keyboard controls are not too complicated but there is a slight learning curve until you get the swing of things. Once you get the keyboard and mouse adjusted to your preference, the rest is actually easy and enjoyable.
	
• So far, the storyline is interesting and keeps you hooked. I'm interested to see what will happen next. I'm really digging the sci-fi futuristic feel of this game. For some reason I feel a bit of "sword art online/portal" vibe going on. Not only is the storyline great, but the fast paced gameplay and puzzles tie together make this a pretty solid game. In simple terms, I'm not bored and believe me, I do get bored easily. This game will make you think and use that thing upstairs we call a brain. Time to get the hamster wheel spinning. 
	
• If you're looking for high resolution graphics and mainstream 3D technology, you won't find that here, instead you'll find old school graphics that might bring back some memories of the great RPG era of the 90's. Remember Chrono Trigger, Thousand arms and Lunar? It will be a nice dosage of nostaglia. Just let soak in…  :)
	
• I will be updating this review when I have completed the game in full. As I've mentioned, this game is interesting, fun, challenging, fast paced and includes a great storyline to keep players coming back. I highly recommend this game if you're a fan of RPG, puzzle solving, Sci-Fi, fast paced, action games.   5/5  
	
	To be continued…

27390717.review:
Se você gostou de Seiken Densetsu, Secret of Mana e afins no Super Nintendo, você vai gostar muito desse jogo.
Aliás, mesmo que não tenha gostado, talvez os controles mais modernos te atraiam pra experimentar! Tem uma demo disponível, então caso não queira gastar dinheiro sem pensar, você pode testar o produto.

O design da principal e o mundo me lembram Xenosaga, de alguma forma. Se você gosta dessa temática e da estética pixel art, então é mais um motivo pra adquirir o jogo.

Um dos pontos que os desenvolvedores sempre reforçam é um que está na descrição do produto: "butter-smooth physics"... E é 100% verdade. O movimento nesse jogo é ESPETACULAR. Sabe quando você tem coisa pra fazer, mas fica procrastinando, zanzando por aí? Aqueles jogos que você só quer andar pra apreciar a paisagem, o movimento, a velocidade? Esse é um deles, e no build atual, está tudo maravilhoso. Ouvi falar que em builds mais antigos haviam problemas de plataforma GRAVES onde você escorregava quando ficava muito na borda de uma plataforma, mas arrumaram isso e a mudança foi drasticamente positiva.

Os personagens são bons, e a história, de início, está ótima. Tenho um pouco de receio de ficar genérica ao decorrer do jogo, visto que eles estão dentro de um MMORPG e tem toda aquela ladainha de quest principal para descobrir blablabla, mas esperemos que acabe bem. As circunstâncias da personagem Lea dão margem pra MUITA backstory bacana e eu tenho muita fé que os criadores vão bolar algo bem bacana. A história não está completa no momento dessa review, pois o jogo está em Early Access, mas mesmo assim você pode acessar áreas além do momento em que a história está feita. Logo logo vão colocar quests e encontros especiais pra cobrir os espaços.

Devo avisar que este jogo é EXTREMAMENTE rápido e frenético, e não é nada fácil. Não existe sistema de dificuldade selecionável, o que pra mim é um ponto positivo pois a progressão é decente e você não precisa de muito grinding quando você aprende as mecânicas e acessa novas habilidades, exceto quando você realmente quer liberar algo na Skill Tree. Prepare-se para morrer BASTANTE.

Prós:
+Extremamente promissor para um Early Access
+Combate rápido e frenético com ótimos controles (Pelo menos no Gamepad, não sei como é Mouse+KB)
+Trilha sonora agradável
+Bom sound design
+Skill Trees variadas com caminhos divergentes, onde alguns podem ser trocados sem nenhum custo de ponto
+Personagens legais com designs únicos
+Puzzles muito bem articulados
+Pixel art linda e que passa por grandes reformas (Procure "Crosscode Lea" no Google e vão aparecer muitas imagens de Antes/Depois dos Portraits)
+Equipe muito prestativa de desenvolvimento que escuta seus fãs

Contras:
-Early Access, logo, incompleto até a presente data
-Alguns puzzles podem te deixar preso por muito tempo
-Você pode se perder MUITO fácil se não seguir o mapa e olhar cada pedaço aberto que se parece uma porta
-Consequência do Early Access: Muitos pedaços da Skill Tree ainda estão faltando
-As chances de você achar um item que você realmente precisa são baixas, tornando o sistema de trocas bem trabalhoso

É isso! Recomendo essa maravilha pra qualquer um! Uma obra excelente com potencial para ser ainda melhor!

27350160.review:
Habe das Spiel für die Steam Awards "Spiel im Spiel" nominiert,
Crosscode, das RPG in dem der Hauptcharakter bewusst ist das er sich in einer Spielwelt befindet.

Mit viel liebe zum Detail entstand das Meisterwerk das an die alten 16Bit Zeiten erinnert.
Actiongeladene Kämpfe, Nerven zerbrechende Rätsel und eine pakende Story schmücken das CrossCode Universum.
Selten habe ich solch ein Spass in einem so simplen Spiel gehabt wie in diesem, c.a. 31 Stunden Spielzeit sprechen für sich und das in der 0.6 Early Access.
Ich musste leider eine Pause einlegen, daher ich es nicht verkrafte das Spiel in stücken zu spielen und warte so mit auf den offiziellen Release der vollständigen Version.
Vorraussichtlich werde ich meine Spielzeit dann auf die knappe 100 Stunden hochtreiben, was den Kaufpreis mehr als rechtfertigt.

Gameplay: 9 / 10
Story: 9 / 10
Grafik: 8 / 10
Sound: 9 / 10
Steuerung: 10 / 10 

Gesamt: 45 / 50 Punkte

Persönliche Meinung:
Das Gameplay macht richtig spass, die Story ist leider noch nicht ganz fertig aber hat schon mit Charm überzeugt.
Die Grafik ist zwar nur im 16Bit Stil gehalten, aber man bemerkt schnell wieviel Mühe in jeder einzelnen Textur und Animation steckt.
Die Soundeffekte sowie Hintergrundmusik sind perfekt abgestimmt auf die jeweiligen Situationen und sehr vorbildlich umgesetzt. An der Steuerung wurde nicht gespart, das Spiel lässt sich mit Controller sowie Maus&Tastatur sehr gut spielen.

Und jetzt hört auf mein Review zu lesen, ladet euch am besten gleich die Demo zum reinschnuppern ;)

27222987.review:
Soooo, CrossCode,

I`ve had this one on my watchlist for quiet a while now before trying the demo, and wow! 
I almost bought it instantly after finishing the demo. It`s really well made, an i`ll list below just why i think it deserves you`re time=)

+ A large beautifull world with a rich backstory to share
+ tons of sidequests to do when you want 
+ a large variety of equip to choose from, some bought just with money, or special ones for which you need some extra materials
+ a fluid combat system with short meele combos, ranged attacks that can ricochet, evasive dashs, and a guard shield
+ combat arts for all 4 mentioned combat "components", as well as specialized ones for each element
+ 5 elements to fight with: neutral(yes in this game it is an element), heat, cold, shock and wave each with theire own      skill tree expansion and combat arts
+ A large skill tree where youre active element changes what bonuses you get, depending on what youv`ve set on its skill tree, and you get skill points for each element on level up
+ challanging battles inide and outside of dungeons, where that one enemy to much can spell you`re doom
+ you don`t get punished a lot for dying. actually you start out back at youre stats and items(!) before the encounter
+ combat rating based drop system, where the higher youre rating, the beter loot you get!
+ puzzles!! some on the overworld, to get to hidden places, and a lot inside dungeons=)
+ well written dialoge, with fluid charakter expressions(they seem much more alive to me)
+ tons of references( go, try find them all)

...phew that were quiet a lot...
well, thats what i have for now=)
I hope you`ll enjoy CrossCode as much as i do if you get it

27080374.review:
A singleplayer MMO with lots of in-jokes (think RE:Zero).
This is a game about playing a game and all the MMO tropes are here (of course there is also some mystery about the character's background as she hasn't entered the game via the typical method).

The action is fast and fun (but circlestrafing and dodgerolling is always fun right?), the puzzles are rewarding and the levels have a lot of secret branching paths that are hidden in plain sight but require a bit of parkour to reach. The levels can be replayed at any time and you are free to explore the open world. 

In fact, teleporting back to the start of the level and chaining together all of the enemies will boost your combat rating from D,C,B,A, all the way to S which means better item drops. As soon as you leave combat you get a short timer to start the next combat or you lose your rating. The rating pushes you to attack the next mobs even if they are harder and even if you're nearly dead and it can get really intense (as a death would put you back to the beginning).

There are even some elite mobs that will kill you in 2-3 hits that take a few mins to kill and are very reminiscent of Dark Souls bosses. The first one I found was a large dark blue hedgehog that spins to attack you (though he didn't have red shoes or white gloves).

The pixel art is really charming and the lighthearted music is amazing and varied. It definitely reminded me of classics such as Zelda and Alundra.

Before purchasing I thought the price was steep for an indie game but since playing I've discovered that it is more than fair as there is a lot of quality content here.

I also voted it for the Game Within a Game award and can't help but laugh at the ingame 'players' anticipating the closed off areas "coming out in the next patch" :D

27047104.review:
First time I heard about this game was somewhere in 2015. I played the demo and simply with that, I wanted to buy the game. But considering that the game is single player, is in early access AND it costs 20€, I was pretty sceptical about buying it. I mean, I had played the demo and I was confident that the quality of the game is amazing. It's just that I was afraid I'd be paying for a single player experience that'll get finished sometime in 2 or 3 years, at which time I'd already be bored with the game and not even bother playing the full version. So I decided to wait until it was out of early access... And considering that I already own the game and have played a few hours of it, you can probably tell that my impatience got the  better of me.

And what was the experience like? Well, it's as I assumed: a very fun action RPG with a colorful world and a cast of characters that you'd swear you've met and loved in any other MMORPG you've ever played... But as the game is in early access, the story leaves something to be desired. They ARE working on it, but know that the story is only added in little by little with some updates. It's not a bad thing, I mean you ARE getting the story and all. It's just that if you're planning on getting the game, know that you might have to wait a month or two or three just to get another piece of the story. It would be the only reason I wouldn't recommend the game yet, but the game itself is so much fun that I can't just not recommend it.

But that's not to say the story is bad. Absolutely not. It's just not finished, and seeing that this is a game in early access, that's to be expected. So if you want the full experience of CrossCode, my recommendation is that you play it when it comes out of early access for the full experience all at once. The problem with that is that if you don't have the patience to do that and you want to get this game, you'll probably go crazy because of the wait like I did.

On the other hand, you could jump on the development train and become involved! Buy and play the game, then report any bugs or typos or whatever to the devs and help them make CrossCode the masterpiece it deserves to be. Devstreams happen almost every week, so you can head over to Radical Fish Games Twitch channel on Sunday at 11am (PST) / 20:00 (CET) if you're interested in how the game is coming together.

All in all, CrossCode is a gem that, in my opinion, is on it's way to becoming a masterpiece. I know I haven't talked about the gameplay itself, but trust me when I say that it's fast, intense and extremely fun. The only thing I regret about buying CrossCode is that I bought it in a bundle for merely a fraction of CrossCode's original price. Gonna have to change that soonish: Going to wait until the sale on the game ends and buy it full price to support the devs.

It may still be in early access, but it's worth every penny of it's base asking price. I guarantee it.

27028425.review:
I've been playing computer/video games for over twenty years now, and I have to say this is undoutedly one of the most enjoyable games I have ever played.

While visually reminiscient of SNES/DreamCast era JRPG's, it really has a feel of its own both in gameplay and graphic style. 

Combat is more like a twin stick shooter, and navigating the map involves some, sometimes mildly frustrating parkour. A major part of the plot involves solving puzzles with a ricocheting ball of energy.

Even at this early stage of development I got about 20-25 hours of gameplay following the story and side quests before I hit the "no more story at this stage" message. And even after that I got another 20-25 hours gameplay again following additional side quests, searching for secrets and completing the third temple.

I cannot recommend this game highly enough. 9.6/10. (This could possibly go .1 or .2 higher for the finished game. We shall see:)

26975923.review:
As I searched through the Steam Catalogue, I chanced upon this gem, CrossCode. It was probably the most positively reviewed game on Steam at that time, so I wanted to see what it was all about.

This game is fast-paced yet very smooth to play, I never felt that I was overwhelmed with the action presented to me but rather it felt just right, not too difficult and not too easy.

The cast of characters on display were all very likeable. Quirks like Lea's (The Main Character) inability to speak coherently and can only blurt out words or phrases at certain points along with her multitude of interesting faces that she makes, brings extra life to the characters.

The areas are also really beautifully represented but there are still some undeveloped areas due to being an Early-Access title. However, I don't regret buying this game as I feel that it was worth my money helping this developer.

What I did not really like was that it was rather confusing to find where the NPC where specifically. The game would tell you the general area but not the exact coordinates, this meant that you would spend time rather uneconomically by just running around trying to find this NPC.

Anyway, if you liked Secret of Mana and the rest of the Seiken Densetsu games or Illusion of Gaia, you would most certainly would want this in your library as it shares its gameplay but with a much more modern and faster feel.

26925739.review:
For being in early access and currently unfinished (particularly the story as they want to hold onto the reveal for the actual release) it is still a whole lot of fun.

A multitude of viable play styles to customize your character into. Great visuals, smooth animations, boss fights that definitely evoke that old Zelda feel but with some more modern twists.

So while you can only get through maybe a third of the overall story before that runs out there is still much more content available because there are large dungeons, a whole host of side quests, multiple large zones, a significantly varied bestiary all with their own strengths and weaknesses.

The only real cons are that some of the dungeon puzzles are going to have you performing a facedesk when you realize what you've just spent ten minutes trying to do only takes about fifteen seconds once you've actually figured out what you were missing. Oh and some finicky platforming on ice rinks or very small areas with restrictions in play, but at least that monk's cave stuff is optional.

26755967.review:
First of all, even though it is early access, CrossCode has a huge amount of content. Even more than some finished games in a similar price-range. 

To the gameplay: It plays pretty good most of the time, but it takes a little time to get used to the controls, the combat is not easy, but mostly fair and fluid, though it can get a bit overwhelming at times. 

The puzzles and platforming are a decent challenge, though it has some pretty high difficulty-spikes.

If you want a retro-style Action RPG with challenging combat and good platforming/puzzles, you should give this a try.
Though it still has typical early-access problems (performance and balancing), the content makes more than up for it, in my opinion.

26725875.review:
I finally finished the available story. Now the game is very intersting and the combat is also really good, however it could use some improvement. This is by far one of my favorite games despite it only being in early access. I would without a doubt recommended it to everyone who likes RPG's and don't mind the art.

That said I think I can get to the second part of the review.

Ok, so CrossCode is a 2D action RPG, unlike most RPGs it's a cyber RPG and not a fantasy one.


-It features a Tree system for the skills called "Circuits"

I really like the ability to choose your own path, your style. However the circuits dont let you do that.The circuit system is still incomplete and I hope it will let you pick a "style" once it's complete. Being a melee spheromancer is near impossible and being a tank is useless. This system has a lot of potential but is not fully exploited.


-Challenging bosses and puzzles

I personally really, really enjoyed this. For some people, the puzzles and the bosse fights can be extremly frustrating due to their punishing behavior. 

When you die in a boss fight you have to redo the entire fight and figure out what did you do wrong and what can you do to not make the same mistake. However for some people dying over and over is not an option and they tend to give up. I see it as a way to evolve. 

The puzzles can almost all be solved using reverse engineering however to solve some puzzles you will need to have great timing and understanding. I remember at the level 18 dungeon I was trying to get one of the last mine keys. I knew the key was in the room I was in, because it was the only one left, however I didn't have enough vision to see where I should throw my fire charged ball to prock the bomb and destroy the rocks. So I started throwing charged balls in all directions until I got it right after one minute. I still don't know if there was another way to solve that puzzle, but I rejoice in the method I used to solve it; this game lets you be creative (sometimes).

Monaster puzzle (ascension quest): At the last level I was really confused and spent thirty minutes trying to figure out what was going on because I completly forgot that you could use a shield in this game... You were put on a steady plate and you had to block the cannon's shots. However nobody uses the stupid fucking shield in this game so we forgot that it existed!!! Can you make it so we use the shield more??? So that it's mandatory sometimes.

-Map and Quests

The map (not the regions and everything, when I say map I mean the thing you see when you press TAB and click on map) is horrible and the quests are often unclear. The map shows you very little information and could use a massive rework (I know it's still early access) and the quest tab under synopsis should show you the location of the quest giver using a map. I take on alot of quests and when I complete one I have to start looking around for 10 minutes to hopefully find the quest giver... not fun. Also for gathering quests tell us what plants or whatever we have to destroy to get the material using an image or something similar.

-Combat

I feel like it relies too much on range combat. The use of the shield is almost always unecessary. However it is fun and enjoyable.

-Controls
I tried to play this with my logitech F310 controller and all I could say was : holy shit. You attack with fucking [RB] ? do you know how tiring that is??? It hurts after 2 minutess... You need to redo the controls for controllers. However the mouse and keyboard controls are fine as they are. Can you also introduce an option to jump? The automatic jump is thrash. 

-Graphics
This is the last point because it didn't bother me a lot. I play on a 27 inch 1440p monitor. Once the game has been upscaled 10000x times it looks like a blurry mess.


Conclusion --> This is constructive critiscism. I want you to understand that I loved this (early access) game and that's why I bothered writing a review, if you are undecided as to wether you should pick up this game or no, I would recommend you pick it up! However I suggest waiting for the end release.

26701074.review:
I was very pleasantly surprised by CrossCode. The creators are good at what they do and have put a lot of love into this. 

Many moons ago, I was a big fan of games like Secret of Mana and illusion of Gaia on the SNES -- CrossCode (although unfinished) is a much better game than any of my favourites on that system. 

Some highlights:
[list]
    [*]Combat is deep without being too complex (other reviewers have mentioned bullet hell -- I don't quite disagree, but I really suck at bullet hell and still found combat in this game fun).
    [*]Puzzles are fun and rewarding.
    [*]The writing is pretty good, and the main character has a lot of personality.
    [*]The artsyle works really well, and works better in game than the screenshots might sugest -- like the writing, it has a lot of personality.
    [*]I found the story (the fraction that is complete) quite creative and engaging.
[/list]

I don't normally buy early access games, let alone recommend them (because they tend to stay early access), but I do feel this one is worth it. I really hope the devs can keep the momentum going.

26638630.review:
Even though the game is not finished, I love it.

The dialogue is fun, and the plot is simple (so far).  The battle system is awesome.  It's fast paced with an intricate system of breaking defenses to actually be able to do good damage to enemies.  I find often that it really is the only way to kill off enemies.  The combination of using range, melee, and dashing is well balanced and fun.  I am also impressed with the skill tree system, and how each element has its own separate tree.  It really allows for some specialization of the character.  You can basically build a character with different ways of fighting for each element.  The only bad part of the skill tree is that all the skills have not been implemented yet.  I find myself at a  stand still with my character building because I don't know what the next skills will actually be.  
The platforming and puzzles range from super easy to difficult.  The rewards of each puzzle match to the difficulty of each puzzle.  So if you are not really a puzzle person you can rely on the gathering and crafting system to get new armor and weapons.  I do find that there is some minor grinding that needs to happen to craft new equipment which can be a turn off for some people, not me though.  If you play MMO's you'll be fine.  
The difficulty of the game overall is moderate.  It's easy to die from regular mobs if you are not paying attention, and the bosses are challenging.  Their difficulty increases as their HP gets lower, their attacks become bigger and crazier, but still a little predictable.  I will say I have died at least 10-15 times on each boss before defeating them.  They have all been a lot fun though.
The art styling is also fun, especially for someone that grew up playing NES and SNES.

Strongly recommend if you are looking for a fun throw-back.

26595623.review:
Pretty awesome game, even in it's in development. 4/5 review

PROS:
- Nice old school pixel graphics
- Fun but challenging ARPG system. I don't think I'll be able to go back to a standard RPG with where you have to stand still and let the dice choose everything. The movement and skills are addictive. 
- Ambience and atmosphere. Landscapes to explore. A perfect combination of cyber feel and traditional creatures + magic. Good story so far.
- Skill trees are flexible and forgiving. Unlike things like Diablo II, you can always change around your points, and each element uses a separate skill point bank. Part of the game is using all of your elements and neutral powers, as you get them one by one. 

MIXED: 
- A bit puzzle heavy for my taste so far. I have seen some similar complaints from other players. 75% of the game is traditional quests, killing, and small puzzles, but 25% are these long dungeons with chains of puzzle after puzzle. These can be fun in some moderation, but they may be a little much for traditional RPG players. Some of the puzzles are more tedious than others also (fail to jump or time something correctly, and you have to go back to the beginning, etc.). 

Even with the mixed, I still definitely recommend.

26541076.review:
[h1]Comme un MMO et sans les aspects négatifs /!\ACCES ANTICIPE\i/[/h1]

[i]C'est ma première revue de jeu, un peu comme une première fois, j'attendais le bon à qui la donner.[/i]

Voilà, maintenant que c'est dit et que j'ai fait ma blague, il me reste plus qu'à justifier ces 30 heures de jeu alors qu'il est loin d'être fini :

[b] Gameplay en général [/b]
Du parkour, des plateformes, de l'exploration, des énigmes, de nombreuses quêtes (pas limitées à du "tue 4 rats et ramène-moi leur queue"), des combats parfois très difficiles j'y reviendrais après.
Autant dire qu'il y en a pour tous les goûts, on peut faire le jeu en ligne droite si on aime le -très gros- challenge.
Autrement, certaines phases de leveling sont obligatoires MAIS elles ne nous laissent pas l'occasion de nous ennuyer.
Il y a du bashing de mobs (intelligent cela dit), [u]mais pas que, et loin de là[/u] !! Comme je l'ai dit plus haut il y a plein de choses à faire, tant dans les quêtes qu'en dehors. 
En fait il faut aimer le challenge pour ce jeu, rien n'est acquis et on peut être parfois amenés à rager ou même à trop réfléchir.

[b] Combats [/b]
[i]D'un système basique, nous passons à des combats intenses, difficiles et stratégiques[/i]
J'ai failli croire à un système de combat bidon, en même temps on n'a à la base que les attaques au corps à corps en arc de cercle devant soi, ou alors on peut tirer des projectiles ronds (on ne peut pas bouger la souris dans tous les sens sinon les projectiles sont tirés dans un cône autour du pointeur).
On a aussi l'esquive et une sorte de "garde", les deux peuvent faire des dégâts suivant le "mode" de dégats sélectionné, par exemple feu ou glace, en les combinant à la touche d'attaque spéciale (qui se combine aussi avec le tir, l'attaque en mêlée ou toute seule). Ces modes sont importants, on est souvent amenés à switcher entre eux car même les attaques basiques n'ont pas le même effet.
Chaque monstre a une technique particulière pour le battre, même les rats du début. Impossible de bourriner, et les boss j'en parle même pas. On a aussi un arbre de talents passifs et actifs, lesquels changent les effets des attaques, esquive...etc Il est possible de "switcher" d'actifs dans l'arbre sans dépenser un point de compétence.

[b] Histoire et immersion [/b]
[i]On est dans un MMORPG classique (mais solo et hors-ligne hein !!), vive la PNJ-ception ![/i]
Pas difficile d'accrocher à l'histoire, pour le moment elle n'est pas très développée, on peut se poser des questions et surtout elle s'arrête très tôt.
Les développeurs ont mis l'accent sur le reste du contenu, les maps, les monstres, les donjons, on peut déjà presque tout visiter alors que l'histoire n'en est qu'au début.
On voit des PNJ courir à travers les maps (très jolies, soit dit en passant), d'autres discuter entre eux ou discuter avec les PNJ-PNJ (ceux qui joueront comprendront). Qui dit MMORPG dit groupes de joueurs (même si ce sont des IA), interactions avec des IA assumées...bref de ce côté j'ai été agréablement surpris, il ne manquerait plus que quelques insultes dans le chat pour vraiment s'y croire.
Les musiques sont entraînantes, collent très bien aux différentes maps et situations,  [u]et surtout[/u] elles ne sont pas énervantes, parce qu'il y en a peu (1 par zone et 1 par ville) et elles passent pour certains en boucle. Par contre ne vous attendez pas à vous retrouver à vouloir les écouter en dehors du jeu, elles ne sont pas non plus transcendantes.
Les autres personnages sont en général d'une classe différente de celle qu'on joue (le perso qu'on joue nous est imposé), mais surtout ils ont chacun des traits spécifique, le travail d'écriture est bien mis en valeur, ils ont leurs propre tics de langage, leur propre manière de s'exprimer, et pour le peu qu'on peut voir pour le moment, ils sont loin d'être vides. Ils ne sont pas limités à leur "avatar" (le perso qu'ils incarent dans le MMO quoi).

[b]Pour conclure,[/b] bien qu'avec peu de bugs, de nombreuses maps et monstres, zones à explorer, quêtes...etc le jeu est encore en accès anticipé, ça veut dire qu'il faut attendre pour que la narration continue, pour avoir plus de contenu et pouvoir courir sur ces magnifiques maps à la recherche de coffres cachés.
Si vous hésitez, achetez-le ! Même si vous préférez attendre qu'il soit complet, ce jeu mérite largement son prix !

Разработчики хотели создать эмуляцию ММО мира, ведь весь сюжет крутится вокруг этого и у них получилось. Это просто очень круто, когда ты что-то делаешь в игре, а вокруг тебя носятся табуном НПЦ. 26494327.review:
[h1] CrossCode Review[/h1]

Bevor ich hier mit dem eigentlichen Review anfange erstmal ein großes Dankeschön an das Entwicklerteam da es uns Spielern eine DEMO zur Verfügung stellt! Das sieht man heutzutage echt nicht mehr oft. Ne Menge Teams können sich da mal ne Scheibe von abschneiden!

CrossCode ist ein 2D Action-RPG welches an alte Zeiten erinnert. Es spielt in einer fiktiven zukunftsartigen Welt in dem du ein Spiel in einem Spiel spielst, vergleichbar mit dem Anime Sword Art Online. Zudem ist die Welt vollgepackt mit einer Unzahl an kniffligen Rätseln im Zelda-Style.
Das Spiel beginnt mit einem düster gestalteten spielbaren Prolog, in dem du ein junges Mädchen spielst welches versucht seinen scheinbar gefangenen Bruder zu retten. Der Prolog dient gleichzeitig auch als Minitutorial und endet mit vielen offenen Fragen. Nach einer Sequenz wird deine Protagonistin Lea ins Spiel wortwörtlich gespawnt und die Geschichte nimmt seinen Lauf.

Pro's:
+ unglaublich schön gestaltete Welt
+ toller und stets passender Soundtrack
+ riesengroßer Fähigkeitsbaum mit ner Menge Spezialangriffe (WIP!)
+ unzählige Rätsel von leicht bis schwer 
+ forderndes Kampfsystem mit intensiven Kämpfen
+ sehr gelungenes Storywriting
+ DEMO!

Con's:
- manchmal sehr schwammige Jumpphysics (wird sicher im Laufe der Zeit gefixt)
- Dungeonbosskämpfe neigen zu schnellem Ende wenn erstmal der Schwachpunkt gebrochen wurde (es besteht bei allen Bossen   OneShot Potenzial -> vlt die Zeitfenster verringern)
- die Ebenen Unterschiede sind Zeitweise extrem schwer zu erkennen (dadurch werden Jumppuzzles manchmal ein Disaster)
- keine Questmarker (lässt den Spieler des öfteren hilflos zurück)
- ungünstige, gewöhnungsbedürftige Schnellmenüführung (im Kampf manchmal wirklich ungünstig-> Slots oder Hotkeys wären da besser)

Abschließend möchte ich mich noch einmal bei den Entwicklern bedanken, dafür das sie einfach ein Paradebeispiel für Early-Access bieten! CrossCode ist ein wunderbares Spiel mit unglaublich großem Potenzial und ich hoffe Radical Fish Games nutzt es aus und gibt dem Spiel den Platz den es verdient. Ich kann dieses Spiel wirklich jedem Spieler ans Herz legen und damit meine ich wirklich jedem! Ich hab das Spiel jetzt schon bis zum aktuellsten Stand durchgespielt und trotzdem will ich es immer weiter spielen obwohl es nix mehr zu tun gibt. Einfach Spitze!

9/10 IGN

26478762.review:
I picked this game up because of the positive user reviews (without really knowing anything about it) and the art style (I love some good pixel art), I didn't really know anything about the game before trying it out. After having played it a bit, I have to say I absolutely love this game- it's one of the best games I've played in a long time. The core gameplay elements of this game are fun and just feel great- I would say they set a high bar in terms of quality and, as a game developer myself, they are inspirational in how a great game should feel and play.

There are a couple things that really stand out about the game:
- The controls are on point. Running and jumping around the world feels superb, I would be willing to put the controls for this game on the same level as Super Meat Boy's controls.
- The combat is good (and fun!), the combat systems are easy to learn (maybe feeling a little akward at first because of the mix of range and melee) but require enough finess that you can get noticeably better at combat.
- I like the art, some people don't like "retro"/pixel art but I think CrossCode doesn't just go for "retro" style art. The world is more detailed than what you would find in an actual SNES-Era game, but is still in the same style. I would call this art high quality pixel art, I especially love the antimation on the title screen.
- The world/lore is interesting (so far) and the game being a [spoiler]'parody' of an MMO[/spoiler] is well executed and entertaining. I love how the world is used to explain and build gameplay mechanics, such as having allies, communicating with people, and more. I look foward to seeing the story continue and eventually be completed in future updates.

Beyond those specific points, I still enjoy pretty much everything else about this game (they just don't nessecarily jump out as specifically being awesome to me). The music is good, the controller support is good, leveling and equipment (allowing for a bit of flexability in how you build your character) are also good. I struggle to find anything negative about the game.

That said, there are really only two negatives I can find about the game (which honestly don't bother me at all).
- Sometimes it can be difficult to tell how high up you are in relation to other terrain/platforms (which is important for moving around). The world you are moving around in gives you 3 dimensions of freedom, however it's only represented in 2 dimensions.  I've only had this be a problem once or twice, but it's maybe worth mentioning. It really is only a minor problem, it's not nearly as bad as what you have problem encountered in other 2D/3D plaformers where it can be difficult to gauge gaps and your placement in the world.
- It's not finished :( I was really sad to see I had hit the end of the existing story content and can't wait to see the game finished (at which point I will probably replay it from scratch).

Everything said and done I would absolutely recommend this game. This is, personally, one of the best games I have played in a long time and I can't wait to see where the world and story go as the game continues to develop.

26365296.review:
Just a small feedback + review after finishing chapter 4.

Since the game is currently (1st Nov 2016) still in early access mode, there are couple of unfinished things, like missing skills in the skill-tree, missing sprites for couple of NPCs and some missing content. These shall be ignored for now, as they will be fixed in the final version.

Pros:
 + Pretty fun gameplay
 + Charming art
 + Interesting enemies
 + Good mix of real time action and RPG
 + Good puzzles
 + Lots of side quests

Neutral:
 - Consuming heal items takes time and leaves you vulnerable

Cons:
 - Locations to finish quests often unclear
 - Puzzles and bosses can get quite challenging and there's no option to choose difficulty
 - Questmenu kinda hidden
 - Quick access menu not very comfortable
 - Low item drop rates

I think the good parts of the game are quite obvious: Apart from the nice pixel art, the gameplay is really good. Despite the pixel art, the movement is free and not tile-based and the game plays similar to titles like diablo or bastion. Apart from the Action, there's a skill tree and options for equipping the character, so it also got the fun of a RPG.

About the bad parts: I think the only real criticism would be that the game can sometimes get rather difficult. For this, I'd suggest adding an option to choose difficulty levels (easy, normal, hard) or have a option to give hints to the player (maybe in form of a shop item?). The other points are mostly nit-picking which hopefully get fixed in the final version: It sucks that the quest menu requires couple of clicks (with the gamepad) to reach. Assigning it directly to a button or the quick access menu is neccessary. Also, the quick access menu is kinda uncomfortable: Holding down a button, moving the analog stick and then also pressing another button is annoying. One of the two last steps can and should be removed for an easier access. Another thing is about the quests: Often, it is very unclear where you initially got the quest. Every place in the game is rather big and full of hidden paths, so searching around for one person is annoying. A better description ("This person is in the north-west of place XY") would be nice. What also annoyed me were really low drop rates for certain items, be it from monsters or from plants. Especially when a certain amount of items is needed for a quest and the specific item drops at 1% chance (bear tail or smth, for example), then that's rather annoying and really just grinding, which isn't very nice. Also, starting the game does take a while (20 seconds, I guess?), which feels rather long for a 2D pixel art game like this, but well, since the game runs fast after that without longer loading times, that's ok.

Well, this was mostly just me nitpicking. Overall, the game looks very promising and is pretty fun and addictive to play!
I'll edit this review with time as I and the game's development progress.

26353624.review:
Now this is my first review so bare with me.

I have been following this game for some time and recently I finally bought it. The game is obvioulsy inspired by some old classics but it also tries to inovate a lot and brings tons of great features that help the pacing of the game, and the overall enjoyement.

You play as an avatar called Lea. She is mute, but slowly starts to get more words put into her vocabulary as the story progresses. This sparks a lot of interesting and comedical conversations  which brings me to the first great point of this game. The writing, and some of my favourite things are :
Inspect the hilarious usernames of the npc's
Ability to listen to conversations and then interrupt if there is something interesting in it, which usually results in a quest
Although the main character is mute, the amount of different expressions the character has + the supporting characters really spice up a lot of conversations.
Don't want to watch/read a cutscene ? The game has got you covered with the skip cutscene feature which can skip almost any dialogue in the game, even the important story parts, which is great for both speedrunning and people who are replaying certain areas.
Combining all of this the story is really enjoyable the whole way through.

Now, for the great mechanics.
Looking for a rare item for a quest ? Just keep killing enemies without stopping for a short time and your "rank" will increase ! The higher the rank the better the loot ! This helps a ton and can also keep areas where you are overleveled (revisiting old areas ) fairly dynamic to go through anyway, as you can try to chain as many monsters as you can.
You have the normal quests that give you a bit of exp, but the majority of the quests are really interesting and make you do things such as :
Fight sonic the hedgehog
Go into a mole hideout
Catch a smuggler
Discover landmarks etc.
Speaking of landmarks, teleporting ! Cause backtracking has never been easier !

Lets move on to the art and music.
Now I am not the best with musical terms, but this game does a really good job with the soundtrack. It is not too diverse, as you will usually be going through a whole area with just 1 song playing + the battle song, but the songs are not annoying at all even after listening to them for some time.
The pixel art in this game is gorgeous , some of the best I have seen. This is aspecially impressive seeing that its made by a small team. At certain points you are really high up from the ground and the view to down below  is great, or in the early areas of the game , the view to the first city from far away is breathtaking because it gives a sense of scale of the world.
All the animations feel extremely well, and the game should run on 60 fps on most computers, and if it doesn't , I suggest going to windowed mode and lowering the window size. The smaller the faster !

Now for the most important and best part of this game 
Gameplay
Now I am gonna divide gameplay into 3 categories :
1. Platforming
- Really basic jumping platforming, but there are a lot of areas where you are just going to say : " Hmm, how do I get over there " , which usually I would say is a bad thing, but in this case it feels like a puzzle of its own.
- Party members follow you really nicely around the map. There is only a few instances where I have seen the AI fail a jump.
- Theres a quest where you jump on top of a roof to chase a goat. WHAT MORE YOU NEED ?
2. Puzzles
- As I said, platforming can sometimes be a puzzle of its own, but besides that this game features a lot of other good and interseting mechanics.
-Platforms that only move/extended when you hit a switch. At first this seems really basic and unoriginal , but you would be suprised how interesting it gets later on.
-Your balls ( weapon, not the nut part ) bounce off of terrain , which in combination with the extending/moving platforms gives some really fun puzzles, which are exteremely fun to watch when speedrunned.
3. Combat
- Skill tree with 4 elements.
- Every elements is a different part of your character Fire = demage , Cold = Defense , Electricity = Ball demage  and Wind = Health/Dodge
-You can switch between using different elements, which comes with its own costs and advantages.
-Dodge, Melee, ranged and block feature.
- Block feature features ( say that 10 times fast )  perfect blocking, aka timing your block last second to negate demage/counter enemy attacks, leaving them vulnerable.
- Dodging can not be spammed which, in my opinion ,is a good thing.
-Tough but extermely fun bosses 
-Enemies tend to have a lot of recolours which is probbably the biggest negative point of the game I have found so far ( This does not mean the game is perfect ) Although, recolours tend to have different means of attacking then their previous itterations. ( For example , normal hedgehags can "spin dash" at you , while red ones can dash and jump on top of you, where you need to block one and dodge the other )
- And of course simple to learn but hard to master controls.

I give this game a 9.5/10 as it currently stands, and this is honestly my opinion and its subject to change and it does not have to affect your opinion at all.
The game is addictive and fun, if I truly talked about everything in this review, it would have taken me double the time to write this.

Thank you for  your patience, and I hope we can direct link our opinions !

26352554.review:
2017-12-18日更新：
        从“大卡伊卡乔”神庙更新之后游戏的优化显著下降：FX-6300 + GTX750Ti （已经使用最优供电方案+水冷）在新手港、翡翠山脉等区域出现了严重的帧率下降（60降至24),严重影响游戏的操作与观感。就目前来看，并没有任何好转的趋势。
        近日更新的3段战技，视觉观赏效果非常棒，招式连贯、华丽，（威力也非常的......低）。值得一提的是，三段战技完美的体现出了开发者想要的：每个元素分别对应着一种能力，一种强悍的能力（详见游戏内对5种形状所对应的职业）。
        甲壳虫武士（出没于“青玉山脉”）这个主意真的是太棒了，既创新，看上去也非常符合常理（厚重的武士盔甲与甲虫的外壳，迅捷的行动、双持武士刀和甲虫的凶猛），又对患有“虫子恐惧症”的二号女主“芝麻脸”造成了严重的心理创伤。当你攻击甲壳虫武士的时候喜闻乐见而又接地气的对话绝对会让你不禁放声大笑。

=========================================================================
什么？国区降价了？卧槽？我当初可是108买的啊！（已经-10%）
而且汉化也是我最早提出的（虽然已经找不到证据了）
===================================================================
首先必须说明：这个游戏的难度不亚于东方弹幕系列  以及隔壁的Rabi-Raabi
这个游戏的价格确实把我吓了一跳 这个价格足够买一个同时期打折的GTA5了
[spoiler]其实是因为没钱上冷却 不敢带[/spoiler]
抱着玩玩看的心态打开了这个游戏 其他先不说 光是战斗风格就很有意思
1.你是球女[strike]奥利安娜[/strike]，攻击方式只有5连击的近战和越打越准的球
2.球可以蓄力攻击 可以在障碍物上反弹4次并提供瞄准器
3.这个游戏居然引入了  高度  这个概念 于是你可以上墙 上房顶  不过你不能攻击处于不同高度的目标
4.绝大多数攻击必须依靠只能右键连击三次的[strike]闪现[/strike]闪避 或者长按右键鼠标选择某一方向格挡
不然基本上同等级的BOSS战 被击中6-8次基本GG
5. 你 的 主 角 我 玩 到 现 在 只 会 说 ：Hi！   和 自 己 的 名 字
6.教程可以反复播放，一次不懂再来一次
7.繁多的可选支线任务
不过不足之处也是比较多
1.这游戏没有中文，没有STEAM云，没有成就没有卡
于是你根本没办法看懂里面的英文、德文
需要至少在国外生活5年以上的英语水平（我是宣布GG 坐等Dalao汉化了）
2.窗口化和全屏提供的可选分辨率太少了 而且不巧的是我的显示器是方屏的 只有横屏选项 而且打开全屏也不会铺满屏幕 只会留下黑边
3.真他喵的蛋疼的操作 TAB是菜单我一直没想到 近战必须把鼠标移动到主角边上连点 远程必须移开一定范围
你在主界面标注一下行不行啊

游戏特点：
科技树一样的升级加点  又可以出纯肉了
把高度这个概念引入了 你可以在墙上跑得比西方记者还快
有趣的解密 检验一个瞎子6不6的关键指标就是看Q的准不准
可选的支线任务 
像素风格 不吃配置
怪物贼团结 一旦攻击了任意一只 只要你没有解除战斗状态 屏幕内的任何一支怪物都会对你发起攻击

一句话总结：这游戏如果有中文 并且持续更新的话 完全对得起这个价格
9/10(如果有简体中文 哪怕是非官方也好啊）
6/10（你根本没办法完成游戏 你看不懂 也就不知道你要去搞什么大新闻)

26339222.review:
[h1]+++ Quick Review : +++[/h1]

Pro :
+ Wunderschöner Grafikstil mit mega atmosphärischen Musik
+ Spaßiges Gameplay 
+ Riesiger Skilltree
+ Interessante Story
+ Riesige atmosphärische Welt.

Con :
- Unbalancte Gegner welche oftmals viel zu Stark sind oder viel zu viel auf einem Haufen
- Viel zu niedrige level und drop rate (das ist natürlich objektiv)
- noch zu eintönige Sidequests
- Story ist noch etwas zu kurz


[h1]+++ Ausführliche Review : +++[/h1]

CrossCode ist ein RPG von dem deutschen indie entwickler Team "Radical Fish Games".
Mit CrossCode bietet Radical Fish Games ihr debüt.
Einer der bekanntesten des Teams ist bei weitem "Lachsen" welcher in der RPG Maker Community einen großen namen hinterlassen hat.

In CrossCode startest du das Spiel als die ... nunja ... Spielerin "Lea", denn die welt von CrossCode stellt ein VR-MMORPG dar.
Doch Lea startet nicht wie jeder normaler Spieler in der Tutorial-Insel sondern auf einem Schiff abseits der Spielfläche.
Lea kann sich an nichts errinern und ihre Sprachfunktion ist auch deffekt und kann sich so nicht mehr ausdrücken.
Glücklicherweise nimmt das Schiffsteam sie auf und hilft ihr zurück auf den weg zur regulären Spielwelt.
Doch das soll so schnell leider nicht funktionieren, denn das Schiff wird von einer mysteriösen Gestalt angegriffen.

Über das Spiel lernt Lea neue Freunde kennen und auch Rivalen.
Freunde können über den Gamechat als Partner gerufen werden und helfen dir bis sie sterben oder bis zu bestimmten Punkten des Spiels.

Das Spiel ist bei weitem noch nicht Fertig aber bietet jetzt schon viel zum Spielen.
Mit seinem Klassischen SNES look vergnügt das Spiel auch die Retrofernatiker unter euch.
Es gibt mittlerweile schon viele, abwechselnde Orte zu entdecken und zu erkunden.
Auf der Welt von CrossCode gibt es auch viele versteckte "Truhen" mit Items zum finden.
Die Story ist noch nicht sonderlich weit, jedoch kann man jetzt schon 3 Dungeons entdecken und 3 Städte erkunden.
Mit vielen Sidequests hat man auch ordentlich was zu tun, auch wenn diese meist mit typischen MMO Quests gespeckt sind wie "Töte Gegner A und bringe den Loot zum Punkt B".
Ich kann mir vorstellen das gegen späteren Verlauf das Spiel viel zu bieten haben wird und auch unterhaltsam wird.
Bis jetzt ist die Vorhandene Story mega gut und die Welt gibt mir das SNES Feeling was ich total liebe.

Fazit :
Das Spiel ist noch nicht ansatzweise fertig, jedoch jetzt schon mega gut.
Sollte man es im Sale für ein paar groschen kriegen kann man es sich aufjedenfall geben.
Ist man Fan von solch Spielen bzw. will man das Team unterstützen : Spendet oder kauft es für den Vollpreis!
Meine unterstützung haben sie und ich bin auch jeden sonntag beim Dev Stream dabei.

26321244.review:
Seriously, get this game asap. The devs are doing an amazing job, the game is awesome already, it's worth it.
Now that's that of the way, the review.

Basicly a multiplayer game into singleplayer. Feels like one, too (positive).
Mechanics are solid, graphics are pretty, story (so far) is amazing, there are neat little tweaks to a "classical zelda like platformer" that make it special.
Mechanism impacts are introduced through a do more than a tell, at least once you get into the less basic ones. This can sometimes make one feel a little stumped, but the feeling of "I get it now!" gets that much stronger, and it feels more... natural?
The skill tree is well made, has a mechanism (switching branches) that i've never seen done well before, and here it is.
Elemental system : check, good so far, some puzzles use the switch of elements which is very good.
Varied ennemies, with interesting attack patterns that take into account the environment (simple example : thing that spits a rock upwards that falls on your head, but if there's something above, the rock can hit it - amazingly simple yet very clever - or take penguins that interact with falling into water not by taking damage like other ennemies, but jumping out and attacking? Ok i'll stop spoiling now.) with different strategies that reward the player for using his brain a little, but not so much that it interrupts the pacing? Check.
Platforming puzzles with switches and pushing boxes and moving platforms and things that shoot at you and bombs and... check.
Sidequests that are not just plopped on, but actually feel like you have a small impact on the world, hidden chests with loot inside, backtracking, making encyclopedias of monsters and plants? Check.
Balance between combat platforming and puzzle? Check.
Epic boss battles with patterns to learn? Check. 
Sentient cyborgoats? Check.

Can't wait for more updates, hits all the right buttons, must recommend. <3

26313537.review:
I'm really disappointed in me that I didn't know about this game for such a long time....<_<
The moment I saw the trailer, I already could guess how good this game is but in truth, it is much better.

Style:

- The style can only be described as beautiful. The sprite-style of this game doesn't only look beautiful, it also runs as smooth as a good Shooter with high FPs and  low Ping.

Character:

- What I really like about this game is the Main Character. This is one of the very rare games in which the Main Character is something special, she is funny, badass and many more without even the need for long speeches. The same can be said to the other important characters. Each one of them is unique in his/her/its own aspect and the dialog's between them is often quite funny.

Fights:

- The fast-pace fights in this game are quite difficult but they make fun, which is something really rare today in this combination.

Music:

- The music is something which can only be praised in any aspect. It isn't too good that you would get distracted but it's not too plain that you don't even notice it.

Story:

- I can't say much about the overall story at the moment but the things I know at the moment are quite interesting which too, is something rather rare these days. The combination of VR-MMORG in the story is quite unique and the other aspects, which I won't spoil, are really good.

Overall:

- Overall is this game not only one of my favorites but also one of the best I have played, in any aspect. It has style, good characters, nice background music, nice story and a really good concept. A recommendation for everyone on steam.

26307014.review:
มองหาเกม RPG เก็บเวล ตีมอน อัพเกรดตัวละครอยู่ใช่ไหม?
เกมนี้เป็นอีกเกมนึง ที่ผมกล้ารับประกันว่า "เกมนี้ดีจริงๆ"

================================
[b][h1] เกริ่นนำ [/h1][/b]
เริ่มที่เราต้องไปหยุดยั้งพี่ชายตัวเอง ที่ถูกบังคับให้ทำการทดลองอะไรสักอย่างที่น่าจะไม่ดี แต่ก็สายเกินไป...
เราจะถูกส่งมาโลกจำลอง ถ้าใครคิดภาพไม่ออกก็ให้คิดถึงอนิเมะเรื่อง Sword Art Online 
เราจะได้เจอ NPC ร้านค้า ผู้คน และ เควส... ดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องไปเรื่อยๆโดยที่ที่จริงแล้วผมก็ไม่รู้ว่ามันต้องให้ทำอะไร5555

================================
[b][h1] ระบบเกมโดยรวม [/h1][/b]
ควบคุมตัวละครจากมุมมอง 2D เน้นระบบการต่อสู้แบบ hack and slash คือวิ่งสู้ฟัด ฟันรัวๆ ยิงรัวๆ
จุดเด่นหลักๆคือ
• ระบบต่อสู้ค่อนข้างรัวรวด คล่องแคล่ว (ทั้งเราและศัตรู)
• ไม่สามารถปรับเปลี่ยนมุมมอง หรือ หมุนมุมกล้องได้
• ใช้คีย์บอร์ดในการควบคุมการเดินของตัวละคร และ ใช้สกิว
• ใช้เมาส์ในการควบคุมทิศทาง การโจมตี
• มีปาร์ตี้ ให้เพื่อนช่วยต่อสู้และช่วยแท้งค์ได้

================================
[b][h1] ระบบต่างๆในเกม [/h1][/b]
• มีเควสให้ทำ เยอะโคตรๆ นี่คือแบบ เห้ย!! นี่เกม Single Player หรอวะ? เชี่ยเควสรกชิบหาย555
ถือว่าเป็นทั้งข้อดีและข้อเสียเนอะ ใครชอบเนื้อเรื่องก็เล่นเนื้อเรื่องก็ได้ แต่ใครชอบเก็บเควสเหมือนผม แม่งเควสเยอะเชี่ยๆเลย5555
• สกิว 4 สาย สายตีใกล้ / ตีไกล / สายป้องกัน / สายซัพ(พวกรีเจนเลือด) ค่อนข้างหลากหลาย
• ที่ว่าเหมือนในอนิเมะเรื่อง Sword Art Online คือ เวลาเราไปต่อสู้มอนเตอร์นอกเมือง ก็ยังมี NPC วิ่งผ่านอยู่ตลอดเวลา ได้ฟิลแบบ เอ่อเว้ย เหมือนมันไม่ใช่เกม Single Player ยังไงอย่างงั้น
• ในเมืองจะมี NPC เทรดของ สะสมของต่างๆที่ดรอปจากมอนไปแลกเป็นอาวุตเสื้อเกราะได้ 

================================
[b][h1] มูลค่าในการเล่น [/h1][/b]
ผมแทบไม่เชื่อตัวเองว่า เกมดีๆอย่างนี้ (ที่ไม่รู้ว่าใน 100เกม จะมีเกมแบบนี้สักกี่เกม)
จะมีราคาแค่ 369บาท ซึ่งถ้าอยู่ในช่วงลดราคาประมาณ 50% แล้วเหลือประมาณ 180บาท 
ผมถือว่า "ถูกโคตรๆ" ได้เลย 
ในคอมมูนิตี้พูดคุยกันว่า คุณสามารถเล่นเกมนี้จบได้ภายใน 6-8ชั่วโมง ถ้าไม่เก็บรายละเอียดพวกเควสย่อย
แต่คุณสามารถเล่นได้นานถึง 36-40ชั่วโมง หากไล่ทำเควสข้างทาง เควสย่อยต่างๆ

ผมอ่านในกระทู้สนทนาของผู้สร้างเกม เขาบอกว่าเขาต้องการให้เกมนี้พัฒนาจนสมบูรณ์ภายในต้นปีหน้า
ซึ่งผมว่าเมื่อเกมพัฒนาจนสมบูรณ์แล้ว คงมีเนื้อหา รายละเอียดต่างๆมากกว่านี้ และทำให้เกมน่าสนใจกว่านี้อีกด้วย

================================
[b][h1] สรุปสั้นๆ [/h1][/b]
เกมดี เกมน่ารัก เหมาะสำหรับคนที่หาอะไรแปลกๆใหม่ๆเล่น ระบบเกมอยู่ในเกณฑ์ดี 
คล้ายๆอนิเมะเรื่อง Sword Art Online หรือเกม Ragnarok Online จินตนาการภาพไป5555
เน้นเนื้อเรื่อง เควสย่อยเยอะ อาจต้องทำความคุ้นเคยกับระบบต่อสู้นิดหน่อย เพราะเกมค่อนข้างเร็ว คล่องแคล่ว 
แต่ผมว่าไม่น่ายากเกินไปสำหรับคนที่ไม่ค่อยถนัดเกมสายนี้
ภาพและเสียงโอเค น่าจะไม่ต้องพูดถึงเรื่องนี้เท่าไหร่
ชั่วโมงเกมเหมาะสม ไม่น้อยและไม่เยอะเกินไป ราคาถือว่าถูก (สำหรับผมนะ)
แต่ถ้าใครซื้อไม่ไหว ผมว่ารอช่วงลดราคาก็น่าจะดีกว่า

ส่วนทิ้งท้ายจริงๆ เกมยังอยู่ในช่วง Early Access อยู่ หรือเรียกง่ายๆว่า เกมมันยังทำไม่เสร็จเลยเว้ยย
ฉนั้นแล้ว ใช้วิจารณญาณกันเอาเองว่า ควรจะซื้อมาเล่นตอนนี้ หรือ รอเกมมันสมบูรณ์ก่อน
รีวิวนี้เป็นความเห็นส่วนตัวล้วนๆ อาจจะมีด้านที่คนไม่เห็นด้วย หรือ หากผมผิดพลาดใดๆก็ขออภัย

แต่อย่างที่ผมได้กล่าวไว้ในบรรทัดที่2 ของรีวิวนี้ว่า..
[b]เกมนี้เป็นอีกเกมนึง ที่ผมกล้ารับประกันว่า "เกมนี้ดีจริงๆ"[/b]

26305205.review:
Surprisingly polished for a game that's still in early access. Combat is tight and challenging without being frustrating, rewarding quick reflexes and concentration, and the movement/parkour system is very satisfying despite its simplicity.

My main (and to be honest only) gripe is that this game is inundated with fetch quests. I was able to overlook how menial the quests were because of how fun the core gameplay loop is.

The characters are very likeable and charming, which I found to be a huge relief since a lot of JRPG inspired games tend to be swimming in unbelievably twee characters. Not the case here, and on more than one occasion I've found myself grinning and laughing along with the characters. Nothing too heavy going on, no black fringed edgelords stinking up the mood.

Picked it up for €15 and so far it's looking like being worth easily twice that.

26302440.review:
This game has something going for it but I'm not sure what,

CrossCode is a sort-of 'Hack n' Slash, Bullet Hell RPG' which coincidentally (story-wise) takes places inside a game of the same genre. However, fun gameplay aside it's story is questionable but enjoyable.

You play 'Lea', a blue-haired 'avatar' which is basically infiltrating an online videogame as a fake player. You're basically a sentient AI who's motive is unclear for the entire game. I wasn't sure what the whole point of the main character being in the game was and I was never told why. The game pulls the amnesia-card straight out of the hat with this story so your main character knows just as much as you do. However, the few people that do know your backstory don't speak up at all and rather take a backseat while occasionally talking. Immersion breaks after that unfortunately once you dive into an endless paradox of self-purpose but let's not get ahead of ourselves. 

Characters are a mix of fantastic but also quite mundane. Most of the time you're accompanied by a French Redheaded girl named Emilie who for the most part won't shutup and her only real use is 'To stop you from being a solo-player in a RPG'. There's also some green dude that I forgot the name of because he makes an appearance like twice and then you never see him again who has so much potential to be part of the plotline but it doesn't seem like it. He acts more like a rival from Pokemon than anything else.  There isn't much relation to the main-story and the ingame characters in that regard, the only 'real' character you keep in touch with that knows about your backstory doesn't say much aside from obvious advice such as 'Log off now you imbecile, you can't play for 24 hours, that's not human'. This entire scenario to put lightly comes to a screeching halt when we nearly get proper character development and then the game slaps you in the face and says "Hi, we haven't made this part yet! But you can still grind and do stuff to set you way over the level-cap for the next dungeon so that the game loses its challenge.' 

How am I still giving this game a positive review?
Because for the most part, it's fun. It's challenging and enjoyable to enough of an extend where I can recommend this game to people who like fast-paced gameplay. The gameplay/gunplay/whateverplay is amazing, borrowing a lot from 'Furi', dashing around, avoiding attacks and when getting into close-quarters it can seem chaotic. The puzzles are a mixture of difficult and relatively easy, a bunch of the Ice Temple's puzzles had me stumped up until the last one which was probably the easiest in the entire dungeon. But that's what got me hooked, the gameplay. Which is a damn shame because the story accompanying it has so many flaws but so many upsides it's hard to say whether it will live up to the gameplay and blossom into a great game or just trip and fall into the pit of forgotten games. 
For what it's worth, play it as it is right now. The game appears to be getting enough updates to sustain life and it's well worth your time.

26286082.review:
When I saw this game at first it stroke me as very ambitious. I hoped they will complete it, so I bought a copy. The world was a bit empty at first, but you could see all the things that will be there one day.

I came back for it a few versions later. And I was not dissappointed! Actually I was blown away by all the detail, the eagerness the developers put into it.

If you like Zelda, JRPGs or Retro games of the mid-early console era (90s-00s) this is totally for you!
Probably also if you just like action-adventure in general.

Additionally to having solid and great gameplay the awesome music and art design gives you this typical feeling of modern nostalgia. ^^

Get it and support the great devs.

For detailed info about the Gameplay just check out the demo or read one of the well written reviews down here :)

26237717.review:
Alright, alright... where to begin this review...

[h1]CrossCode, an Indie, Early Access title (as of now), is a great game.[/h1]
...no, the Review doesn't end there yet, hang on for a bit more.

Well of course anyone can say a Game is good or bad, but saying [b][i]why[/i][/b] the game is good depending on my own opinion is what matters here.

As previously mentioned, I'm in love with the Game, even without playing it to its full extent, even though it is unfinished.
And about that, honestly, the game feels like it is finished until you see that small reminder after 12 hours of gameplay "Yo, the story ends here cause Early Access you know, you can still continue through content though, glhf" that makes you feel bad because you really want to continue to learn more about the Story of the Game, which is really well written.

[b]Now onto Combat and other Gameplay elements.[/b]

Good lord, I never had so much fun fighting enemies in a game in a long time. No enemy feels like its a trash mob, unless youre 5 levels above that poor little creature, because then you're likely oneshotting it anyway. There's a relatively well structured vendor system aswell, that rewards you with items that don't just boost your basic stats, but enable you to customize Lea (that's the protagonist's name, duh) to your playsytle. Want hardhitting crit balls? There you have them. Want to take like 0 damage when blocking and reflect damage to enemies? You can do just that! 
(Disclaimer: said strategies are not guaranteed to work throughout the progress of the Game) The Riddles and Puzzles are great and are a lot of fun, and if you're not a fan of those, too bad, you're missing out on some good Leveldesign there.

[b]Moving on to the Characters and Music.[/b]

Two words, Eargasm and Eyegasm.
The soundtracks are awesome, fitting and don't get too repetitive or boring while you're playing,
Characters have really unique characteristics to them, which makes them very enjoyable. (I'm not looking at Apollo or anything.) Also, I think it's mentionable that every single Pixel the devs put onto your screen is blessed, because everything just looks so good, even with those little colored squares being visible. Animations are smooth and very enjoyable (also oddly satisfying sometimes.) And don't get me started with the title screen, that smooth animation had me hooked for a good 2 minutes of appreciation.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Is this game worth 20 bucks? For you? Probably. For me? Oh hell yes.
Does the game offer you quality gameplay? Hells yeah.
Do the devs deserve your money? Uhh... that's likely?

Basically, if you like RPGs and can appreciate details in a game, this is [b]the[/b] game for you.
I can assure you that CrossCode is worth the time you put into it.
